" Confound it , [sir]2360-sir , do n't stay arguing , but go and order [my]531-the squire horse , "[531-the squire] said [the Squire]531-the squire , taking up a pipe . [Godfrey]66-godfrey left [the room]611-the room , hardly knowing whether [he]66-godfrey were more relieved by the sense that the interview was ended without having made any change in [his]66-godfrey position , or more uneasy that [he]66-godfrey had entangled [himself]66-godfrey still further in prevarication and deceit . What had passed about [his]66-godfrey proposing to [Nancy]67-nancy had raised a new alarm , lest by some after - dinner words of [[his]66-godfrey father]592-his father 's to [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter [he]66-godfrey should be thrown into the embarrassment of being obliged absolutely to decline [her]67-nancy when [she]67-nancy seemed to be within [his]66-godfrey reach . [He]66-godfrey fled to [his]66-godfrey usual refuge , that of hoping for some unforeseen turn of fortune , some favourable chance which would save [him]66-godfrey from unpleasant consequences — perhaps even justify [his]66-godfrey insincerity by manifesting its prudence . And in this point of trusting to some throw of fortune 's dice , [Godfrey]66-godfrey can hardly be called specially old - fashioned . Favourable Chance , [I]0-i fancy , is [the god of all men who follow [their]1051-their own devices instead of obeying a law [they]1051-their believe in]1050-the god of all men who follow their own devices instead of obeying a law they believe in . Let even [a polished man of these days]1052-a polished man of these days get into a position [he]1052-a polished man of these days is ashamed to avow , and [his]1052-a polished man of these days mind will be bent on all the possible issues that may deliver [him]1052-a polished man of these days from the calculable results of that position . Let [him]1052-a polished man of these days live outside [his]1052-a polished man of these days income , or shirk the resolute honest work that brings wages , and [he]1052-a polished man of these days will presently find [himself]1052-a polished man of these days dreaming of [a possible benefactor]1053-a possible benefactor , [a possible simpleton who may be cajoled into using [his]1052-a polished man of these days interest]1054-a possible simpleton who may be cajoled into using his interest , a possible state of mind in [some possible person not yet forthcoming]1055-some possible person not yet forthcoming . Let [him]1052-a polished man of these days neglect the responsibilities of [[his]1052-a polished man of these days office]1056-his office , and [he]1052-a polished man of these days will inevitably anchor [himself]1052-a polished man of these days on the chance , that the thing left undone may turn out not to be of the supposed importance . Let [him]1052-a polished man of these days betray [[his]1052-a polished man of these days friend]312-his friend 's confidence , and [he]1052-a polished man of these days will adore that same cunning complexity called [Chance]110-chance , which gives [him]1052-a polished man of these days the hope that [[his]1052-a polished man of these days friend]312-his friend will never know ; let [him]1052-a polished man of these days forsake a decent craft that [he]1052-a polished man of these days may pursue the gentilities of a profession to which nature never called [him]1052-a polished man of these days , and [his]1052-a polished man of these days religion will infallibly be the worship of [blessed Chance]110-chance , which [he]1052-a polished man of these days will believe in as the mighty creator of success . The evil principle deprecated in that religion , is the orderly sequence by which the seed brings forth a crop after its kind . [Justice Malam]101-justice malam was naturally regarded in [Tarley]6-tarley and [Raveloe]1-raveloe as [a man of capacious mind]1059-a man of capacious mind , seeing that [he]101-justice malam could draw much wider conclusions without evidence than could be expected of [[his]101-justice malam neighbours who were not on [the Commission of the Peace]1061-the commission of the peace]1060-his neighbours who were not on the commission of the peace . [Such a man]1062-such a man was not likely to neglect the clue of the tinder - box , and an inquiry was set on foot concerning [a pedlar , name unknown , with curly black hair and a foreign complexion]1063-a pedlar , name unknown , with curly black hair and a foreign complexion , carrying a box of cutlery and jewellery , and wearing large rings in [his]1063-a pedlar , name unknown , with curly black hair and a foreign complexion ears . But either because inquiry was too slow - footed to overtake [him]1063-a pedlar , name unknown , with curly black hair and a foreign complexion , or because the description applied to so many [pedlars]1064-pedlars that inquiry did not know how to choose among [them]1064-pedlars , weeks passed away , and there was no other result concerning the robbery than a gradual cessation of the excitement it had caused in [Raveloe]1-raveloe . [Dunstan Cass]63-dunstan 's absence was hardly a subject of remark : [he]63-dunstan had once before had a quarrel with [[his]63-dunstan father]592-his father , and had gone off , [nobody]444-nobody knew whither , to return at the end of six weeks , take up [[his]63-dunstan old quarters]1067-his old quarters unforbidden , and swagger as usual . [[His]63-dunstan own family]1068-his own family , who equally expected this issue , with the sole difference that [the Squire]531-the squire was determined this time to forbid [him]63-dunstan [the old quarters]1070-the old quarters , never mentioned [his]63-dunstan absence ; and when [[his]63-dunstan uncle]1071-his uncle [Kimble]54-kimble or [Mr Osgood]59-mr osgood noticed it , the story of [his]63-dunstan having killed Wildfire , and committed some offence against [[his]63-dunstan father]592-his father , was enough to prevent surprise . To connect the fact of [Dunsey]104-dunsey 's disappearance with that of the robbery occurring on the same day , lay quite away from the track of [every one]365-every one 's thought — even [[Godfrey]66-godfrey 's , who had better reason than [any one else]1075-any one else to know what [[his]63-dunstan brother]555-his brother was capable of]1074-godfrey 's , who had better reason than any one else to know what his brother was capable of . [He]63-dunstan remembered no mention of the weaver between [them]1077-their since the time , twelve years ago , when it was [their]1077-their boyish sport to deride [him]63-dunstan ; and , besides , [his]63-dunstan imagination constantly created an alibi for [Dunstan]63-dunstan : [he]63-dunstan saw [him]63-dunstan continually in some congenial haunt , to which [he]63-dunstan had walked off on leaving Wildfire — saw [him]63-dunstan sponging on [chance acquaintances]1078-chance acquaintances , and meditating a return [home]374-home to the old amusement of tormenting [[his]63-dunstan elder brother]1080-his elder brother . Even if any brain in [Raveloe]1-raveloe had put the said two facts together , [I]0-i doubt whether a combination so injurious to the prescriptive respectability of [a family with a mural monument and venerable tankards]1081-a family with a mural monument and venerable tankards , would not have been suppressed as of unsound tendency . But Christmas puddings , brawn , and abundance of spirituous liquors , throwing the mental originality into the channel of nightmare , are great preservatives against a dangerous spontaneity of waking thought . When the robbery was talked of at [the Rainbow]741-the rainbow and elsewhere , in good company , the balance continued to waver between the rational explanation founded on the tinder - box , and the theory of an impenetrable mystery that mocked investigation . [The advocates of the tinder - box - and - pedlar view]1083-the advocates of the tinder - box - and - pedlar view considered the other side a muddle - headed and credulous set , who , because [they]1077-their [themselves]1077-their were wall - eyed , supposed [everybody else to have the same blank outlook]1084-everybody else to have the same blank outlook ; and the adherents of the inexplicable , more than hinted that [[their]1077-their antagonists]1085-their antagonists were animals inclined to crow before [they]1077-their had found any corn — mere skimming - dishes in point of depth — whose clear - sightedness consisted in supposing there was nothing behind a barn - door because [they]1077-their could n't see through it ; so that , though [their]1077-their controversy did not serve to elicit the fact concerning the robbery , it elicited some true opinions of collateral importance . But while [poor Silas]38-silas 's loss served thus to brush the slow current of [Raveloe]1-raveloe conversation , [Silas]38-silas [himself]38-silas was feeling the withering desolation of that bereavement , about which [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours were arguing at [their]435-his neighbours case . To [any one who had observed [him]38-silas before [he]38-silas lost [his]38-silas gold]1087-any one who had observed him before he lost his gold , it might have seemed that so withered and shrunken a life as [his]38-silas could hardly be susceptible of a bruise , could hardly endure any subtraction but such as would put an end to it altogether . But in reality it had been an eager life , filled with immediate purpose , which fenced [him]38-silas in from [the wide , cheerless unknown]1088-the wide , cheerless unknown . It had been a clinging life ; and though the object round which its fibres had clung was a dead disrupted thing , it satisfied the need for clinging . But now the fence was broken down — the support was snatched away . [Marner]38-silas 's thoughts could no longer move in their old round , and were baffled by a blank like that which meets a plodding ant when the earth has broken away on its homeward path . The loom was there , and the weaving , and the growing pattern in the cloth ; but the bright treasure in the hole under [his]38-silas feet was gone ; the prospect of handling and counting it was gone : the evening had no phantasm of delight to still [the poor soul]1089-the poor soul 's craving . The thought of the money [he]38-silas would get by [his]38-silas actual work could bring no joy , for its meagre image was only a fresh reminder of [his]38-silas loss ; and hope was too heavily crushed by the sudden blow for [his]38-silas imagination to dwell on the growth of a new hoard from that small beginning . [He]38-silas filled up the blank with grief . As [he]38-silas sat weaving , [he]38-silas every now and then moaned low , like one in pain : it was the sign that [his]38-silas thoughts had come round again to the sudden chasm — to the empty evening - time . And all the evening , as [he]38-silas sat in [his]38-silas loneliness by [his]38-silas dull fire , [he]38-silas leaned [his]38-silas elbows on [his]38-silas knees , and clasped [his]38-silas head with [his]38-silas hands , and moaned very low — not as [one who seeks to be heard]1090-one who seeks to be heard . And yet [he]38-silas was not utterly forsaken in [his]38-silas trouble . The repulsion [Marner]38-silas had always created in [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours was partly dissipated by the new light in which this misfortune had shown [him]38-silas . Instead of [a man who had more cunning than [honest folks]1093-honest folks could come by]1092-a man who had more cunning than honest folks could come by , and , what was worse , had not the inclination to use that cunning in a neighbourly way , it was now apparent that [Silas]38-silas had not cunning enough to keep [his]38-silas own . [He]38-silas was generally spoken of as [a " poor mushed creatur]2438-a " poor mushed creatur ; "[2438-a " poor mushed creatur] and that avoidance of [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours , which had before been referred to [his]38-silas ill - will , and to a probable addiction to worse company , was now considered mere craziness . This change to a kindlier feeling was shown in various ways . The odour of Christmas cooking being on the wind , it was the season when superfluous pork and black puddings are suggestive of charity in [well - to - do families]1095-well - to - do families ; and [Silas]38-silas 's misfortune had brought [him]38-silas uppermost in the memory of housekeepers like [Mrs Osgood]52-mrs osgood . [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp , too , while [he]86-mr crackenthorp admonished [Silas]38-silas that [his]86-mr crackenthorp money had probably been taken from [him]86-mr crackenthorp because [he]86-mr crackenthorp thought too much of it , and never came to [church]363-church , enforced the doctrine by a present of [pigs]1097-pigs ' pettitoes , well calculated to dissipate unfounded prejudices against the clerical character . [Neighbours , who had nothing but verbal consolation to give]1098-neighbours , who had nothing but verbal consolation to give , showed a disposition not only to greet [Silas]38-silas , and discuss [his]38-silas misfortune at some length when [they]1098-neighbours , who had nothing but verbal consolation to give encountered [him]38-silas in [the village]247-the village ; but also to take the trouble of calling at [[his]38-silas cottage]458-his cottage , and getting [him]38-silas to repeat all the details on the very spot ; and then [they]1098-neighbours , who had nothing but verbal consolation to give would try to cheer [him]38-silas by saying , " Well , [Master Marner]42-master marner , [you]38-silas 're no worse off nor [other poor folks]2439-other poor folks , after all ; and if [you]38-silas was to be crippled , [the parish]262-the parish ' ud give [you]38-silas a ' lowance . "[1098-neighbours , who had nothing but verbal consolation to give] [I]0-i suppose one reason why [we]1101-our are seldom able to comfort [[our]1101-our neighbours]1102-our neighbours with [our]1101-our words is , that [our]1101-our goodwill gets adulterated , in spite of [ourselves]1101-our , before it can pass [our]1101-our lips . [We]1101-our can send black puddings and pettitoes without giving [them]1103-them a flavour of [our]1101-our own egoism ; but language is a stream that is almost sure to smack of a mingled soil . There was a fair proportion of kindness in [Raveloe]1-raveloe ; but it was often of a beery and bungling sort , and took the shape least allied to the complimentary and hypocritical . [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , for example , coming one evening expressly to let [Silas]38-silas know that recent events had given [him]41-mr macey the advantage of standing more favourably in the opinion of [a man whose judgment was not formed lightly]1104-a man whose judgment was not formed lightly , opened the conversation by saying , as soon as [he]41-mr macey had seated [himself]41-mr macey and adjusted [his]41-mr macey thumbs — " Come , [Master Marner]42-master marner , why , [you]42-master marner 've no call to sit a - moaning . [You]42-master marner 're a deal better off to [ha]2441-ha ' lost [your]42-master marner money , nor to ha ' kep it by foul means . [I]41-mr macey used to think , when [you]42-master marner first come into [these parts]2117-these parts , as [you]42-master marner were no better nor [you]42-master marner should be ; [you]42-master marner were younger a deal than what [you]42-master marner are now ; but [you]42-master marner were allays [a staring , white - faced creatur]2443-a staring , white - faced creatur , partly like a bald - faced calf , as [I]41-mr macey may say . But there 's no knowing : it is n't every queer - looksed thing as [Old Harry]96-old harry 's had the making of — [I]41-mr macey mean , speaking o ' toads and such ; for [they]2117-these parts 're often harmless , like , and useful against varmin . And it 's pretty much the same wi ' [you]42-master marner , as fur as [I]41-mr macey can see . Though as to the yarbs and stuff to cure the breathing , if [you]42-master marner brought that sort o ' knowledge from [distant parts]193-distant parts , [you]42-master marner might ha ' been a bit freer of it . And if the knowledge was n't well come by , why , [you]42-master marner might ha ' made up for it by coming to [church reg'lar]2445-church reg'lar ; for , as for [the children]482-the children as [the Wise Woman]449-the wise woman charmed , [I]41-mr macey 've been at the christening of ['em]2448-'em again and again , and [they]482-the children took the water just as well . And that 's reasonable ; for if [Old Harry]96-old harry 's a mind to do a bit o ' kindness for a holiday , like , who 's got anything against it ? That 's [my]41-mr macey thinking ; and [I]41-mr macey 've been [clerk o ' [this parish]2450-this parish]2449-clerk o ' this parish forty year , and [I]41-mr macey know , when [the parson]273-the parson and [me]41-mr macey does the cussing of a Ash - Wednesday , there 's no cussing o ' [folks]214-folks as have a mind to be cured without [a doctor]2329-a doctor , let [Kimble]54-kimble say what [he]2329-a doctor will . And so , [Master Marner]42-master marner , as [I]41-mr macey was saying — for there 's windings [i]41-mr macey ' things as [they]482-the children may carry [you]42-master marner to the fur end o ' the prayer - book afore [you]42-master marner get back to ['em]2448-'em — [my]41-mr macey advice is , as [you]42-master marner keep up [your]42-master marner sperrits ; for as for thinking [you]42-master marner 're [a deep un]2454-a deep un , and ha ' got more inside [you]42-master marner nor ' ull bear daylight , [I]41-mr macey 'm not o ' that opinion at all , and so [I]41-mr macey tell [the neighbours]285-the neighbours . For , says [I]41-mr macey , [you]42-master marner talk o ' [Master Marner]42-master marner making out a tale — why , its nonsense , that is : it ' ud take [a ' cute man]2208-a ' cute man to make a tale like that ; and , says [I]41-mr macey , [he]42-master marner looked as scared as a rabbit . "[41-mr macey] During this discursive address [Silas]38-silas had continued motionless in [his]38-silas previous attitude , leaning [his]38-silas elbows on [his]38-silas knees , and pressing [his]38-silas hands against [his]38-silas head . [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , not doubting that [he]41-mr macey had been listened to , paused , in the expectation of some appreciatory reply , but [Marner]38-silas remained silent . [He]38-silas had a sense that [the old man]330-the old man meant to be good - natured and neighbourly ; but the kindness fell on [him]38-silas as sunshine falls on the wretched — [he]38-silas had no heart to taste it , and felt that it was very far off [him]38-silas . " Come , [Master Marner]42-master marner , have [you]38-silas got nothing to say to that ? "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey at last , with a slight accent of impatience . " Oh , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , slowly , shaking [his]38-silas head between [his]38-silas hands , " [I]38-silas thank [you]41-mr macey — thank [you]41-mr macey — kindly . "[38-silas] " Ay , ay , to be sure : [I]41-mr macey thought [you]38-silas would , "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey ; " and [my]41-mr macey advice is — have [you]38-silas got a Sunday suit ? "[41-mr macey] " No , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas . " [I]41-mr macey doubted it was so , "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey . " Now , let [me]41-mr macey advise [you]38-silas to get a Sunday suit : there 's [Tookey]84-tookey , [he]84-tookey 's [a poor creatur]2457-a poor creatur , but [he]84-tookey 's got [my]41-mr macey tailoring business , and some o ' [my]41-mr macey money in it , and [he]84-tookey shall make a suit at a low price , and give [you]38-silas trust , and then [you]38-silas can come to [church]363-church , and be a bit neighbourly . Why [you]38-silas 've never heared [me]41-mr macey say ' Amen ' since [you]38-silas come into [these parts]2117-these parts , and [I]41-mr macey recommend [you]38-silas to lose no time , for it 'll be poor work when [Tookey]84-tookey has it all to [himself]84-tookey , for [I]41-mr macey may n't be equil to stand [i]41-mr macey ' the desk at all , come another winter . "[41-mr macey] Here [Mr Macey]41-mr macey paused , perhaps expecting some sign of emotion in [[his]41-mr macey hearer]631-his hearer ; but not observing any , [he]41-mr macey went on . " And as for the money for the suit o ' clothes , why , [you]38-silas get a matter of a pound a - week at [[your]38-silas weaving]2460-your weaving , [Master Marner]42-master marner , and [you]38-silas 're [a young man]2461-a young man , eh , for all [you]38-silas look so mushed . Why , [you]38-silas could n't [ha]2462-ha ' been five - and - twenty when [you]38-silas come into [these parts]2117-these parts , eh ? "[41-mr macey] [Silas]38-silas started a little at the change to a questioning tone , and answered mildly , " [I]38-silas do n't know ; [I]38-silas ca n't rightly say — it 's a long while since . "[38-silas] After receiving such an answer as this , it is not surprising that [Mr Macey]41-mr macey observed , later on in the evening at [the Rainbow]4-the rainbow , that [Marner]38-silas 's head was " all of a muddle , "[38-silas] and that it was to be doubted if [he]38-silas ever knew when Sunday came round , which showed [him]38-silas a worse heathen than many a dog . Another of [Silas]38-silas 's comforters , besides [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , came to [him]41-mr macey with a mind highly charged on the same topic . This was [Mrs Winthrop]111-mrs winthrop , [[the wheelwright]1107-the wheelwright 's wife]1108-the wheelwright 's wife . [The inhabitants of [Raveloe]1-raveloe]1109-the inhabitants of raveloe were not severely regular in [their]1109-the inhabitants of raveloe church - going , and perhaps there was hardly [a person in the parish who would not have held that to go to church every Sunday in the calendar]1110-a person in the parish who would not have held that to go to church every sunday in the calendar would have shown a greedy desire to stand well with [Heaven]112-heaven , and get an undue advantage over [[their]1109-the inhabitants of raveloe neighbours]272-their neighbours — a wish to be better than the " common run , "[112-heaven] that would have implied a reflection on [those who had had [godfathers]1113-godfathers and [godmothers]1114-godmothers as well as [themselves]1112-those who had had godfathers and godmothers as well as themselves and had an equal right to the burying - service and had an equal right to the burying - service]1112-those who had had godfathers and godmothers as well as themselves and had an equal right to the burying - service . At the same time , it was understood to be requisite for [all who were not [household servants]1116-household servants , or [young men]2396-young men]1115-all who were not household servants , or young men , to take the sacrament at one of the great festivals : [Squire Cass]58-squire cass [himself]58-squire cass took it on Christmas - day ; while [those who were held to be " good livers "]2464-those who were held to be " good livers "[111-mrs winthrop] went to [church]363-church with greater , though still with moderate frequency . [Mrs Winthrop]111-mrs winthrop was one of these : [she]111-mrs winthrop was in all respects [a woman of scrupulous conscience , so eager for duties , that life]1119-a woman of scrupulous conscience , so eager for duties , that life seemed to offer them too scantily unless [she]111-mrs winthrop rose at half - past four , though this threw a scarcity of work over the more advanced hours of the morning , which it was a constant problem with [her]111-mrs winthrop to remove . Yet [she]111-mrs winthrop had not the vixenish temper which is sometimes supposed to be a necessary condition of such habits : [she]111-mrs winthrop was [a very mild , patient woman , whose nature it was to seek out all the sadder and more serious elements of life]1120-a very mild , patient woman , whose nature it was to seek out all the sadder and more serious elements of life , and pasture [her]111-mrs winthrop mind upon [them]1121-them . [She]111-mrs winthrop was [the person always first thought of in [Raveloe]1-raveloe when there was illness or death in [a family]1123-a family , when leeches were to be applied , or there was a sudden disappointment in [a monthly nurse]1124-a monthly nurse]1122-the person always first thought of in raveloe when there was illness or death in a family , when leeches were to be applied , or there was a sudden disappointment in a monthly nurse . [She]111-mrs winthrop was [a " comfortable woman"—good[111-mrs winthrop] - looking , fresh - complexioned , having [her]111-mrs winthrop lips always slightly screwed , as if [she]111-mrs winthrop felt [herself]111-mrs winthrop in [a sickroom]1126-a sickroom with [the doctor]216-the doctor or [the clergyman present]1128-the clergyman present]1125-a " comfortable woman"—good - looking , fresh - complexioned , having her lips always slightly screwed , as if she felt herself in a sickroom with the doctor or the clergyman present . But [she]111-mrs winthrop was never whimpering ; [no one]182-no one had seen [her]111-mrs winthrop shed tears ; [she]111-mrs winthrop was simply grave and inclined to shake [her]111-mrs winthrop head and sigh , almost imperceptibly , like [a funereal mourner who is not a relation]1130-a funereal mourner who is not a relation . It seemed surprising that [Ben Winthrop]87-ben winthrop , who loved [his]87-ben winthrop quart - pot and [his]87-ben winthrop joke , got along so well with [Dolly]113-dolly ; but [she]111-mrs winthrop took [[her]111-mrs winthrop husband]2414-her husband 's jokes and joviality as patiently as everything else , considering that " [men]372-men would be so , "[111-mrs winthrop] and viewing the stronger sex in the light of animals whom it had pleased [Heaven]112-heaven to make naturally troublesome , like bulls and turkey - cocks . [This good wholesome woman]1132-this good wholesome woman could hardly fail to have [her]1132-this good wholesome woman mind drawn strongly towards [Silas Marner]38-silas , now that [he]38-silas appeared in the light of [a sufferer]1133-a sufferer ; and one Sunday afternoon [she]111-mrs winthrop took [[her]111-mrs winthrop little boy]1134-her little boy [Aaron]89-aaron with [her]111-mrs winthrop , and went to call on [Silas]38-silas , carrying in [her]111-mrs winthrop hand some small lard - cakes , flat paste - like articles , much esteemed in [Raveloe]1-raveloe . [Aaron]89-aaron , [an apple - cheeked youngster of seven]1135-an apple - cheeked youngster of seven , with a clean starched frill , which looked like a plate for the apples , needed all [his]89-aaron adventurous curiosity to embolden [him]89-aaron against the possibility that [the big - eyed weaver]1136-the big - eyed weaver might do [him]89-aaron some bodily injury ; and [his]89-aaron dubiety was much increased when , on arriving at [the Stone - pits]658-the stone - pits , [they]1138-they heard the mysterious sound of the loom . " Ah , it is as [I]111-mrs winthrop thought , "[111-mrs winthrop] said [Mrs Winthrop]111-mrs winthrop , sadly . [They]1138-they had to knock loudly before [Silas]38-silas heard [them]1138-they ; but when [he]38-silas did come to the door , [he]38-silas showed no impatience , as [he]38-silas would once have done , at a visit that had been unasked for and unexpected . Formerly , [his]38-silas heart had been as a locked casket with its treasure inside ; but now the casket was empty , and the lock was broken . Left groping in darkness , with [his]38-silas prop utterly gone , [Silas]38-silas had inevitably a sense , though a dull and half - despairing one , that if any help came to [him]38-silas it must come from without ; and there was a slight stirring of expectation at the sight of [[his]38-silas fellow - men]1139-his fellow - men , a faint consciousness of dependence on [their]1139-his fellow - men goodwill . [He]38-silas opened the door wide to admit [Dolly]113-dolly , but without otherwise returning [her]113-dolly greeting than by moving the armchair a few inches as a sign that [she]113-dolly was to sit down in it . [Dolly]113-dolly , as soon as [she]113-dolly was seated , removed the white cloth that covered [her]113-dolly lard - cakes , and said in [her]113-dolly gravest way — " [I]113-dolly 'd a baking yisterday , [Master Marner]42-master marner , and the lard - cakes turned out better nor common , and [I]113-dolly 'd ha ' asked [you]38-silas to accept some , if [you]38-silas 'd thought well . [I]113-dolly do n't eat such things [myself]113-dolly , for a bit o ' bread 's what [I]113-dolly like from one year 's end to the other ; but [men]372-men 's stomichs are made so comical , [they]372-men want a change — [they]372-men do , [I]113-dolly know , [God]48-god help 'em . "[113-dolly] [Dolly]113-dolly sighed gently as [she]113-dolly held out the cakes to [Silas]38-silas , who thanked [her]113-dolly kindly , and looked very close at [them]1140-them , absently , being accustomed to look so at everything [he]38-silas took into [his]38-silas hand — eyed all the while by the wondering bright orbs of the small Aaron , who had made an outwork of [[his]38-silas mother]301-his mother 's chair , and was peeping round from behind it . " There 's letters pricked on 'em , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly . " [I]89-aaron ca n't read 'em [myself]89-aaron , and there 's [nobody]444-nobody , not [Mr Macey]41-mr macey [himself]41-mr macey , rightly knows what [they]1140-them mean ; but they 've a good meaning , for they 're the same as is on the pulpit - cloth at [church]363-church . What are they , [Aaron]89-aaron , [[my]89-aaron dear]2469-my dear ? "[89-aaron] [Aaron]89-aaron retreated completely behind [his]89-aaron outwork . " O go , that 's naughty , "[301-his mother] said [[his]38-silas mother]301-his mother , mildly . " Well , whativer the letters are , they 've a good meaning ; and it 's a stamp as has been in [[our]2470-we house]2471-our house , [Ben]87-ben winthrop says , ever since [he]87-ben winthrop was [a little un]2472-a little un , and [[his]87-ben winthrop mother]301-his mother used to put it on the cakes , and [I]301-his mother 've allays put it on too ; for if there 's any good , [we]2470-we 've need of it [i]301-his mother ' [this world]2474-this world . "[301-his mother] " It 's [I.]38-silas H. S. , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , at which proof of learning [Aaron]89-aaron peeped round the chair again . " Well , to be sure , [you]38-silas can read 'em off , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly . " [Ben]87-ben winthrop 's read 'em to [me]113-dolly many and many a time , but they slip out o ' [my]113-dolly mind again ; the more 's the pity , for they 're good letters , else [they]2475-they would n't be in [the church]322-the church ; and so [I]113-dolly prick 'em on all the loaves and all the cakes , though sometimes they wo n't hold , because o ' the rising — for , as [I]113-dolly said , if there 's any good to be got , [we]2470-we 've need on it [i]113-dolly ' [this world]2474-this world — that [we]2470-we have ; and [I]113-dolly hope [they]2475-they 'll bring good to [you]38-silas , [Master Marner]42-master marner , for it 's wi ' that will [I]113-dolly brought [you]38-silas the cakes ; and [you]38-silas see the letters have held better nor common . "[113-dolly] [Silas]38-silas was as unable to interpret the letters as [Dolly]113-dolly , but there was no possibility of misunderstanding the desire to give comfort that made itself heard in [her]113-dolly quiet tones . [He]38-silas said , with more feeling than before—"Thank [you]113-dolly — thank [you]113-dolly kindly . "[38-silas] But [he]38-silas laid down the cake and seated [himself]38-silas absently — drearily unconscious of any distinct benefit towards which the cake and the letters , or even [Dolly]113-dolly 's kindness , could tend for [him]38-silas . " Ah , if there 's good anywhere , [we]2478-we 've need of it , "[113-dolly] repeated [Dolly]113-dolly , who did not lightly forsake a serviceable phrase . [She]113-dolly looked at [Silas]38-silas pityingly as [she]113-dolly went on . " But [you]38-silas did n't hear the church - bells this morning , [Master Marner]42-master marner . [I]113-dolly doubt [you]38-silas did n't know it was Sunday . Living so lone here , [you]38-silas lose [your]38-silas count , [I]113-dolly daresay ; and then , when [your]38-silas loom makes a noise , [you]38-silas ca n't hear the bells , more partic'lar now the frost kills the sound . "[113-dolly] " Yes , [I]38-silas did ; [I]38-silas heard 'em , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , to whom Sunday bells were a mere accident of the day , and not part of its sacredness . There had been no bells in [Lantern Yard]7-lantern yard . " [Dear heart]2479-dear heart ! "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , pausing before [she]113-dolly spoke again . " But what a pity it is [you]38-silas should work of a Sunday , and not clean [yourself]38-silas — if [you]38-silas did n't go to [church]363-church ; for if [you]38-silas 'd a roasting bit , it might be as [you]38-silas could n't leave it , being [a lone man]2481-a lone man . But there 's the bakehus , if [you]38-silas could make up [your]38-silas mind to spend a twopence on the oven now and then , — not every week , in course — [I]113-dolly should n't like to do that [myself,—you]38-silas might carry [your]38-silas bit o ' dinner there , for it 's nothing but right to have a bit o ' summat hot of a Sunday , and not to make it as [you]38-silas ca n't know [your]38-silas dinner from Saturday . But now , upo ' Christmas - day , this blessed Christmas as is ever coming , if [you]38-silas was to take [your]38-silas dinner to the bakehus , and go to [church]363-church , and see the holly and the yew , and hear the anthim , and then take the sacramen ' , [you]38-silas 'd be a deal the better , and [you]38-silas 'd know which end [you]38-silas stood on , and [you]38-silas could put [your]38-silas trust [i]113-dolly ' [Them]2483-them as knows better nor [we]2484-we do , seein ' [you]38-silas 'd ha ' done what it lies on [us]2484-we all to do . "[113-dolly] [Dolly]113-dolly 's exhortation , which was an unusually long effort of speech for [her]113-dolly , was uttered in the soothing persuasive tone with which [she]113-dolly would have tried to prevail on [a sick man]1143-a sick man to take [his]1143-a sick man medicine , or a basin of gruel for which [he]1143-a sick man had no appetite . [Silas]38-silas had never before been closely urged on the point of [his]38-silas absence from [church]363-church , which had only been thought of as a part of [his]38-silas general queerness ; and [he]38-silas was too direct and simple to evade [Dolly]113-dolly 's appeal . " Nay , nay , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas said , " [I]38-silas know nothing o ' [church]363-church . [I]38-silas 've never been to [church]363-church . "[38-silas] " No ! "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , in a low tone of wonderment . Then bethinking [herself]113-dolly of [Silas]38-silas 's advent from [an unknown country]1145-an unknown country , [she]113-dolly said , " Could it ha ' been as [they]2487-they 'd [no church where [you]38-silas was born]2488-no church where you was born ? "[113-dolly] " O yes , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , meditatively , sitting in [his]38-silas usual posture of leaning on [his]38-silas knees , and supporting [his]38-silas head . " There was [churches]2489-churches — [a many]2490-a many — [it]2491-it was [a big town]2492-a big town . But [I]113-dolly knew nothing of 'em — [I]113-dolly went to [chapel]2493-chapel . "[113-dolly] [Dolly]113-dolly was much puzzled at this new word , but [she]113-dolly was rather afraid of inquiring further , lest " [chapel]2493-chapel "[113-dolly] might mean some haunt of wickedness . After a little thought , [she]113-dolly said — " Well , [Master Marner]42-master marner , it 's niver too late to turn over a new leaf , and if [you]42-master marner 've niver had [no church]2495-no church , there 's no telling the good it 'll do [you]42-master marner . For [I]113-dolly feel so set up and comfortable as niver was , when [I]113-dolly 've been and heard the prayers , and the singing to the praise and glory o ' [God]48-god , as [Mr Macey]41-mr macey gives out — and [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp saying good words , and more partic'lar on Sacramen ' Day ; and if a bit o ' trouble comes , [I]113-dolly feel as [I]113-dolly can put up wi'it , for [I]113-dolly 've looked for help [i]113-dolly ' [the right quarter]2496-the right quarter , and gev [myself]113-dolly up to [Them]2497-them as [we]2498-we must all give [ourselves]2498-we up to at the last ; and if [we'n]2498-we done [our]2498-we part , it is n't to be believed as [Them]2497-them as are above [us]2498-we ' ull be worse nor [we]2498-we are , and come short o ' Theirn . "[113-dolly] [Poor Dolly]113-dolly 's exposition of [her]113-dolly simple Raveloe theology fell rather unmeaningly on [Silas]38-silas 's ears , for there was no word in it that could rouse a memory of what [he]38-silas had known as religion , and [his]38-silas comprehension was quite baffled by the plural pronoun , which was no heresy of [Dolly]113-dolly 's , but only [her]113-dolly way of avoiding a presumptuous familiarity . [He]38-silas remained silent , not feeling inclined to assent to the part of [Dolly]113-dolly 's speech which [he]38-silas fully understood — [her]113-dolly recommendation that [he]38-silas should go to [church]363-church . Indeed , [Silas]38-silas was so unaccustomed to talk beyond the brief questions and answers necessary for the transaction of [his]38-silas simple business , that words did not easily come to [him]38-silas without the urgency of a distinct purpose . But now , [little Aaron]89-aaron , having become used to [the weaver]209-the weaver 's awful presence , had advanced to [[his]89-aaron mother]301-his mother 's side , and [Silas]38-silas , seeming to notice [him]89-aaron for the first time , tried to return [Dolly]113-dolly 's signs of goodwill by offering [the lad]2228-the lad a bit of lard - cake . [Aaron]89-aaron shrank back a little , and rubbed [his]89-aaron head against [[his]89-aaron mother]301-his mother 's shoulder , but still thought the piece of cake worth the risk of putting [his]89-aaron hand out for it . " O , for shame , [Aaron]89-aaron , "[301-his mother] said [[his]89-aaron mother]301-his mother , taking [him]89-aaron on [her]301-his mother lap , however ; " why , [you]89-aaron do n't want cake again yet awhile . [He]89-aaron 's wonderful hearty , "[301-his mother] [she]301-his mother went on , with a little sigh—"that [he]89-aaron is , [God]48-god knows . [He]89-aaron 's [[my]301-his mother youngest]2499-my youngest , and [we]2500-we spoil [him]89-aaron sadly , for either [me]301-his mother or [the father]2229-the father must allays [hev]89-aaron [him]89-aaron in [our]2500-we sight — that [we]2500-we must . "[301-his mother] [She]301-his mother stroked [Aaron]89-aaron 's brown head , and thought it must do [Master Marner]42-master marner good to see such a " pictur of [a child]2502-a child . "[301-his mother] But [Marner]38-silas , on the other side of the hearth , saw the neat - featured rosy face as a mere dim round , with two dark spots in it . " And [he]89-aaron 's got a voice like a bird — [you]89-aaron would n't think , "[113-dolly] [Dolly]113-dolly went on ; " [he]89-aaron can sing a Christmas carril as [[his]89-aaron father]592-his father 's taught [him]89-aaron ; and [I]113-dolly take it for a token as [he]89-aaron 'll come to good , as [he]89-aaron can learn the good tunes so quick . Come , [Aaron]89-aaron , stan ' up and sing the carril to [Master Marner]42-master marner , come . "[113-dolly] [Aaron]89-aaron replied by rubbing [his]89-aaron forehead against [[his]89-aaron mother]301-his mother 's shoulder . " O , that 's naughty , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , gently . " Stan'up , when [mother]189-mother tells [you]89-aaron , and let [me]113-dolly hold the cake till [you]89-aaron 've done . "[113-dolly] [Aaron]89-aaron was not indisposed to display [his]89-aaron talents , even to [an ogre]1153-an ogre , under protecting circumstances ; and after a few more signs of coyness , consisting chiefly in rubbing the backs of [his]89-aaron hands over [his]89-aaron eyes , and then peeping between them at [Master Marner]42-master marner , to see if [he]89-aaron looked anxious for the " carril , "[89-aaron] [he]89-aaron at length allowed [his]89-aaron head to be duly adjusted , and standing behind the table , which let [him]89-aaron appear above it only as far as [his]89-aaron broad frill , so that [he]89-aaron looked like a cherubic head untroubled with a body , [he]89-aaron began with a clear chirp , and in a melody that had the rhythm of an industrious hammer , — " God rest [you]89-aaron merry , [gentlemen]2505-gentlemen , Let nothing [you]89-aaron dismay , For [Jesus Christ]114-jesus christ [[our]2506-our Saviour]2507-our saviour Was born on Christmas - day . "[89-aaron] [Dolly]113-dolly listened with a devout look , glancing at [Marner]38-silas in some confidence that this strain would help to allure [him]38-silas to [church]363-church . " That 's Christmas music , "[113-dolly] [she]113-dolly said , when [Aaron]89-aaron had ended , and had secured [his]89-aaron piece of cake again . " There 's no other music equil to the Christmas music—'Hark [the erol angils]2508-the erol angils sing . ' And [you]38-silas may judge what it is at [church]363-church , [Master Marner]42-master marner , with the bassoon and the voices , as [you]38-silas ca n't help thinking [you]38-silas 've got to a better place a'ready — for [I]113-dolly would n't speak ill o ' [this world]2474-this world , seeing as [Them]2508-the erol angils put [us]2511-us in it as knows best ; but what wi ' the drink , and the quarrelling , and the bad illnesses , and the hard dying , as [I]113-dolly 've seen times and times , [one]2512-one 's thankful to hear of a better . [The boy]2513-the boy sings pretty , do n't [he]2513-the boy , [Master Marner]42-master marner ? "[113-dolly] " Yes , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , absently , " very pretty . "[38-silas] The Christmas carol , with its hammer - like rhythm , had fallen on [his]89-aaron ears as strange music , quite unlike a hymn , and could have none of the effect [Dolly]113-dolly contemplated . But [he]89-aaron wanted to show [her]113-dolly that [he]89-aaron was grateful , and the only mode that occurred to [him]89-aaron was to offer [Aaron]89-aaron a bit more cake . " O , no , thank [you]89-aaron , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , holding down [Aaron]89-aaron 's willing hands . " [We]2511-us must be going [home]374-home now . And so [I]38-silas wish [you]89-aaron good - by , [Master Marner]42-master marner ; and if [you]89-aaron ever feel anyways bad in [your]89-aaron inside , as [you]89-aaron ca n't fend for [yourself]89-aaron , [I]38-silas 'll come and clean up for [you]89-aaron , and get [you]89-aaron a bit o ' victual , and willing . But [I]38-silas beg and pray of [you]89-aaron to leave off weaving of [a Sunday]2515-a sunday , for it 's bad for soul and body — and the money as comes [i]38-silas ' that way'ull be a bad bed to lie down on at the last , if it does n't fly away , [nobody]444-nobody knows where , like the white frost . And [you]89-aaron 'll excuse [me]38-silas being that free with [you]89-aaron , [Master Marner]42-master marner , for [I]38-silas wish [you]89-aaron well — [I]38-silas do . Make [your]89-aaron bow , [Aaron]89-aaron . "[38-silas] [Silas]38-silas said " Good - by , and thank [you]113-dolly , kindly , "[38-silas] as [he]38-silas opened the door for [Dolly]113-dolly , but [he]38-silas could n't help feeling relieved when [she]113-dolly was gone — relieved that [he]38-silas might weave again and moan at [his]38-silas case . [Her]113-dolly simple view of life and its comforts , by which [she]113-dolly had tried to cheer [him]38-silas , was only like a report of unknown objects , which [his]38-silas imagination could not fashion . The fountains of human love and divine faith had not yet been unlocked , and [his]38-silas soul was still the shrunken rivulet , with only this difference , that its little groove of sand was blocked up , and it wandered confusedly against dark obstruction . And so , notwithstanding the honest persuasions of [Mr Macey]41-mr macey and [Dolly Winthrop]113-dolly , [Silas]38-silas spent [his]38-silas Christmas - day in loneliness , eating [his]38-silas meat in sadness of heart , though the meat had come to [him]38-silas as a neighbourly present . In the morning [he]38-silas looked out on the black frost that seemed to press cruelly on every blade of grass , while the half - icy red pool shivered under the bitter wind ; but towards evening the snow began to fall , and curtained from [him]38-silas even that dreary outlook , shutting [him]38-silas close up with [his]38-silas narrow grief . And [he]38-silas sat in [[his]38-silas robbed [home]374-home]1155-his robbed home through the livelong evening , not caring to close [his]38-silas shutters or lock [his]38-silas door , pressing [his]38-silas head between [his]38-silas hands and moaning , till the cold grasped [him]38-silas and told [him]38-silas that [his]38-silas fire was grey . Nobody in [this world]2474-this world but [himself]38-silas knew that [he]38-silas was [the same [Silas Marner]38-silas who had once loved [[his]38-silas fellow]1159-his fellow with tender love , and trusted in an unseen goodness]1158-the same silas marner who had once loved his fellow with tender love , and trusted in an unseen goodness . Even to [himself]38-silas that past experience had become dim . But in [Raveloe village]1-raveloe the bells rang merrily , and [the church]322-the church was fuller than all through the rest of the year , with red faces among the abundant dark - green boughs — faces prepared for a longer service than usual by an odorous breakfast of toast and ale . Those green boughs , the hymn and anthem never heard but at Christmas — even the Athanasian Creed , which was discriminated from the others only as being longer and of exceptional virtue , since it was only read on rare occasions — brought a vague exulting sense , for which [the grown men]1161-the grown men could as little have found words as [the children]482-the children , that something great and mysterious had been done for [them]482-the children in [heaven above]1163-heaven above , and in [earth below]1164-earth below , which [they]482-the children were appropriating by [their]482-the children presence . And then the red faces made [their]482-the children way through the black biting frost to [[their]482-the children own homes]1165-their own homes , feeling [themselves]482-the children free for the rest of the day to eat , drink , and be merry , and using that Christian freedom without diffidence . At [Squire Cass]58-squire cass 's family party that day [nobody]444-nobody mentioned [Dunstan]63-dunstan — [nobody]444-nobody was sorry for [his]63-dunstan absence , or feared it would be too long . [The doctor]216-the doctor and [[his]216-the doctor wife]223-his wife , [uncle]1170-uncle and [aunt Kimble]54-kimble , were [there]2073-there , and the annual Christmas talk was carried through without any omissions , rising to the climax of [Mr Kimble]115-mr kimble 's experience when [he]115-mr kimble walked the [London]27-london hospitals thirty years back , together with striking professional anecdotes then gathered . [Whereupon]116-whereupon cards followed , with [aunt Kimble]115-mr kimble 's annual failure to follow suit , and [uncle Kimble]115-mr kimble 's irascibility concerning the odd trick which was rarely explicable to [him]115-mr kimble , when it was not on [his]115-mr kimble side , without a general visitation of tricks to see that they were formed on sound principles : the whole being accompanied by a strong steaming odour of spirits - and - water . But the party on Christmas - day , being a strictly family party , was not the pre - eminently brilliant celebration of the season at [the Red House]533-the red house . It was the great dance on New Year 's Eve that made the glory of [Squire Cass]58-squire cass 's hospitality , as of [[his]58-squire cass forefathers]1173-his forefathers ' , time out of mind . This was the occasion when [all the society of [Raveloe]1-raveloe and [Tarley]6-tarley]1174-all the society of raveloe and tarley , whether [old acquaintances separated by long rutty distances]1175-old acquaintances separated by long rutty distances , or [cooled acquaintances separated by misunderstandings concerning runaway calves]1176-cooled acquaintances separated by misunderstandings concerning runaway calves , or [acquaintances founded on intermittent condescension]1177-acquaintances founded on intermittent condescension , counted on meeting and on comporting [themselves]1174-all the society of raveloe and tarley with mutual appropriateness . This was the occasion on which [fair dames who came on pillions]1178-fair dames who came on pillions sent [their]1178-fair dames who came on pillions bandboxes before [them]1178-fair dames who came on pillions , supplied with more than [their]1178-fair dames who came on pillions evening costume ; for the feast was not to end with a single evening , like a paltry town entertainment , where the whole supply of eatables is put on the table at once , and bedding is scanty . [The Red House]533-the red house was provisioned as if for a siege ; and as for the spare feather - beds ready to be laid on floors , they were as plentiful as might naturally be expected in [a family that had killed its own geese for many generations]1180-a family that had killed its own geese for many generations . [Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey was looking forward to this New Year 's Eve with a foolish reckless longing , that made [him]66-godfrey half deaf to [[his]66-godfrey importunate companion]1181-his importunate companion , [Anxiety]117-anxiety . " [Dunsey]104-dunsey will be coming [home]374-home soon : there will be great blow - up , and how will [you]66-godfrey bribe [his]104-dunsey spite to silence ? "[117-anxiety] said [Anxiety]117-anxiety . " O , [he]104-dunsey wo n't come [home]374-home before New Year 's Eve , perhaps , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey ; " and [I]66-godfrey shall sit by [Nancy]67-nancy then , and dance with [her]67-nancy , and get a kind look from [her]67-nancy in spite of [herself]67-nancy . "[66-godfrey] " But money is wanted in another quarter , "[117-anxiety] said [Anxiety]117-anxiety , in a louder voice , " and how will [you]66-godfrey get it without selling [[your]66-godfrey mother]2519-your mother 's diamond pin ? And if [you]66-godfrey do n't get it . ... ? "[117-anxiety] " Well , but something may happen to make things easier . At any rate , there 's one pleasure for [me]66-godfrey close at hand : [Nancy]67-nancy is coming . "[66-godfrey] " Yes , and suppose [[your]66-godfrey father]2520-your father should bring matters to a pass that will oblige [you]66-godfrey to decline marrying [her]67-nancy — and to give [your]66-godfrey reasons ? "[66-godfrey] " Hold [your]66-godfrey tongue , and do n't worry [me]117-anxiety . [I]117-anxiety can see [Nancy]67-nancy 's eyes , just as [they]1182-some women will look at [me]117-anxiety , and feel [her]67-nancy hand in mine already . "[117-anxiety] But Anxiety went on , though in noisy Christmas company ; refusing to be utterly quieted even by much drinking . [Some women]1182-some women , [I]0-i grant , would not appear to advantage seated on [a pillion , and attired in a drab joseph and a drab beaver - bonnet]1183-a pillion , and attired in a drab joseph and a drab beaver - bonnet , with a crown resembling a small stew - pan ; for a garment suggesting [a coachman]1184-a coachman 's greatcoat , cut out under an axiguity of cloth that would only allow of miniature capes , is not well adapted to conceal deficiencies of contour , nor is drab a colour that will throw sallow cheeks into lively contrast . It was all the greater triumph to [Miss Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy 's beauty that [she]67-nancy looked thoroughly bewitching in that costume , as seated on the pillion behind [[her]67-nancy tall , erect father]1185-her tall , erect father , [she]67-nancy held one arm round [him]1185-her tall , erect father , and looked down , with open - eyed anxiety , at the treacherous snow - covered pools and puddles , which sent up formidable splashings of mud under the stamp of [Dobbin]118-dobbin 's foot . [A painter]1186-a painter would , perhaps , have preferred [her]67-nancy in those moments when [she]67-nancy was free from self - consciousness ; but certainly the bloom on [her]67-nancy cheeks was at its highest point of contrast with the surrounding drab when [she]67-nancy arrived at the door of [the Red House]533-the red house , and saw [Mr Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey ready to lift [her]67-nancy from the pillion . [She]67-nancy wished [[her]67-nancy sister]1188-her sister [Priscilla]80-priscilla had come up at the same time with [the servant]1189-the servant , for then [she]67-nancy would have contrived that [Mr Godfrey]66-godfrey should have lifted off [Priscilla]80-priscilla first , and , in the mean time , [she]67-nancy would have persuaded [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father to go round to the horseblock instead of alighting at the door - steps . It was very painful , when [you]1191-you had made it quite clear to [a young man]2461-a young man that [you]1191-you were determined not to marry [him]1190-her father , however much [he]1190-her father might wish it , that [he]1190-her father would still continue to pay [you]1191-you marked attentions ; besides , why did n't [he]1190-her father always show the same attentions , if [he]1190-her father meant them sincerely , instead of being so strange as [Mr Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey was , sometimes behaving as if [he]1190-her father did n't want to speak to [her]67-nancy , and taking no notice of [her]67-nancy for weeks and weeks , and then , all on a sudden , almost making love again ? Moreover , it was quite plain [he]1190-her father had no real love for [her]67-nancy , else [he]1190-her father would not let [people]387-people have that to say of [him]1190-her father which [they]387-people did say . Did [he]1190-her father suppose that [Miss Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy was to be won by [any man]2260-any man , [squire]506-squire or [no squire]1196-no squire , who led a bad life ? That was not what [she]67-nancy had been used to see in [[her]67-nancy own father]1197-her own father , who was [the soberest and best man in [that country - side]1199-that country - side]1198-the soberest and best man in that country - side , only a little hot and hasty now and then , if things were not done to the minute . All these thoughts rushed through [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's mind , in their habitual succession , in the moments between [her]67-nancy first sight of [Mr Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey standing at the door and [her]67-nancy own arrival there . Happily , [the Squire]531-the squire came out too , and gave a loud greeting to [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father , so that , somehow , under cover of this noise , [she]67-nancy seemed to find concealment for [her]67-nancy confusion and neglect of any suitably formal behaviour , while [she]67-nancy was being lifted from the pillion by strong arms , which seemed to find [her]67-nancy ridiculously small and light . And there was the best reason for hastening into [the house]334-the house at once , since the snow was beginning to fall again , threatening an unpleasant journey for [such guests]1203-such guests as were still on [the road]648-the road . These were a small minority ; for already the afternoon was beginning to decline , and there would not be too much time for [the ladies who came from a distance to attire [themselves]1205-the ladies who came from a distance to attire themselves in readiness for the early tea which was to inspirit them for the dance in readiness for the early tea which was to inspirit [them]1205-the ladies who came from a distance to attire themselves in readiness for the early tea which was to inspirit them for the dance for the dance]1205-the ladies who came from a distance to attire themselves in readiness for the early tea which was to inspirit them for the dance . There was a buzz of voices through [the house]334-the house , as [Miss Nancy]67-nancy entered , mingled with the scrape of a fiddle preluding in [the kitchen]752-the kitchen ; but [the Lammeters]1208-the lammeters were [guests whose arrival had evidently been thought of so much that it had been watched for from the windows]1209-guests whose arrival had evidently been thought of so much that it had been watched for from the windows , for [Mrs Kimble]119-mrs kimble , who did the honours at [the Red House]533-the red house on these great occasions , came forward to meet [Miss Nancy]67-nancy in [the hall]1211-the hall , and conduct [her]67-nancy [upstairs]1212-upstairs . [Mrs Kimble]119-mrs kimble was [[the Squire]531-the squire 's sister]1214-the squire 's sister , as well as [[the doctor]216-the doctor 's wife]1216-the doctor 's wife — a double dignity , with which [her]67-nancy diameter was in direct proportion ; so that , a journey up - stairs being rather fatiguing to [her]67-nancy , [she]67-nancy did not oppose [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's request to be allowed to find [her]67-nancy way alone to [the Blue Room]1217-the blue room , where [the Miss Lammeters]1218-the miss lammeters ' bandboxes had been deposited on [their]1218-the miss lammeters arrival in the morning . There was hardly [a bedroom in [the house where feminine compliments were not passing]1220-the house where feminine compliments were not passing and feminine toilettes going forward , in various stages , in space made scanty by extra beds spread upon the floor]1219-a bedroom in the house where feminine compliments were not passing and feminine toilettes going forward , in various stages , in space made scanty by extra beds spread upon the floor ; and [Miss Nancy]67-nancy , as [she]67-nancy entered [the Blue Room]1217-the blue room , had to make [her]67-nancy little formal curtsy to [a group of six]1222-a group of six . On the one hand , there were [ladies]523-ladies no less important than the two [Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns , [[the wine merchant]1224-the wine merchant 's daughters from [Lytherly]28-lytherly]1225-the wine merchant 's daughters from lytherly , dressed in the height of fashion , with the tightest skirts and the shortest waists , and gazed at by [Miss Ladbrook]121-miss ladbrook ( of [the Old Pastures]1226-the old pastures ) with a shyness not unsustained by inward criticism . Partly , [Miss Ladbrook]121-miss ladbrook felt that [her]121-miss ladbrook own skirt must be regarded as unduly lax by [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns , and partly , that it was a pity [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns did not show that judgment which [she]121-miss ladbrook [herself]121-miss ladbrook would show if [she]121-miss ladbrook were in [their]1227-their place , by stopping a little on this side of the fashion . On the other hand , [Mrs Ladbrook]122-mrs ladbrook was standing in skullcap and front , with [her]121-miss ladbrook turban in [her]121-miss ladbrook hand , curtsying and smiling blandly and saying " After [you]67-nancy , [ma'am]2521-ma'am "[121-miss ladbrook] to [another lady in similar circumstances , who had politely offered the precedence at the looking - glass]1228-another lady in similar circumstances , who had politely offered the precedence at the looking - glass . But [Miss Nancy]67-nancy had no sooner made [her]67-nancy curtsy than [an elderly lady]1229-an elderly lady came forward , whose full white muslin kerchief , and mob - cap round [her]1229-an elderly lady curls of smooth grey hair , were in daring contrast with the puffed yellow satins and top - knotted caps of [[her]1229-an elderly lady neighbours]1230-her neighbours . [She]1229-an elderly lady approached [Miss Nancy]67-nancy with much primness , and said , with a slow , treble suavity — " [Niece]2522-niece , [I]1229-an elderly lady hope [I]1229-an elderly lady see [you]2522-niece well in health . "[1229-an elderly lady] [Miss Nancy]67-nancy kissed [[her]67-nancy aunt]1231-her aunt 's cheek dutifully , and answered , with the same sort of amiable primness , " Quite well , [I]1229-an elderly lady thank [you]1231-her aunt , [aunt]2523-aunt , and [I]1229-an elderly lady hope [I]1229-an elderly lady see [you]1231-her aunt the same . "[1229-an elderly lady] " Thank [you]1231-her aunt , [niece]2522-niece , [I]1229-an elderly lady keep [my]1229-an elderly lady health for the present . And how is [[my]1229-an elderly lady brother - in - law]2525-my brother - in - law ? "[1229-an elderly lady] These dutiful questions and answers were continued until it was ascertained in detail that [the Lammeters]1208-the lammeters were all as well as usual , and [the Osgoods]60-osgoods likewise , also that [niece Priscilla]80-priscilla must certainly arrive shortly , and that travelling on pillions in snowy weather was unpleasant , though [a joseph]1233-a joseph was a great protection . Then [Nancy]67-nancy was formally introduced to [[her]67-nancy aunt 's visitors]1234-her aunt 's visitors , [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns , as being [the daughters of a mother known to [[their]1234-her aunt 's visitors mother]1236-their mother , though now for the first time induced to make a journey into [these parts]2117-these parts]1235-the daughters of a mother known to their mother , though now for the first time induced to make a journey into these parts ; and [these ladies]1238-these ladies were so taken by surprise at finding such a lovely face and figure in [an out - of - the - way country place]1239-an out - of - the - way country place , that [they]1238-these ladies began to feel some curiosity about the dress [she]1236-their mother would put on when [she]1236-their mother took off [her]1236-their mother joseph . [Miss Nancy]67-nancy , whose thoughts were always conducted with the propriety and moderation conspicuous in [her]67-nancy manners , remarked to [herself]67-nancy that [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns were rather hard - featured than otherwise , and that such very low dresses as [they]1234-her aunt 's visitors wore might have been attributed to vanity if [their]1234-her aunt 's visitors shoulders had been pretty , but that , being as [they]1234-her aunt 's visitors were , it was not reasonable to suppose that [they]1234-her aunt 's visitors showed [their]1234-her aunt 's visitors necks from a love of display , but rather from some obligation not inconsistent with sense and modesty . [She]67-nancy felt convinced , as [she]67-nancy opened [her]67-nancy box , that this must be [[her]67-nancy aunt]1231-her aunt [Osgood]52-mrs osgood 's opinion , for [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's mind resembled [[her]67-nancy aunt]1231-her aunt 's to a degree that [everybody]446-everybody said was surprising , considering the kinship was on [Mr Osgood]59-mr osgood 's side ; and though [you]1243-you might not have supposed it from the formality of [their]1244-their greeting , there was a devoted attachment and mutual admiration between [aunt]2523-aunt and [niece]2522-niece . Even [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's refusal of [[her]67-nancy cousin]2421-her cousin [Gilbert Osgood]123-gilbert osgood ( on the ground solely that [he]123-gilbert osgood was [[her]67-nancy cousin]2421-her cousin ) , though it had grieved [[her]67-nancy aunt]1231-her aunt greatly , had not in the least cooled the preference which had determined [her]1231-her aunt to leave [Nancy]67-nancy several of [her]1231-her aunt hereditary ornaments , let [[Gilbert]123-gilbert osgood 's future wife]1250-gilbert 's future wife be whom [she]1231-her aunt might . [Three of [the ladies]1252-the ladies]1251-three of the ladies quickly retired , but [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns were quite content that [Mrs Osgood]52-mrs osgood 's inclination to remain with [[her]52-mrs osgood niece]1253-her niece gave [them]1251-three of the ladies also a reason for staying to see [the rustic beauty]1254-the rustic beauty 's toilette . And it was really a pleasure — from the first opening of the bandbox , where everything smelt of lavender and rose - leaves , to the clasping of the small coral necklace that fitted closely round [her]67-nancy little white neck . Everything belonging to [Miss Nancy]67-nancy was of delicate purity and nattiness : not a crease was where it had no business to be , not a bit of [her]67-nancy linen professed whiteness without fulfilling its profession ; the very pins on [her]67-nancy pincushion were stuck in after a pattern from which [she]67-nancy was careful to allow no aberration ; and as for [[her]67-nancy own person]1255-her own person , it gave the same idea of perfect unvarying neatness as the body of a little bird . It is true that [her]67-nancy lightbrown hair was cropped behind like [a boy]2254-a boy 's , and was dressed in front in a number of flat rings , that lay quite away from [her]67-nancy face ; but there was no sort of coiffure that could make [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's cheek and neck look otherwise than pretty ; and when at last [she]67-nancy stood complete in [her]67-nancy silvery twilled silk , [her]67-nancy lace tucker , [her]67-nancy coral necklace , and coral ear - drops , [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns could see nothing to criticise except [her]67-nancy hands , which bore the traces of butter - making , cheese - crushing , and even still coarser work . But [Miss Nancy]67-nancy was not ashamed of that , for even while [she]67-nancy was dressing [she]67-nancy narrated to [[her]67-nancy aunt]1231-her aunt how [she]67-nancy and [Priscilla]80-priscilla had packed [their]1258-their boxes yesterday , because this morning was baking morning , and since [they]1258-their were leaving [home]374-home , it was desirable to make a good supply of meat pies for [the kitchen]752-the kitchen ; and as [she]67-nancy concluded this judicious remark , [she]67-nancy turned to [the Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns that [she]67-nancy might not commit the rudeness of not including [them]1258-their in the conversation . [The Miss Gunns]120-the miss gunns smiled stiffly , and thought what a pity it was that [these rich country people , who could afford to buy such good clothes]1261-these rich country people , who could afford to buy such good clothes ( really [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's lace and silk were very costly ) , should be brought up in utter ignorance and vulgarity . [She]67-nancy actually said " [mate]2526-mate "[67-nancy] for " meat , "[67-nancy] " ' appen "[67-nancy] for " perhaps , "[67-nancy] and " oss "[67-nancy] for " horse , "[67-nancy] which , to [young ladies living in good Lytherly society]1262-young ladies living in good lytherly society , who habitually said ' orse , even in domestic privacy , and only said ' appen on the right occasions , was necessarily shocking . [Miss Nancy]67-nancy , indeed , had never been to [any school higher than [Dame Tedman]124-dame tedman 's]1263-any school higher than dame tedman 's : [her]67-nancy acquaintance with profane literature hardly went beyond the rhymes [she]67-nancy had worked in [her]67-nancy large sampler under the lamb and [the shepherdess]1264-the shepherdess ; and in order to balance an account , [she]67-nancy was obliged to effect [her]67-nancy subtraction by removing visible metallic shillings and sixpences from a visible metallic total . There is hardly [a servant - maid in these days who is not better informed than [Miss Nancy]67-nancy]1265-a servant - maid in these days who is not better informed than miss nancy ; yet [she]67-nancy had the essential attributes of [a lady]1266-a lady — high veracity , delicate honour in [her]67-nancy dealings , deference to [others]297-others , and refined personal habits,—and lest these should not suffice to convince [grammatical fair ones]1268-grammatical fair ones that [her]67-nancy feelings can at all resemble [theirs]1268-grammatical fair ones , [I]0-i will add that [she]67-nancy was slightly proud and exacting , and as constant in [her]67-nancy affection towards a baseless opinion as towards [an erring lover]1269-an erring lover . The anxiety about [sister Priscilla]80-priscilla , which had grown rather active by the time the coral necklace was clasped , was happily ended by the entrance of [that cheerful - looking lady]1270-that cheerful - looking lady [herself]67-nancy , with a face made blowsy by cold and damp . After the first questions and greetings , [she]67-nancy turned to [Nancy]67-nancy , and surveyed [her]67-nancy from head to foot — then wheeled [her]67-nancy round , to ascertain that the back view was equally faultless . " [The pretty uns]2534-the pretty uns do for [fly - catchers]2535-fly - catchers — [they]2534-the pretty uns keep [the men]2536-the men off [us]2537-us . "[67-nancy] " [Priscy]127-priscy , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , gently , as [she]67-nancy fastened a coral necklace , exactly like [her]67-nancy own , round [Priscilla]80-priscilla 's neck , which was very far from being like [her]67-nancy own , " [I]67-nancy 'm sure [I]67-nancy 'm willing to give way as far as is right , but who should n't dress alike if it is n't [sisters]328-sisters ?
