"[80-priscilla] As [the two Miss Lammeters]1273-the two miss lammeters walked into [the large parlour]1274-the large parlour together , [any one who did not know the character of both]1275-any one who did not know the character of both , might certainly have supposed that the reason why [the square - shouldered , clumsy , high - featured Priscilla]1276-the square - shouldered , clumsy , high - featured priscilla wore a dress the facsimile of [[her]1276-the square - shouldered , clumsy , high - featured priscilla pretty sister]1277-her pretty sister 's , was either the mistaken vanity of [the one]1278-the one , or the malicious contrivance of the other in order to set off [her]1276-the square - shouldered , clumsy , high - featured priscilla own rare beauty . But the good - natured self - forgetful cheeriness and commonsense of [Priscilla]80-priscilla would soon have dissipated the one suspicion ; and the modest calm of [Nancy]67-nancy 's speech and manners told clearly of a mind free from all disavowed devices . Places of honour had been kept for [the Miss Lammeters]68-the lammeters near the head of [the principal teatable in [the wainscoted parlour]998-the wainscoted parlour]1279-the principal teatable in the wainscoted parlour , now looking fresh and pleasant with handsome branches of holly , yew , and laurel , from the abundant growths of [the old garden]1281-the old garden ; and [Nancy]67-nancy felt an inward flutter , that no firmness of purpose could prevent , when [she]67-nancy saw [Mr Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey advancing to lead [her]67-nancy to a seat between [himself]66-godfrey and [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp , while [Priscilla]80-priscilla was called to the opposite side between [[her]80-priscilla father]1190-her father and [the Squire]531-the squire . It certainly did make some difference to [Nancy]67-nancy that [the lover]1284-the lover [she]67-nancy had given up was [the young man of quite the highest consequence in [the parish]262-the parish]1285-the young man of quite the highest consequence in the parish — at [home]374-home in [a venerable and unique parlour]1288-a venerable and unique parlour , which was the extremity of grandeur in [her]67-nancy experience , [a parlour where [she]67-nancy might one day have been [mistress]559-mistress]1289-a parlour where she might one day have been mistress , with the consciousness that [she]67-nancy was spoken of as " [Madam Cass]129-madam cass , "[67-nancy] [[the Squire]531-the squire 's wife]532-the squire 's wife . These circumstances exalted [her]67-nancy inward drama in [her]67-nancy own eyes , and deepened the emphasis with which [she]67-nancy declared to [herself]67-nancy that not the most dazzling rank should induce [her]67-nancy to marry [a man whose conduct showed [him]1293-a man whose conduct showed him careless of his character careless of [his]1293-a man whose conduct showed him careless of his character character]1293-a man whose conduct showed him careless of his character , but that , " love once , love always , "[67-nancy] was the motto of [a true and pure woman]1294-a true and pure woman , and [no man]248-no man should ever have any right over [her]67-nancy which would be a call on [her]67-nancy to destroy the dried flowers that [she]67-nancy treasured , and always would treasure , for [Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey 's sake . And [Nancy]67-nancy was capable of keeping [her]67-nancy word to [herself]67-nancy under very trying conditions . Nothing but a becoming blush betrayed the moving thoughts that urged themselves upon [her]67-nancy as [she]67-nancy accepted the seat next to [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp ; for [she]67-nancy was so instinctively neat and adroit in all [her]67-nancy actions , and [her]67-nancy pretty lips met each other with such quiet firmness , that it would have been difficult for [her]67-nancy to appear agitated . It was not [the rector]911-the rector 's practice to let a charming blush pass without an appropriate compliment . [He]66-godfrey was not in the least lofty or aristocratic , but simply [a merry - eyed , small - featured , grey - haired man , with [his]66-godfrey chin propped by an ample , many - creased white neckcloth , which seemed to predominate over every other point in [his]66-godfrey person]1297-a merry - eyed , small - featured , grey - haired man , with his chin propped by an ample , many - creased white neckcloth , which seemed to predominate over every other point in his person , and somehow to impress its peculiar character on [his]66-godfrey remarks ; so that to have considered [his]66-godfrey amenities apart from [his]66-godfrey cravat , would have been a severe , and perhaps a dangerous , effort of abstraction . " Ha , [Miss Nancy]67-nancy , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said , turning [his]66-godfrey head within [his]66-godfrey cravat , and smiling down pleasantly upon [her]67-nancy , " when [anybody]263-anybody pretends this has been a severe winter , [I]66-godfrey shall tell [them]263-anybody [I]66-godfrey saw the roses blooming on New Year 's Eve — eh , [Godfrey]66-godfrey , what do [you]66-godfrey say ? "[66-godfrey] [Godfrey]66-godfrey made no reply , and avoided looking at [Nancy]67-nancy very markedly ; for though [these complimentary personalities]1298-these complimentary personalities were held to be in excellent taste in old - fashioned Raveloe society , reverent love has a politeness of its own which it teaches to [men otherwise of small schooling]1299-men otherwise of small schooling . But [the Squire]531-the squire was rather impatient at [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's showing [himself]66-godfrey a dull spark in this way . By this advanced hour of the day , [the Squire]531-the squire was always in higher spirits than [we]1302-we have seen [him]531-the squire in at the breakfast - table , and felt it quite pleasant to fulfil the hereditary duty of being noisily jovial and patronising : the large silver snuff - box was in active service , and was offered without fail to [all neighbours]1303-all neighbours from time to time , however often [they]1303-all neighbours might have declined the favour . At present , [the Squire]531-the squire had only given an express welcome to the heads of [families]1305-families as [they]1303-all neighbours appeared ; but always as the evening deepened , [his]531-the squire hospitality rayed out more widely , till [he]531-the squire had tapped [the youngest guests]1306-the youngest guests on the back and shown a peculiar fondness for [their]1306-the youngest guests presence , in the full belief that [they]1306-the youngest guests must feel [their]1306-the youngest guests lives made happy by [their]1306-the youngest guests belonging to [a parish where there was such [a hearty man as [Squire Cass]58-squire cass to invite [them]1306-the youngest guests and wish [them]1306-the youngest guests well]1308-a hearty man as squire cass to invite them and wish them well]1307-a parish where there was such a hearty man as squire cass to invite them and wish them well . Even in this early stage of the jovial mood , it was natural that [he]531-the squire should wish to supply [[his]531-the squire son]981-his son 's deficiencies by looking and speaking for [him]981-his son . " Ay , ay , "[531-the squire] [he]531-the squire began , offering [his]531-the squire snuff - box to [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter , who for the second time bowed [his]81-mr lammeter head and waved [his]81-mr lammeter hand in stiff rejection of the offer , " [[us]2576-us old fellows]2577-us old fellows may wish [ourselves]2576-us young to - night , when [we]2576-us see the mistletoebough in [the White Parlour]2578-the white parlour . It 's true , most things are gone back'ard in these last thirty years — [the country]198-the country 's going down since [the old king]2580-the old king fell ill . But when [I]1310-i look at [Miss Nancy]67-nancy here , [I]1310-i begin to think [the lasses]2212-the lasses keep up [their]2212-the lasses quality;—ding [me]1310-i if [I]1310-i remember a sample to match [her]67-nancy , not when [I]1310-i was [a fine young fellow]2582-a fine young fellow , and thought a deal about [my]1310-i pigtail . No offence , to [you]130-mrs crackenthorp , [madam]2583-madam , "[1310-i] [he]1310-i added , bending to [Mrs Crackenthorp]130-mrs crackenthorp , who sat by [him]1310-i , " [I]130-mrs crackenthorp did n't know [you]130-mrs crackenthorp when [you]130-mrs crackenthorp were as young as [Miss Nancy]67-nancy [here]2143-here . "[130-mrs crackenthorp] [Mrs Crackenthorp]130-mrs crackenthorp — [a small blinking woman]1311-a small blinking woman , who fidgeted incessantly with [her]130-mrs crackenthorp lace , ribbons , and gold chain , turning [her]130-mrs crackenthorp head about and making subdued noises , very much like a guinea - pig , that twitches its nose and soliloquises in all company indiscriminately — now blinked and fidgeted towards [the Squire]531-the squire , and said , " O no — no offence . "[531-the squire] This emphatic compliment of [the Squire]531-the squire 's to [Nancy]67-nancy was felt by others besides [Godfrey]66-godfrey to have a diplomatic significance ; and [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father gave a slight additional erectness to [his]1190-her father back , as [he]1190-her father looked across the table at [her]67-nancy with complacent gravity . [That grave and orderly senior]1315-that grave and orderly senior was not going to bate a jot of [his]1315-that grave and orderly senior dignity by seeming elated at the notion of a match between [[his]1315-that grave and orderly senior family]601-his family and [the Squire]531-the squire 's : [he]1315-that grave and orderly senior was gratified by any honour paid to [[his]1315-that grave and orderly senior daughter]2418-his daughter ; but [he]1315-that grave and orderly senior must see an alteration in several ways before [his]1315-that grave and orderly senior consent would be vouchsafed . [[His]1315-that grave and orderly senior spare but healthy person]1319-his spare but healthy person , and high - featured firm face , that looked as if it had never been flushed by excess , was in strong contrast , not only with [the Squire]531-the squire 's , but with the appearance of [the Raveloe farmers]1321-the raveloe farmers generally — in accordance with a favourite saying of [his]1315-that grave and orderly senior own , that " breed was stronger than pasture . "[1315-that grave and orderly senior] " [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's wonderful like what [[her]67-nancy mother]2585-her mother was , though ; is n't [she]67-nancy , [Kimble]119-mrs kimble ? "[1322-the stout lady of that name] said [the stout lady of that name]1322-the stout lady of that name , looking round for [[her]1322-the stout lady of that name husband]2414-her husband . But [Doctor Kimble]54-kimble ( county apothecaries in old days enjoyed that title without authority of diploma ) , being [a thin and agile man]1324-a thin and agile man , was flitting about [the room]611-the room with [his]1315-that grave and orderly senior hands in [his]1315-that grave and orderly senior pockets , making [himself]1315-that grave and orderly senior agreeable to [[his]1315-that grave and orderly senior feminine patients]1326-his feminine patients , with medical impartiality , and being welcomed everywhere as [a doctor]2329-a doctor by hereditary right — [not one of [those miserable apothecaries who canvass for practice in [strange neighbourhoods]1330-strange neighbourhoods , and spend all [their]1329-those miserable apothecaries who canvass for practice in strange neighbourhoods , and spend all their income in starving their one horse income in starving [their]1329-those miserable apothecaries who canvass for practice in strange neighbourhoods , and spend all their income in starving their one horse one horse]1329-those miserable apothecaries who canvass for practice in strange neighbourhoods , and spend all their income in starving their one horse , but [a man of substance]1331-a man of substance , able to keep an extravagant table like the best of [[his]1315-that grave and orderly senior patients]1332-his patients]1328-not one of those miserable apothecaries who canvass for practice in strange neighbourhoods , and spend all their income in starving their one horse , but a man of substance , able to keep an extravagant table like the best of his patients . Time out of mind [the Raveloe doctor]1333-the raveloe doctor had been [a Kimble]54-kimble ; [Kimble]54-kimble was inherently [a doctor]2329-a doctor 's name ; and it was difficult to contemplate firmly the melancholy fact that [the actual Kimble]1335-the actual kimble had [no son]1336-no son , so that [his]1335-the actual kimble practice might one day be handed over to [a successor]1337-a successor , with the incongruous name of [Taylor]131-taylor or [Johnson]132-johnson . But in that case [the wiser people in [Raveloe]1-raveloe]1338-the wiser people in raveloe would employ [Dr Blick of Flitton]133-dr blick of flitton — as less unnatural . " Did [you]223-his wife speak to [me]1339-the authentic doctor , [[my]1339-the authentic doctor dear]2469-my dear ? "[1339-the authentic doctor] said [the authentic doctor]1339-the authentic doctor , coming quickly to [[his]1339-the authentic doctor wife]223-his wife 's side ; but , as if foreseeing that [she]223-his wife would be too much out of breath to repeat [her]223-his wife remark , [he]1339-the authentic doctor went on immediately—"Ha , [Miss Priscilla]80-priscilla , the sight of [you]223-his wife revives the taste of that super - excellent pork - pie . [I]1339-the authentic doctor hope the batch is n't near an end . "[1339-the authentic doctor] " Yes , indeed , it is , [doctor]877-doctor , "[80-priscilla] said [Priscilla]80-priscilla ; " but [I]80-priscilla 'll answer for it the next shall be as good . [My]80-priscilla pork - pies do n't turn out well by chance . "[80-priscilla] " Not as [[your]223-his wife doctoring]2588-your doctoring does , eh , [Kimble]54-kimble ? — because [folks]214-folks forget to take [your]223-his wife physic , eh ? "[531-the squire] said [the Squire]531-the squire , who regarded [physic and doctors]1342-physic and doctors as [many loyal churchmen]1343-many loyal churchmen regard [the church]322-the church and [the clergy]1345-the clergy — tasting a joke against [them]1342-physic and doctors when [he]531-the squire was in health , but impatiently eager for [their]1342-physic and doctors aid when anything was the matter with [him]531-the squire . [He]531-the squire tapped [his]531-the squire box , and looked round with a triumphant laugh . " Ah , [she]1347-the lady has a quick wit , [[my]216-the doctor friend]2590-my friend [Priscilla]80-priscilla has , "[216-the doctor] said [the doctor]216-the doctor , choosing to attribute the epigram to [the lady]1347-the lady rather than allow [a brother - in - law]1348-a brother - in - law that advantage over [him]216-the doctor . " [She]1347-the lady saves a little pepper to sprinkle over [her]1347-the lady talk — that 's the reason why [she]1347-the lady never puts too much into [her]1347-the lady pies . There 's [[my]216-the doctor wife]2284-my wife , now , [she]1347-the lady never has an answer at [her]1347-the lady tongue 's end ; but if [I]216-the doctor offend [her]1347-the lady , [she]1347-the lady 's sure to scarify [my]216-the doctor throat with black pepper the next day , or else give [me]216-the doctor the colic with watery greens . That 's an awful tit - for - tat . "[216-the doctor] Here [the vivacious doctor]1349-the vivacious doctor made a pathetic grimace . " Did [you]1349-the vivacious doctor ever hear the like ? While safe , well - tested personalities were enlivening the tea in this way , the sound of the fiddle approaching within a distance at which it could be heard distinctly , made [the young people]1356-the young people look at [each other]655-each other with sympathetic impatience for the end of the meal . " Why , there 's [Solomon]91-solomon in [the hall]1211-the hall , "[531-the squire] said [the Squire]531-the squire , " and playing [my]531-the squire fav'rite tune , [I]531-the squire believe — ' The flaxen - headed ploughboy'—he 's for giving [us]1356-the young people a hint as [we]1356-the young people are n't enough in a hurry to hear [him]91-solomon play . [Bob]72-bob , "[531-the squire] [he]531-the squire called out to [[his]531-the squire third long - legged son , who was at the other end of [the room]611-the room]1359-his third long - legged son , who was at the other end of the room , " open the door , and tell [Solomon]91-solomon to come in . "[531-the squire] [Bob]72-bob obeyed , and [Solomon]91-solomon walked in , fiddling as [he]91-solomon walked , for [he]91-solomon would on no account break off in the middle of a tune . " Here , [Solomon]91-solomon , "[531-the squire] said [the Squire]531-the squire , with loud patronage . " Round here , [[my]531-the squire man]2604-my man . Ah , [I]531-the squire knew it was ' [The flaxen - headed ploughboy]2605-the flaxen - headed ploughboy : ' there 's no finer tune . "[531-the squire] [Solomon Macey]91-solomon , [a small hale old man with an abundant crop of long white hair reaching nearly to [his]91-solomon shoulders]1362-a small hale old man with an abundant crop of long white hair reaching nearly to his shoulders , advanced to the indicated spot , bowing reverently while [he]91-solomon fiddled , as much as to say that [he]91-solomon respected the company , though [he]91-solomon respected the key - note more . As soon as [he]91-solomon had repeated the tune and lowered [his]91-solomon fiddle , [he]91-solomon bowed again to [the Squire]531-the squire and [the rector]911-the rector , and said , " [I]91-solomon hope [I]91-solomon see [your]2604-my man honour and [your]2604-my man reverence well , and wishing [you]2604-my man health and long life and a happy New Year . And wishing the same to [you]2604-my man , [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter , [sir]2360-sir ; and to [the other gentlemen]2607-the other gentlemen , and [the madams]2608-the madams , and [the young lasses]2609-the young lasses . "[91-solomon] As [Solomon]91-solomon uttered the last words , [he]91-solomon bowed in all directions solicitously , lest [he]91-solomon should be wanting in due respect . But thereupon [he]91-solomon immediately began to prelude , and fell into the tune which [he]91-solomon knew would be taken as a special compliment by [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter . " Thank [ye]91-solomon , [Solomon]91-solomon , thank [ye]91-solomon , "[81-mr lammeter] said [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter , when the fiddle paused again . " That 's ' Over [the hills]169-the hills and far away , ' that is . [[My]81-mr lammeter father]2068-my father used to say to [me]81-mr lammeter , whenever [we]2612-we heard that tune , ' Ah , [lad]2613-lad , [I]81-mr lammeter come from over [the hills]169-the hills and far away . ' There 's a many tunes [I]81-mr lammeter do n't make head or tail of ; but that speaks to [me]81-mr lammeter like the blackbird 's whistle . [I]81-mr lammeter suppose it 's the name : there 's a deal in the name of a tune . "[81-mr lammeter] But [Solomon]91-solomon was already impatient to prelude again , and presently broke with much spirit into " [Sir Roger de Coverley]136-sir roger de coverley , "[81-mr lammeter] at which there was a sound of chairs pushed back , and laughing voices . " Ay , ay , [Solomon]91-solomon , [we]2612-we know what that means , "[531-the squire] said [the Squire]531-the squire , rising . " It 's time to begin the dance , eh ? Lead the way , then , and [we]2612-we 'll all follow [you]91-solomon . "[531-the squire] So [Solomon]91-solomon , holding [his]91-solomon white head on one side , and playing vigorously , marched forward at the head of the gay procession into [the White Parlour]2578-the white parlour , where the mistletoe - bough was hung , and multitudinous tallow candles made rather a brilliant effect , gleaming from among the berried holly - boughs , and reflected in the old - fashioned oval mirrors fastened in the panels of the white wainscot . A quaint procession ! [Old Solomon]137-old solomon , in [his]91-solomon seedy clothes and long white locks , seemed to be luring that decent company by the magic scream of [his]91-solomon fiddle — luring [discreet matrons]1367-discreet matrons in turban - shaped caps , nay , [Mrs Crackenthorp]130-mrs crackenthorp [herself]130-mrs crackenthorp , the summit of whose perpendicular feather was on a level with [the Squire]531-the squire 's shoulder — [luring fair lasses complacently conscious of very short waists and skirts blameless of front - folds]1369-luring fair lasses complacently conscious of very short waists and skirts blameless of front - folds — [burly fathers]1370-burly fathers , in large variegated waistcoats , and [ruddy sons]1371-ruddy sons , for the most part shy and sheepish , in short nether garments and very long coattails . Already , [Mr Macey]41-mr macey and [a few other privileged villagers , who were allowed to be [spectators on these great occasions]1373-spectators on these great occasions]1372-a few other privileged villagers , who were allowed to be spectators on these great occasions , were seated on benches placed for [them]1372-a few other privileged villagers , who were allowed to be spectators on these great occasions near the door ; and great was the admiration and satisfaction in that quarter when [the couples]1374-the couples had formed [themselves]1374-the couples for the dance , and [the Squire]531-the squire led off with [Mrs Crackenthorp]130-mrs crackenthorp , joining hands with [the rector]911-the rector and [Mrs Osgood]52-mrs osgood . That was as it should be — that was what [everybody]446-everybody had been used to — and the charter of [Raveloe]1-raveloe seemed to be renewed by the ceremony . It was not thought of as an unbecoming levity for [the old and middle - aged people]1378-the old and middle - aged people to dance a little before sitting down to cards , but rather as part of [their]1378-the old and middle - aged people social duties . For what were these if not to be merry at appropriate times , interchanging visits and poultry with due frequency , paying [each other]655-each other old - established compliments in sound traditional phrases , passing well - tried personal jokes , urging [[your]1380-you guests]1381-your guests to eat and drink too much out of hospitality , and eating and drinking too much in [[[your]1380-you neighbour]1382-your neighbour 's house]1383-your neighbour 's house to show that [you]1380-you liked [your]1380-you cheer ? And [the person]1384-the person naturally set an example in these social duties . For it would not have been possible for [the Raveloe]1-raveloe mind , without a peculiar revelation , to know that [a clergyman]1385-a clergyman should be [a pale - faced memento of solemnities]1386-a pale - faced memento of solemnities , instead of [a reasonably faulty man , whose exclusive authority to read prayers and preach]1387-a reasonably faulty man , whose exclusive authority to read prayers and preach , to christen , marry , and bury [you]1380-you , necessarily co - existed with the right to sell [you]1380-you the ground to be buried in , and to take tithe in kind ; on which last point , of course , there was a little grumbling , but not to the extent of irreligion — not beyond the grumbling at the rain , which was by no means accompanied with a spirit of impious defiance , but with a desire that the prayer for fine weather might be read forthwith . There was no reason , then , why [the rector]911-the rector 's dancing should not be received as part of the fitness of things quite as much as [the Squire]531-the squire 's , or why , on the other hand , [Mr Macey]41-mr macey 's official respect should restrain [him]41-mr macey from subjecting [the parson]273-the parson 's performance to that criticism with which [minds of extraordinary acuteness]1391-minds of extraordinary acuteness must necessarily contemplate the doings of [[their]1391-minds of extraordinary acuteness fallible fellow - men]1392-their fallible fellow - men . " [The Squire]531-the squire 's pretty springe , considering [his]531-the squire weight , "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , " and [he]531-the squire stamps uncommon well . But [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter beats 'em all for shapes : [you]1380-you see , [he]81-mr lammeter holds [his]81-mr lammeter head like [a sodger]2616-a sodger , and [he]81-mr lammeter is n't so cushiony as most o ' [the oldish gentlefolks]2617-the oldish gentlefolks — [they]2617-the oldish gentlefolks run fat in general ; and [he]81-mr lammeter 's got a fine leg . [The parson]273-the parson 's nimble enough , but [he]273-the parson has n't got much of a leg : it 's a bit too thick down'ard , and [his]273-the parson knees might be a bit nearer wi'out damage ; but [he]273-the parson might do worse , [he]273-the parson might do worse . Though [he]273-the parson has n't that grand way o ' waving [his]273-the parson hand as [the Squire]531-the squire has . "[41-mr macey] " Talk o ' nimbleness , look at [Mrs Osgood]52-mrs osgood , "[87-ben winthrop] said [Ben Winthrop]87-ben winthrop , who was holding [[his]87-ben winthrop son]981-his son [Aaron]89-aaron between [his]87-ben winthrop knees . " [She]52-mrs osgood trips along with [her]52-mrs osgood little steps , so as [nobody]444-nobody can see how [she]52-mrs osgood goes — it 's like as if [she]52-mrs osgood had little wheels to [her]52-mrs osgood feet . [She]52-mrs osgood does n't look a day older nor last year : [she]52-mrs osgood 's [the finest - made woman as is]2621-the finest - made woman as is , let the next be where [she]52-mrs osgood will . " [They]2622-the women wear nayther coat nor breeches : [you]41-mr macey ca n't make much out o ' [their]2622-the women shapes . "[41-mr macey] " [Fayder]138-fayder , "[89-aaron] said [Aaron]89-aaron , whose feet were busy beating out the tune , " how does that big cock's - feather stick in [Mrs Crackenthorp]130-mrs crackenthorp 's yead ? Is there a little hole for it , like in [my]89-aaron shuttlecock ? "[89-aaron] " Hush , [lad]2613-lad , hush ; that 's the way [the ladies]1252-the ladies dress theirselves , that is , "[2229-the father] said [the father]2229-the father , adding , however , in an under - tone to [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , " It does make [her]52-mrs osgood look funny , though — partly like a short - necked bottle wi ' a long quill in it . Hey , by jingo , there 's [the young Squire]624-the young squire leading off now , wi ' [Miss Nancy]67-nancy for [partners]2626-partners . [I]2229-the father should n't wonder if [she]52-mrs osgood 's [Madam Cass]129-madam cass some day , arter all — and [nobody more rightfuller]2631-nobody more rightfuller , for [they]2632-they 'd make a fine match . [You]41-mr macey can find nothing against [Master Godfrey]66-godfrey 's shapes , [Macey]41-mr macey , [I]2229-the father 'll bet a penny . "[2229-the father] [Mr Macey]41-mr macey screwed up [his]41-mr macey mouth , leaned [his]41-mr macey head further on one side , and twirled [his]41-mr macey thumbs with a presto movement as [his]41-mr macey eyes followed [Godfrey]66-godfrey up the dance . At last [he]41-mr macey summed up [his]41-mr macey opinion . " Pretty well down'ard , but a bit too round [i]41-mr macey ' the shoulder - blades . And as for [them]2632-they coats as [he]66-godfrey gets from [the Flitton tailor]2633-the flitton tailor , [they]2632-they 're a poor cut to pay double money for . "[41-mr macey] " Ah , [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , [you]41-mr macey and [me]87-ben winthrop are [two folks]2133-two folks , "[87-ben winthrop] said [Ben]87-ben winthrop , slightly indignant at this carping . " When [I]87-ben winthrop 've got a pot o ' good ale , [I]87-ben winthrop like to swaller it , and do [my]87-ben winthrop inside good , [i'stead]87-ben winthrop o ' smelling and staring at it to see if [I]87-ben winthrop ca n't find faut wi ' the brewing . [I]87-ben winthrop should like [you]41-mr macey to pick [me]87-ben winthrop out [a finer - limbed young fellow]2635-a finer - limbed young fellow nor [Master Godfrey]66-godfrey — one as ' ud knock [you]41-mr macey down easier , or 's more pleasanter - looksed when [he]66-godfrey 's piert and merry . "[87-ben winthrop] " Tchuh ! "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , provoked to increased severity , " [he]66-godfrey is n't come to [his]66-godfrey right colour yet : [he]66-godfrey 's partly like a slack - backed pie . And [I]41-mr macey doubt [he]66-godfrey 's got a soft place in [his]66-godfrey head , else why should [he]66-godfrey be turned round the finger by [that offal [Dunsey]104-dunsey]2636-that offal dunsey as [nobody]444-nobody 's seen o ' late , and let [him]66-godfrey kill that fine hunting hoss as was the talk o ' [the country]198-the country ? And one while [he]66-godfrey was allays after [Miss Nancy]67-nancy , and then it all went off again , like a smell o ' hot porridge , as [I]41-mr macey may say . That was n't [my]41-mr macey way , when [I]41-mr macey went a - coorting . "[41-mr macey] " Ah , but mayhap [Miss Nancy]67-nancy hung off , like , and [[your]41-mr macey lass]2639-your lass did n't , "[87-ben winthrop] said [Ben]87-ben winthrop . " [I]41-mr macey should say [she]67-nancy did n't , "[41-mr macey] said [Mr Macey]41-mr macey , significantly . " Before [I]41-mr macey said ' sniff , ' [I]41-mr macey took care to know as [she]67-nancy 'd say ' snaff , ' and pretty quick too . [I]41-mr macey was n't a - going to open [my]41-mr macey mouth , like a dog at a fly , and snap it to again , wi ' nothing to swaller . "[41-mr macey] " Well , [I]87-ben winthrop think [Miss Nancy]67-nancy 's a - coming round again , "[87-ben winthrop] said [Ben]87-ben winthrop , " for [Master Godfrey]66-godfrey does n't look so down - hearted to - night . And [I]87-ben winthrop see [he]66-godfrey 's for taking [her]67-nancy away to sit down , now [they]2640-they 're at the end o ' the dance : that looks like sweet - hearting , that does . "[87-ben winthrop] The reason why [Godfrey]66-godfrey and [Nancy]67-nancy had left the dance was not so tender as [Ben]87-ben winthrop imagined . In the close press of [couples]1395-couples a slight accident had happened to [Nancy]67-nancy 's dress , which , while it was short enough to show [her]67-nancy neat ankle in front , was long enough behind to be caught under the stately stamp of [the Squire]531-the squire 's foot , so as to rend certain stitches at the waist , and cause much sisterly agitation in [Priscilla]80-priscilla 's mind , as well as serious concern in [Nancy]67-nancy 's . [One]2512-one 's thoughts may be much occupied with love - struggles , but hardly so as to be insensible to a disorder in the general framework of things . [Nancy]67-nancy had no sooner completed [her]67-nancy duty in the figure [they]1398-they were dancing than [she]67-nancy said to [Godfrey]66-godfrey , with a deep blush , that [she]67-nancy must go and sit down till [Priscilla]80-priscilla could come to [her]67-nancy ; for [the sisters]1399-the sisters had already exchanged a short whisper and an open - eyed glance full of meaning . No reason less urgent than this could have prevailed on [Nancy]67-nancy to give [Godfrey]66-godfrey this opportunity of sitting apart with [her]67-nancy . As for [Godfrey]66-godfrey , [he]66-godfrey was feeling so happy and oblivious under the long charm of the country - dance with [Nancy]67-nancy , that [he]66-godfrey got rather bold on the strength of [her]67-nancy confusion , and was capable of leading [her]67-nancy straight away , without leave asked , into [the adjoining small parlour]1400-the adjoining small parlour , where the card - tables were set . " O no , thank [you]66-godfrey , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , coldly , as soon as [she]67-nancy perceived where [he]66-godfrey was going , " not in [there]2073-there . [I]67-nancy 'll wait here till [Priscilla]80-priscilla 's ready to come to [me]67-nancy . [I]67-nancy 'm sorry to bring [you]66-godfrey out of the dance and make [myself]67-nancy troublesome . "[67-nancy] " Why , [you]67-nancy 'll be more comfortable here by [yourself]67-nancy , "[66-godfrey] said [the artful Godfrey]66-godfrey ; " [I]66-godfrey 'll leave [you]67-nancy here till [[your]67-nancy sister]2642-your sister can come . "[66-godfrey] [He]66-godfrey spoke in an indifferent tone . That was an agreeable proposition , and just what [Nancy]67-nancy desired ; why , then , was [she]67-nancy a little hurt that [Mr Godfrey]66-godfrey should make it ? [They]1401-they entered , and [she]67-nancy seated [herself]67-nancy on a chair against one of the card - tables , as the stiffest and most unapproachable position [she]67-nancy could choose . " Thank [you]66-godfrey , [sir]2360-sir , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy said immediately . " [I]67-nancy need n't give [you]66-godfrey any more trouble . [I]67-nancy 'm sorry [you]66-godfrey 've had such [an unlucky partner]2644-an unlucky partner . "[67-nancy] " That 's very ill - natured of [you]67-nancy , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , standing by [her]67-nancy without any sign of intended departure , " to be sorry [you]67-nancy 've danced with [me]66-godfrey . "[66-godfrey] " Oh , no , [sir]2360-sir , [I]67-nancy do n't mean to say what 's ill - natured at all , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , looking distractingly prim and pretty . " When [gentlemen]2505-gentlemen have so many pleasures , one dance can make but very little . "[67-nancy] " [You]66-godfrey know that is n't true . [You]66-godfrey know one dance with [you]66-godfrey matters more to [me]66-godfrey than all the other pleasures in [the world]410-the world . "[66-godfrey] It was a long , long while since [Godfrey]66-godfrey had said anything so direct as that , and [Nancy]67-nancy was startled . But [her]67-nancy instinctive dignity and repugnance to any show of emotion made [her]67-nancy sit perfectly still , and only throw a little more decision into [her]67-nancy voice as [she]67-nancy said — " No , indeed , [Mr Godfrey]66-godfrey , that 's not known to [me]67-nancy , and [I]67-nancy have very good reasons for thinking different . But if it 's true , [I]67-nancy do n't wish to hear it . "[67-nancy] " Would [you]67-nancy never forgive [me]66-godfrey , then , [Nancy]67-nancy — never think well of [me]66-godfrey , let what would happen — would [you]67-nancy never think the present made amends for the past ? Not if [I]66-godfrey turned [a good fellow]2357-a good fellow , and gave up everything [you]67-nancy did n't like ? "[66-godfrey] [Godfrey]66-godfrey was half conscious that this sudden opportunity of speaking to [Nancy]67-nancy alone had driven [him]66-godfrey beside [himself]66-godfrey ; but blind feeling had got the mastery of [his]66-godfrey tongue . [Nancy]67-nancy really felt much agitated by the possibility [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's words suggested , but this very pressure of emotion that [she]67-nancy was in danger of finding too strong for [her]67-nancy , roused all [her]67-nancy power of self - command . " [I]67-nancy should be glad to see a good change in [anybody]263-anybody , [Mr Godfrey]66-godfrey , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy answered , with the slightest discernible difference of tone , " but it ' ud be better if no change was wanted . "[67-nancy] " [You]67-nancy 're very hard - hearted , [Nancy]67-nancy , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , pettishly . " [You]67-nancy might encourage [me]66-godfrey to be [a better fellow]2650-a better fellow . [I]66-godfrey 'm very miserable — but [you]67-nancy 've no feeling . "[66-godfrey] " [I]67-nancy think those have the least feeling that act wrong to begin with , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , sending out a flash in spite of [herself]67-nancy . [Godfrey]66-godfrey was delighted with that little flash , and would have liked to go on and make [her]67-nancy quarrel with [him]66-godfrey ; [Nancy]67-nancy was so exasperatingly quiet and firm . [She]67-nancy was not indifferent to [him]66-godfrey yet , though — The entrance of [Priscilla]80-priscilla , bustling forward and saying , " [Dear heart]139-dear heart alive , [child]2550-child , let [us]2652-us look at this gown , "[80-priscilla] cut off [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's hopes of a quarrel . " [I]66-godfrey suppose [I]66-godfrey must go now , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said to [Priscilla]80-priscilla . " It 's no matter to [me]1402-that frank lady whether [you]66-godfrey go or stay , "[1402-that frank lady] said [that frank lady]1402-that frank lady , searching for something in [her]1402-that frank lady pocket , with a preoccupied brow . " Do [you]80-priscilla want [me]66-godfrey to go ? "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , looking at [Nancy]67-nancy , who was now standing up by [Priscilla]80-priscilla 's order . " As [you]66-godfrey like , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , trying to recover all [her]67-nancy former coldness , and looking down carefully at the hem of [her]67-nancy gown . " Then [I]66-godfrey like to stay , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , with a reckless determination to get as much of this joy as [he]66-godfrey could to - night , and think nothing of the morrow . While [Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey was taking draughts of forgetfulness from the sweet presence of [Nancy]67-nancy , willingly losing all sense of that hidden bond which at other moments galled and fretted [him]66-godfrey so as to mingle irritation with the very sunshine , [[Godfrey]66-godfrey 's wife]1403-godfrey 's wife was walking with slow uncertain steps through the snow - covered [Raveloe lanes]1-raveloe , carrying [[her]1403-godfrey 's wife child]1404-her child in [her]1403-godfrey 's wife arms . This journey on [New Year 's Eve]31-new year 's eve was a premeditated act of vengeance which [she]1403-godfrey 's wife had kept in [her]1403-godfrey 's wife heart ever since [Godfrey]66-godfrey , in a fit of passion , had told [her]1403-godfrey 's wife [he]66-godfrey would sooner die than acknowledge [her]1403-godfrey 's wife as [[his]66-godfrey wife]223-his wife . There would be a great party at [the Red House]24-the red house on New Year 's Eve , [she]1403-godfrey 's wife knew : [[her]1403-godfrey 's wife husband]2414-her husband would be smiling and smiled upon , hiding [her]1403-godfrey 's wife existence in the darkest corner of [his]66-godfrey heart . But [she]1403-godfrey 's wife would mar [his]66-godfrey pleasure : [she]1403-godfrey 's wife would go in [her]1403-godfrey 's wife dingy rags , with [her]1403-godfrey 's wife faded face , once as handsome as the best , with [[her]1403-godfrey 's wife little child that had [its father]1408-its father 's hair and eyes , and disclose [herself]1403-godfrey 's wife to [the Squire]531-the squire as [[his]66-godfrey eldest son 's wife]1410-his eldest son 's wife]1407-her little child that had its father 's hair and eyes , and disclose herself to the squire as his eldest son 's wife . It is seldom that [the miserable]1411-the miserable can help regarding [their]1411-the miserable misery as a wrong inflicted by [those who are less miserable]1412-those who are less miserable . [Molly]71-molly knew that the cause of [her]71-molly dingy rags was not [[her]71-molly husband]2414-her husband 's neglect , but the demon Opium to whom [she]71-molly was enslaved , body and soul , except in [the lingering mother]1414-the lingering mother 's tenderness that refused to give [him]66-godfrey [[her]1403-godfrey 's wife hungry child]1415-her hungry child . [She]71-molly knew this well ; and yet , in the moments of wretched unbenumbed consciousness , the sense of [her]71-molly want and degradation transformed itself continually into bitterness towards [Godfrey]66-godfrey . [He]66-godfrey was well off ; and if [she]71-molly had [her]71-molly rights [she]71-molly would be well off too . The belief that [he]66-godfrey repented [his]66-godfrey marriage , and suffered from it , only aggravated [her]71-molly vindictiveness . Just and self - reproving thoughts do not come to [us]1416-us too thickly , even in the purest air , and with the best lessons of heaven and [earth]397-earth ; how should [those white - winged delicate messengers make [their]1418-those white - winged delicate messengers make their way to molly 's poisoned chamber , inhabited by no higher memories than those of a bar - maid 's paradise of pink ribbons and gentlemen 's jokes way to [[Molly]71-molly 's poisoned chamber]1419-molly 's poisoned chamber , inhabited by no higher memories than those of [[a bar - maid]1420-a bar - maid 's paradise of pink ribbons and [gentlemen]2505-gentlemen 's jokes]1421-a bar - maid 's paradise of pink ribbons and gentlemen 's jokes]1418-those white - winged delicate messengers make their way to molly 's poisoned chamber , inhabited by no higher memories than those of a bar - maid 's paradise of pink ribbons and gentlemen 's jokes ? [She]71-molly had set out at an early hour , but had lingered on [the road]648-the road , inclined by [her]71-molly indolence to believe that if [she]71-molly waited under a warm shed the snow would cease to fall . [She]71-molly had waited longer than [she]71-molly knew , and now that [she]71-molly found [herself]71-molly belated in the snow - hidden ruggedness of [the long lanes]1424-the long lanes , even the animation of a vindictive purpose could not keep [her]71-molly spirit from failing . It was seven o'clock , and by this time [she]71-molly was not very far from [Raveloe]1-raveloe , but [she]71-molly was not familiar enough with [those monotonous lanes]1425-those monotonous lanes to know how near [she]71-molly was to [her]71-molly journey 's end . [She]71-molly needed comfort , and [she]71-molly knew but one comforter — the familiar demon in [her]71-molly bosom ; but [she]71-molly hesitated a moment , after drawing out the black remnant , before [she]71-molly raised it to [her]71-molly lips . In that moment [the mother]1426-the mother 's love pleaded for painful consciousness rather than oblivion — pleaded to be left in aching weariness , rather than to have the encircling arms benumbed so that [they]1427-they could not feel the dear burden . In another moment [Molly]71-molly had flung something away , but it was not the black remnant — it was an empty phial . And [she]71-molly walked on again under the breaking cloud , from which there came now and then the light of a quickly - veiled star , for a freezing wind had sprung up since the snowing had ceased . But [she]71-molly walked always more and more drowsily , and clutched more and more automatically [the sleeping child]1428-the sleeping child at [her]71-molly bosom . Slowly [the demon]1429-the demon was working [his]1429-the demon will , and cold and weariness were [[his]1429-the demon helpers]1430-his helpers . Soon [she]71-molly felt nothing but a supreme immediate longing that curtained off all futurity — the longing to lie down and sleep . [She]71-molly had arrived at a spot where [her]71-molly footsteps were no longer checked by a hedgerow , and [she]71-molly had wandered vaguely , unable to distinguish any objects , notwithstanding the wide whiteness around [her]71-molly , and the growing starlight . [She]71-molly sank down against a straggling furze bush , an easy pillow enough ; and the bed of snow , too , was soft . [She]71-molly did not feel that the bed was cold , and did not heed whether [the child]451-the child would wake and cry for [her]71-molly . But [her]71-molly arms did not yet relax [their]1427-they instinctive clutch ; and [the little one]1432-the little one slumbered on as gently as if it had been rocked in a lace - trimmed cradle . But the complete torpor came at last : the fingers lost their tension , the arms unbent ; then the little head fell away from the bosom , and the blue eyes opened wide on the cold starlight . At first there was a little peevish cry of " mammy , "[140-mammy] and an effort to regain the pillowing arm and bosom ; but [mammy]140-mammy 's ear was deaf , and the pillow seemed to be slipping away backward . Suddenly , as [the child]451-the child rolled downward on [[its]451-the child mother]1434-its mother 's knees , all wet with snow , [its]451-the child eyes were caught by a bright glancing light on the white ground , and , with the ready transition of infancy , it was immediately absorbed in watching the bright living thing running towards it , yet never arriving . That bright living thing must be caught ; and in an instant [the child]451-the child had slipped on all - fours , and held out one little hand to catch the gleam . But the gleam would not be caught in that way , and now the head was held up to see where the cunning gleam came from . It came from a very bright place ; and [the little one]1432-the little one , rising on [its]1432-the little one legs , toddled through the snow , the old grimy shawl in which it was wrapped trailing behind [it]1432-the little one , and the queer little bonnet dangling at its back — toddled on to the open door of [[Silas Marner]38-silas 's cottage]659-silas marner 's cottage , and right up to the warm hearth , where there was a bright fire of logs and sticks , which had thoroughly warmed the old sack ( [Silas]38-silas 's greatcoat ) spread out on the bricks to dry . [The little one]1432-the little one , accustomed to be left to itself for long hours without notice from [[its]451-the child mother]1434-its mother , squatted down on the sack , and spread its tiny hands towards the blaze , in perfect contentment , gurgling and making many inarticulate communications to the cheerful fire , like a new - hatched gosling beginning to find itself comfortable . But presently the warmth had a lulling effect , and the little golden head sank down on the old sack , and the blue eyes were veiled by their delicate half - transparent lids . But where was [Silas Marner]38-silas while [this stranger - visitor]1440-this stranger - visitor had come to [[his]38-silas hearth]1441-his hearth ? [He]38-silas was in [the cottage]616-the cottage , but [he]38-silas did not see [the child]451-the child . During the last few weeks , since [he]38-silas had lost [his]38-silas money , [he]38-silas had contracted the habit of opening [his]38-silas door and looking out from time to time , as if [he]38-silas thought that [his]38-silas money might be somehow coming back to [him]38-silas , or that some trace , some news of it , might be mysteriously on [the road]648-the road , and be caught by the listening ear or the straining eye . It was chiefly at night , when [he]38-silas was not occupied in [his]38-silas loom , that [he]38-silas fell into this repetition of an act for which [he]38-silas could have assigned no definite purpose , and which can hardly be understood except by those who have undergone a bewildering separation from [a supremely loved object]1445-a supremely loved object . In the evening twilight , and later whenever the night was not dark , [Silas]38-silas looked out on that narrow prospect round [the Stone - pits]658-the stone - pits , listening and gazing , not with hope , but with mere yearning and unrest . This morning [he]38-silas had been told by [some of [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours]1447-some of his neighbours that it was New Year 's Eve , and that [he]38-silas must sit up and hear the old year rung out and the new rung in , because that was good luck , and might bring [his]38-silas money back again . This was only a friendly Raveloe - way of jesting with the half - crazy oddities of [a miser]673-a miser , but it had perhaps helped to throw [Silas]38-silas into a more than usually excited state . Since the on - coming of twilight [he]38-silas had opened [his]38-silas door again and again , though only to shut it immediately at seeing all distance veiled by the falling snow . But the last time [he]38-silas opened it the snow had ceased , and the clouds were parting here and there . [He]38-silas stood and listened , and gazed for a long while — there was really something on the road coming towards [him]38-silas then , but [he]38-silas caught no sign of it ; and the stillness and the wide trackless snow seemed to narrow [his]38-silas solitude , and touched [his]38-silas yearning with the chill of despair . [He]38-silas went in again , and put [his]38-silas right hand on the latch of the door to close it — but [he]38-silas did not close it : [he]38-silas was arrested , as [he]38-silas had been already since [his]38-silas loss , by the invisible wand of catalepsy , and stood like a graven image , with wide but sightless eyes , holding open [his]38-silas door , powerless to resist either the good or evil that might enter [there]2073-there . When [Marner]38-silas 's sensibility returned , [he]38-silas continued the action which had been arrested , and closed [his]38-silas door , unaware of the chasm in [his]38-silas consciousness , unaware of any intermediate change , except that the light had grown dim , and that [he]38-silas was chilled and faint . [He]38-silas thought [he]38-silas had been too long standing at the door and looking out . Turning towards the hearth , where the two logs had fallen apart , and sent forth only a red uncertain glimmer , [he]38-silas seated [himself]38-silas on [his]38-silas fireside chair , and was stooping to push [his]38-silas logs together , when , to [his]38-silas blurred vision , it seemed as if there were gold on the floor in front of the hearth . Gold!—his own gold — brought back to [him]38-silas as mysteriously as it had been taken away ! [He]38-silas felt [his]38-silas heart begin to beat violently , and for a few moments [he]38-silas was unable to stretch out [his]38-silas hand and grasp the restored treasure . The heap of gold seemed to glow and get larger beneath [his]38-silas agitated gaze . [He]38-silas leaned forward at last , and stretched forth [his]38-silas hand ; but instead of the hard coin with the familiar resisting outline , [his]38-silas fingers encountered soft warm curls . In utter amazement , [Silas]38-silas fell on [his]38-silas knees and bent [his]38-silas head low to examine the marvel : it was [a sleeping child]1451-a sleeping child — a round , fair thing , with soft yellow rings all over its head . Could this be [[his]38-silas little sister]1452-his little sister come back to [him]38-silas in a dream — [[his]38-silas little sister whom [he]38-silas had carried about in [his]38-silas arms]1453-his little sister whom he had carried about in his arms for a year before [she]1453-his little sister whom he had carried about in his arms died , when [he]38-silas was [a small boy without shoes or stockings]1454-a small boy without shoes or stockings ? That was the first thought that darted across [Silas]38-silas 's blank wonderment . Was it a dream ? [He]38-silas rose to [his]38-silas feet again , pushed [his]38-silas logs together , and , throwing on some dried leaves and sticks , raised a flame ; but the flame did not disperse the vision — it only lit up more distinctly the little round form of [the child]451-the child and [its]451-the child shabby clothing . It was very much like [[his]38-silas little sister]1452-his little sister . [Silas]38-silas sank into [his]38-silas chair powerless , under the double presence of an inexplicable surprise and a hurrying influx of memories . How and when had [the child]451-the child come in without [his]38-silas knowledge ? [He]38-silas had never been beyond the door . But along with that question , and almost thrusting it away , there was a vision of [the old home]1458-the old home and [the old streets leading to [Lantern Yard]7-lantern yard]1459-the old streets leading to lantern yard — and within that vision another , of the thoughts which had been present with [him]38-silas in those far - off scenes . The thoughts were strange to [him]38-silas now , like old friendships impossible to revive ; and yet [he]38-silas had a dreamy feeling that [this child]1460-this child was somehow a message come to [him]38-silas from that far - off life : it stirred fibres that had never been moved in [Raveloe]1-raveloe — old quiverings of tenderness — old impressions of awe at the presentiment of some Power presiding over [his]38-silas life ; for [his]38-silas imagination had not yet extricated itself from the sense of mystery in [the child]451-the child 's sudden presence , and had formed no conjectures of ordinary natural means by which the event could have been brought about . But there was a cry on the hearth : [the child]451-the child had awaked , and [Marner]38-silas stooped to lift [it]451-the child on [his]38-silas knee . It clung round [his]38-silas neck , and burst louder and louder into that mingling of inarticulate cries with " mammy "[38-silas] by which [little children]1463-little children express the bewilderment of waking . [Silas]38-silas pressed it to [him]38-silas , and almost unconsciously uttered sounds of hushing tenderness , while [he]38-silas bethought [himself]38-silas that some of [his]38-silas porridge , which had got cool by the dying fire , would do to feed [the child]451-the child with if it were only warmed up a little . [He]38-silas had plenty to do through the next hour . The porridge , sweetened with some dry brown sugar from [an old store which [he]38-silas had refrained from using for [himself]38-silas]1465-an old store which he had refrained from using for himself , stopped the cries of [the little one]1432-the little one , and made [her]1432-the little one lift [her]1432-the little one blue eyes with a wide quiet gaze at [Silas]38-silas , as [he]38-silas put the spoon into [her]1432-the little one mouth . Presently [she]1432-the little one slipped from [his]38-silas knee and began to toddle about , but with a pretty stagger that made [Silas]38-silas jump up and follow [her]1432-the little one lest [she]1432-the little one should fall against anything that would hurt [her]1432-the little one . But [she]1432-the little one only fell in a sitting posture on the ground , and began to pull at [her]1432-the little one boots , looking up at [him]38-silas with a crying face as if the boots hurt [her]1432-the little one . [He]38-silas took [her]1432-the little one on [his]38-silas knee again , but it was some time before it occurred to [Silas]38-silas 's dull bachelor mind that the wet boots were the grievance , pressing on [her]1432-the little one warm ankles . [He]38-silas got them off with difficulty , and [baby]1467-baby was at once happily occupied with the primary mystery of [her]1432-the little one own toes , inviting [Silas]38-silas , with much chuckling , to consider the mystery too . But the wet boots had at last suggested to [Silas]38-silas that [the child]451-the child had been walking on the snow , and this roused [him]38-silas from [his]38-silas entire oblivion of any ordinary means by which [it]1469-it could have entered or been brought into [[his]38-silas house]703-his house . Under the prompting of this new idea , and without waiting to form conjectures , [he]38-silas raised [the child]451-the child in [his]38-silas arms , and went to the door . As soon as [he]38-silas had opened it , there was the cry of " mammy "[38-silas] again , which [Silas]38-silas had not heard since [the child]451-the child 's first hungry waking . Bending forward , [he]38-silas could just discern the marks made by the little feet on [the virgin snow]1473-the virgin snow , and [he]38-silas followed [their]1474-their track to the furze bushes . " Mammy ! "[1432-the little one] [the little one]1432-the little one cried again and again , stretching itself forward so as almost to escape from [Silas]38-silas 's arms , before [he]38-silas [himself]38-silas was aware that there was something more than the bush before [him]38-silas — that there was a human body , with the head sunk low in the furze , and half - covered with the shaken snow . It was after the early supper - time at [the Red House]533-the red house , and the entertainment was in that stage when bashfulness itself had passed into easy jollity , when [gentlemen , conscious of unusual accomplishments , could at length be prevailed on to dance a hornpipe]1477-gentlemen , conscious of unusual accomplishments , could at length be prevailed on to dance a hornpipe , and when [the Squire]531-the squire preferred talking loudly , scattering snuff , and patting [[his]531-the squire visitors]1479-his visitors ' backs , to sitting longer at the whist - table — a choice exasperating to [uncle Kimble]119-mrs kimble , who , being always volatile in sober business hours , became intense and bitter over cards and brandy , shuffled before [[his]119-mrs kimble adversary]1480-his adversary 's deal with a glare of suspicion , and turned up a mean trump - card with an air of inexpressible disgust , as if in a world where such things could happen one might as well enter on a course of reckless profligacy . When the evening had advanced to this pitch of freedom and enjoyment , it was usual for [the servants]1481-the servants , the heavy duties of supper being well over , to get [their]1481-the servants share of amusement by coming to look on at the dancing ; so that [the back regions of [the house]334-the house]1482-the back regions of the house were left in solitude . There were two doors by which [the White Parlour]2578-the white parlour was entered from [the hall]1211-the hall , and [they]1486-they were both standing open for the sake of air ; but [the lower one]1487-the lower one was crowded with [the servants]1481-the servants and [villagers]194-villagers , and only the upper doorway was left free . [Bob Cass]72-bob was figuring in a hornpipe , and [[his]72-bob father]592-his father , very proud of [this lithe son , whom [he]592-his father repeatedly declared to be just like [himself]592-his father in [his]592-his father young days , in a tone that implied this to be the very highest stamp of juvenile merit]1491-this lithe son , whom he repeatedly declared to be just like himself in his young days , in a tone that implied this to be the very highest stamp of juvenile merit , was the centre of [a group who had placed [themselves]1492-a group who had placed themselves opposite the performer , not far from the upper door opposite [the performer]1493-the performer , not far from the upper door]1492-a group who had placed themselves opposite the performer , not far from the upper door . [Godfrey]66-godfrey was standing a little way off , not to admire [[his]66-godfrey brother]555-his brother 's dancing , but to keep sight of [[Nancy]67-nancy , who was seated in the group , near [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father]1495-nancy , who was seated in the group , near her father . [He]66-godfrey stood aloof , because [he]66-godfrey wished to avoid suggesting [himself]66-godfrey as a subject for [the Squire]531-the squire 's fatherly jokes in connection with matrimony and [Miss Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy 's beauty , which were likely to become more and more explicit . But [he]66-godfrey had the prospect of dancing with [her]67-nancy again when the hornpipe was concluded , and in the meanwhile it was very pleasant to get long glances at [her]67-nancy quite unobserved . But when [Godfrey]66-godfrey was lifting [his]66-godfrey eyes from one of those long glances , [they]1498-they encountered an object as startling to [him]66-godfrey at that moment as if it had been [an apparition from the dead]1499-an apparition from the dead . It was an apparition from that hidden life which lies , like [a dark by - street]1500-a dark by - street , behing the goodly ornamented facade that meets the sunlight and the gaze of [respectable admirers]1501-respectable admirers . It was [[his]66-godfrey own child]1502-his own child , carried in [Silas Marner]38-silas 's arms . That was [his]66-godfrey instantaneous impression , unaccompanied by doubt , though [he]66-godfrey had not seen [the child]451-the child for months past ; and when the hope was rising that [he]66-godfrey might possibly be mistaken , [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp and [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter had already advanced to [Silas]38-silas , in astonishment at this strange advent . [Godfrey]66-godfrey joined [them]1498-they immediately , unable to rest without hearing every word — trying to control [himself]66-godfrey , but conscious that if [any one]1504-any one noticed [him]66-godfrey , [they]1504-any one must see that [he]66-godfrey was white - lipped and trembling . But now all eyes at that end of [the room]611-the room were bent on [Silas Marner]38-silas ; [the Squire]531-the squire [himself]531-the squire had risen , and asked angrily , " How 's this ? — what 's this?—what do [you]38-silas do coming in here in this way ? "[531-the squire] " [I]38-silas 'm come for [the doctor]216-the doctor — [I]38-silas want [the doctor]216-the doctor , "[38-silas] [Silas]38-silas had said , in the first moment , to [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp . " Why , what 's the matter , [Marner]38-silas ? "[911-the rector] said [the rector]911-the rector . " [The doctor]216-the doctor 's [here]2143-here ; but say quietly what [you]38-silas want [him]216-the doctor for . " [She]2412-a woman 's dead , [I]66-godfrey think — dead in the snow at [the Stone - pits]658-the stone - pits — not far from [my]66-godfrey door . "[66-godfrey] [Godfrey]66-godfrey felt a great throb : there was one terror in [his]66-godfrey mind at that moment : it was , that [the woman]1508-the woman might not be dead . That was an evil terror — [an ugly inmate]1509-an ugly inmate to have found a nestling - place in [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's kindly disposition ; but no disposition is a security from evil wishes to [a man whose happiness hangs on duplicity]1510-a man whose happiness hangs on duplicity . "[38-silas] [The child , no longer distracted by the bright light and the smiling women]1524-the child , no longer distracted by the bright light and the smiling women 's faces , began to cry and call for " mammy , "[115-mr kimble] though always clinging to [Marner]38-silas , who had apparently won [her]1525-her thorough confidence . But [the doctor]216-the doctor was out of hearing . [Godfrey]66-godfrey , too , had disappeared : [he]66-godfrey was gone to snatch [his]66-godfrey hat and coat , having just reflection enough to remember that [he]66-godfrey must not look like [a madman]2298-a madman ; but [he]66-godfrey rushed out of [the house]334-the house into the snow without heeding [his]66-godfrey thin shoes . In a few minutes [he]66-godfrey was on [his]66-godfrey rapid way to the Stone - pits by the side of [Dolly]113-dolly , who , though feeling that [she]113-dolly was entirely in [her]113-dolly place in encountering cold and snow on an errand of mercy , was much concerned at [a young gentleman]650-a young gentleman 's getting [his]650-a young gentleman feet wet under a like impulse . " [You]66-godfrey can come and tell [me]66-godfrey if [I]66-godfrey can do anything . "[66-godfrey] " Well , [sir]2360-sir , [you]2360-sir 're very good : [you]2360-sir 've a tender heart , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , going to the door . [Godfrey]66-godfrey was too painfully preoccupied to feel a twinge of self - reproach at this undeserved praise . [He]66-godfrey walked up and down , unconscious that [he]66-godfrey was plunging ankle - deep in snow , unconscious of everything but trembling suspense about what was going on in [the cottage]616-the cottage , and the effect of each alternative on [his]66-godfrey future lot . No , not quite unconscious of everything else . Deeper down , and half - smothered by passionate desire and dread , there was the sense that [he]66-godfrey ought not to be waiting on these alternatives ; that [he]66-godfrey ought to accept the consequences of [his]66-godfrey deeds , own [the miserable wife]1533-the miserable wife , and fulfil the claims of [the helpless child]1534-the helpless child . But [he]66-godfrey had not moral courage enough to contemplate that active renunciation of [Nancy]67-nancy as possible for [him]66-godfrey : [he]66-godfrey had only conscience and heart enough to make [him]66-godfrey for ever uneasy under the weakness that forbade the renunciation . And at this moment [his]66-godfrey mind leaped away from all restraint toward the sudden prospect of deliverance from [his]66-godfrey long bondage . " Is [she]67-nancy dead ? "[67-nancy] said the voice that predominated over every other within [him]66-godfrey . " If [she]67-nancy is , [I]67-nancy may marry [Nancy]67-nancy ; and then [I]67-nancy shall be [a good fellow]2357-a good fellow in future , and have no secrets , and [the child]451-the child — shall be taken care of somehow . "[67-nancy] But across that vision came the other possibility — " [She]67-nancy may live , and then it 's all up with [me]66-godfrey . "[66-godfrey] [Godfrey]66-godfrey never knew how long it was before the door of [the cottage]616-the cottage opened and [Mr Kimble]115-mr kimble came out . [He]66-godfrey went forward to meet [[his]66-godfrey uncle]1071-his uncle , prepared to suppress the agitation [he]66-godfrey must feel , whatever news [he]66-godfrey was to hear . [He]66-godfrey cast only one glance at the dead face on the pillow , which [Dolly]113-dolly had smoothed with decent care ; but [he]66-godfrey remembered that last look at [[his]66-godfrey unhappy hated wife]1538-his unhappy hated wife so well , that at the end of sixteen years every line in the worn face was present to [him]66-godfrey when [he]66-godfrey told the full story of this night . [He]66-godfrey turned immediately towards the hearth where [Silas Marner]38-silas sat lulling [the child]451-the child . [She]451-the child was perfectly quiet now , but not asleep — only soothed by sweet porridge and warmth into that wide - gazing calm which makes [us]1540-us [older human beings]1541-older human beings , with [our]1540-us inward turmoil , feel a certain awe in the presence of [a little child]1542-a little child , such as [we]1540-us feel before some quiet majesty or beauty in [the earth]2053-the earth or sky — before [a steady - glowing planet]1544-a steady - glowing planet , or a full - flowered eglantine , or the bending trees over [a silent pathway]1545-a silent pathway . The wide - open blue eyes looked up at [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's without any uneasiness or sign of recognition : [the child]451-the child could make no visible audible claim on [[its]451-the child father]1408-its father ; and [the father]2229-the father felt a strange mixture of feelings , a conflict of regret and joy , that the pulse of that little heart had no response for the half - jealous yearning in [his]2229-the father own , when the blue eyes turned away from [him]2229-the father slowly , and fixed themselves on [the weaver]209-the weaver 's queer face , which was bent low down to look at [them]1550-them , while the small hand began to pull [Marner]38-silas 's withered cheek with loving disfiguration . " [You]38-silas 'll take [the child]451-the child to [the parish]262-the parish tomorrow ? "[66-godfrey] asked [Godfrey]66-godfrey , speaking as indifferently as [he]66-godfrey could . " Who says so ? "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , sharply . " Will [they]2703-they make [me]38-silas take [her]451-the child ? "[38-silas] " Why , [you]38-silas would n't like to keep [her]451-the child , should [you]38-silas — [an old bachelor like [you]38-silas]2704-an old bachelor like you ?
