" Ah , [I]66-godfrey see it 's not [the same woman [I]66-godfrey saw]2709-the same woman i saw , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said , as [he]66-godfrey came up . " It 's [a pretty little child]2710-a pretty little child : [the old fellow]623-the old fellow seems to want to keep it ; that 's strange for [a miser like [him]623-the old fellow]2712-a miser like him . But [I]66-godfrey gave [him]623-the old fellow a trifle to help [him]623-the old fellow out : [the parish]262-the parish is n't likely to quarrel with [him]623-the old fellow for the right to keep [the child]451-the child . "[66-godfrey] " No ; but [I]66-godfrey 've seen the time when [I]66-godfrey might have quarrelled with [him]623-the old fellow for it [myself]66-godfrey . It 's too late now , though . If [the child]451-the child ran into the fire , [[your]2716-your aunt]2717-your aunt 's too fat to overtake it : [she]2717-your aunt could only sit and grunt like [an alarmed sow]2718-an alarmed sow . But what [a fool]2352-a fool [you]2716-your are , [Godfrey]66-godfrey , to come out in [your]2716-your dancing shoes and stockings in this way — and [[you]2716-your one of [the beaux of the evening]2721-the beaux of the evening , and at [[your]2716-your own house]2722-your own house]2720-you one of the beaux of the evening , and at your own house ! What do [you]2716-your mean by [such freaks]2723-such freaks , [young fellow]2724-young fellow ? Has [Miss Nancy]67-nancy been cruel , and do [you]2716-your want to spite [her]67-nancy by spoiling [your]2716-your pumps ? "[66-godfrey] " O , everything has been disagreeable to - night . [I]66-godfrey was tired to death of jigging and gallanting , and that bother about the horn - pipes . And [I]66-godfrey 'd got to dance with the other [Miss Gunn]125-miss gunn , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , glad of the subterfuge [[his]66-godfrey uncle]1071-his uncle had suggested to [him]66-godfrey . The prevarication and white lies which [a mind that keeps itself ambitiously pure]1553-a mind that keeps itself ambitiously pure is as uneasy under as [a great artist]1554-a great artist under the false touches that no eye detects but [his]1554-a great artist own , are worn as lightly as mere trimmings when once the actions have become a lie . [Godfrey]66-godfrey reappeared in the White Parlour with dry feet , and , since the truth must be told , with a sense of relief and gladness that was too strong for painful thoughts to struggle with . For could [he]66-godfrey not venture now , whenever opportunity offered , to say the tenderest things to [Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy — to promise [her]67-nancy and [himself]66-godfrey that [he]66-godfrey would always be just what [she]67-nancy would desire to see [him]66-godfrey ? There was no danger that [[his]66-godfrey dead wife]1555-his dead wife would be recognised : those were not days of active inquiry and wide report ; and as for the registry of [their]1556-their marriage , that was a long way off , buried in unturned pages , away from [every one]365-every one 's interest but [his]66-godfrey own . [Dunsey]104-dunsey might betray [him]66-godfrey if [he]66-godfrey came back ; but [Dunsey]104-dunsey might be won to silence . And when events turn out so much better for [a man]185-a man than [he]185-a man has had reason to dread , is it not a proof that [his]185-a man conduct has been less foolish and blameworthy than it might otherwise have appeared ? When [we]1559-we are treated well , [we]1559-we naturally begin to think that [we]1559-we are not altogether unmeritorious , and that it is only just [we]1559-we should treat [ourselves]1559-we well , and not mar [our]1559-we own good fortune . Where , after all , would be the use of [his]66-godfrey confessing the past to [Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy , and throwing away [his]66-godfrey happiness?—nay , [hers]67-nancy ? for [he]66-godfrey felt some confidence that [she]67-nancy loved [him]66-godfrey . As for [the child]451-the child , [he]66-godfrey would see that it was cared for : [he]66-godfrey would never forsake [it]451-the child ; [he]66-godfrey would do everything but own [it]451-the child . Perhaps [it]451-the child would be just as happy in life without being owned by [[its]451-the child father]1408-its father , seeing that [nobody]444-nobody could tell how things would turn out , and that — is there any other reason wanted ? — well , then , that [the father]2229-the father would be much happier without owning [the child]451-the child . There was [a pauper]1565-a pauper 's burial that week in [Raveloe]1-raveloe , and up [Kench Yard]32-kench yard at [Batherley]11-batherley it was known that [the dark - haired woman with the fair child]1566-the dark - haired woman with the fair child , who had lately come to lodge [there]2073-there , was gone away again . That was all the express note taken that [Molly]71-molly had disappeared from the eyes of [men]372-men . But the unwept death which , to [the general lot]1569-the general lot , seemed as trivial as the summer - shed leaf , was charged with the force of destiny to certain human lives that [we]1570-we know of , shaping [their]372-men joys and sorrows even to the end . [Silas Marner]38-silas 's determination to keep [the " tramp 's child]2725-the " tramp 's child "[2725-the " tramp 's child] was matter of hardly less surprising and iterated talk in [the village]247-the village than the robbery of [his]38-silas money . That softening of feeling towards [him]38-silas which dated from [his]38-silas misfortune , that merging of suspicion and dislike in a rather contemptuous pity for [him]38-silas as lone and crazy , was now accompanied with a more active sympathy , especially amongst [the women]2622-the women . [Notable mothers]1573-notable mothers , who knew what it was to keep [children]1574-children " whole and sweet ; "[1573-notable mothers] [lazy mothers , who knew what it was to be interrupted]1575-lazy mothers , who knew what it was to be interrupted in folding [their]1575-lazy mothers , who knew what it was to be interrupted arms and scratching [their]1575-lazy mothers , who knew what it was to be interrupted elbows by the mischievous propensities of [children]1574-children just firm on [their]1574-children legs , were equally interested in conjecturing how [a lone man]2481-a lone man would manage with [a two - year - old child]1578-a two - year - old child on [his]2481-a lone man hands , and were equally ready with [their]1573-notable mothers suggestions : [the notable chiefly]1579-the notable chiefly telling [him]38-silas what [he]38-silas had better do , and [the lazy ones]1580-the lazy ones being emphatic in telling [him]38-silas what [he]38-silas would never be able to do . Among [the notable mothers]1581-the notable mothers , [Dolly Winthrop]113-dolly was the one whose neighbourly offices were the most acceptable to [Marner]38-silas , for [they]1582-they were rendered without any show of bustling instruction . [Silas]38-silas had shown [her]113-dolly the half - guinea given to [him]38-silas by [Godfrey]66-godfrey , and had asked [her]113-dolly what [he]38-silas should do about getting some clothes for [the child]451-the child . " Eh , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , " there 's no call to buy , no more nor a pair o ' shoes ; for [I]113-dolly 've got the little petticoats as [Aaron]89-aaron wore five years ago , and it 's ill spending the money on [them]1584-them baby - clothes , for [the child]451-the child ' ull grow like grass [i]113-dolly ' May , bless it — that it will . "[113-dolly] And the same day [Dolly]113-dolly brought [her]113-dolly bundle , and displayed to [Marner]38-silas , one by one , the tiny garments in [their]1584-them due order of succession , most of them patched and darned , but clean and neat as fresh - sprung herbs . This was the introduction to a great ceremony with soap and water , from which [baby]1467-baby came out in new beauty , and sat on [Dolly]113-dolly 's knee , handling [her]113-dolly toes and chuckling and patting [her]113-dolly palms together with an air of having made several discoveries about [herself]113-dolly , which [she]113-dolly communicated by alternate sounds of " gug - gug - gug , "[113-dolly] and " mammy . "[113-dolly] The " mammy "[113-dolly] was not a cry of need or uneasiness : [Baby]143-baby had been used to utter it without expecting either tender sound or touch to follow . " [Anybody]263-anybody ' ud think the angils in [heaven]2728-heaven could n't be prettier , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , rubbing the golden curls and kissing them . " And to think of its being covered wi ' [them]1584-them dirty rags — and [the poor mother]2729-the poor mother — froze to death ; but there 's [Them]1584-them as took care of it , and brought [it]451-the child to [your]38-silas door , [Master Marner]42-master marner . The door was open , and it walked in over the snow , like as if it had been a little starved robin . Did n't [you]38-silas say the door was open ? "[113-dolly] " Yes , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , meditatively . " Yes — the door was open . The money 's gone [I]38-silas do n't know where , and this is come from [I]38-silas do n't know where . "[38-silas] [He]38-silas had not mentioned to any one [his]38-silas unconsciousness of [the child]451-the child 's entrance , shrinking from questions which might lead to the fact [he]38-silas [himself]38-silas suspected — namely , that [he]38-silas had been in one of [his]38-silas trances . " Ah , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , with soothing gravity , " it 's like the night and the morning , and the sleeping and the waking , and the rain and the harvest — one goes and the other comes , and [we]2730-we know nothing how nor where . [We]2730-we may strive and scrat and fend , but it 's little [we]2730-we can do arter all — the big things come and go wi ' no striving o ' our'n — [they]1584-them do , that [they]1584-them do ; and [I]113-dolly think [you]38-silas 're in the right on it to keep [the little un]2731-the little un , [Master Marner]42-master marner , seeing as it 's been sent to [you]38-silas , though there 's [folks as thinks different]2732-folks as thinks different . [You]38-silas 'll happen be a bit moithered with it while it 's so little ; but [I]113-dolly 'll come , and welcome , and see to it for [you]38-silas : [I]113-dolly 've a bit o ' time to spare most days , for when [one]2512-one gets up be - times [i]113-dolly ' the morning , the clock seems to stan ' still tow'rt ten , afore it 's time to go about the victual . So , as [I]113-dolly say , [I]113-dolly 'll come and see to [the child]451-the child for [you]38-silas , and welcome . "[113-dolly] " Thank [you]113-dolly ... kindly , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , hesitating a little . " [I]38-silas 'll be glad if [you]113-dolly 'll tell [me]38-silas things . But , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas added , uneasily , leaning forward to look at [Baby]143-baby with some jealousy , as [she]143-baby was resting [her]143-baby head backward against [Dolly]113-dolly 's arm , and eyeing [him]38-silas contentedly from a distance—"But [I]143-baby want to do things for it [myself]143-baby , else it may get fond o ' [somebody else]739-somebody else , and not fond o ' [me]143-baby . [I]143-baby 've been used to fending for [myself]143-baby in [the house]334-the house — [I]143-baby can learn , [I]143-baby can learn . "[143-baby] " Eh , to be sure , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , gently . " [I]113-dolly 've seen [men]372-men as are [wonderful handy wi ' [children]1574-children]2738-wonderful handy wi ' children . [The men]2536-the men are awk'ard and contrairy mostly , [God]128-god help ['em]2741-'em — but when the drink 's out of 'em , [they]2536-the men are n't unsensible , though [they]2536-the men 're bad for leeching and bandaging — so fiery and unpatient . [You]38-silas see this goes first , next the skin , "[113-dolly] proceeded [Dolly]113-dolly , taking up the little shirt , and putting it on . " Yes , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , docilely , bringing [his]38-silas eyes very close , that they might be initiated in the mysteries ; whereupon [Baby]143-baby seized [his]38-silas head with both [her]143-baby small arms , and put [her]143-baby lips against [his]38-silas face with purring noises . " See there , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , with [a woman]2412-a woman 's tender tact , " [she]143-baby 's fondest o ' [you]38-silas . [She]143-baby wants to go o ' [your]38-silas lap , [I]113-dolly 'll be bound . Go , then : take [her]143-baby , [Master Marner]42-master marner ; [you]38-silas can put the things on , and then [you]38-silas can say as [you]38-silas 've done for [her]143-baby from the first of [her]143-baby coming to [you]38-silas . "[113-dolly] [Marner]38-silas took [her]143-baby on [his]38-silas lap , trembling with an emotion mysterious to [himself]38-silas , at something unknown dawning on [his]38-silas life . Thought and feeling were so confused within [him]38-silas , that if [he]38-silas had tried to give [them]1588-them utterance , [he]38-silas could only have said that [the child]451-the child was come instead of the gold — that the gold had turned into [the child]451-the child . [He]38-silas took the garments from [Dolly]113-dolly , and put them on under [her]113-dolly teaching ; interrupted , of course , by [Baby]143-baby 's gymnastics . " There , then ! why , [you]38-silas take to it quite easy , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly ; " but what shall [you]38-silas do when [you]38-silas 're forced to sit in [[your]38-silas loom]2742-your loom ? For [she]451-the child 'll get busier and mischievouser every day — [she]451-the child will , bless [her]451-the child . It 's lucky as [you]38-silas 've got that high hearth [i'stead]2743-i'stead of a grate , for that keeps the fire more out of [her]451-the child reach ; but if [you]38-silas 've got anything as can be spilt or broke , or as is fit to cut [her]451-the child fingers off , [she]451-the child 'll be at it — and it is but right [you]38-silas should know . "[113-dolly] [Silas]38-silas meditated a little while in some perplexity . " [I]38-silas 'll tie [her]451-the child to the leg o ' the loom , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas said at last—"tie [her]451-the child with a good long strip o ' something . "[38-silas] " Well , mayhap that 'll do , as it 's a little gell , for [they]2744-they 're easier persuaded to sit [i]38-silas ' one place nor [the lads]2745-the lads . [I]38-silas know what [the lads]2745-the lads are ; for [I]38-silas 've had four — four [I]38-silas 've had , God knows — and if [you]38-silas was to take and tie ['em]451-the child up , [they]2745-the lads 'd make a fighting and a crying as if [you]38-silas was ringing pigs . But [I]38-silas 'll bring [you]38-silas [my]38-silas little chair , and some bits o ' red rag and things for [her]451-the child to play wi ' ; an ' [she]451-the child 'll sit and chatter to ['em]451-the child as if [they]2744-they was alive . Eh , if it was n't a sin to [the lads]2745-the lads to wish 'em made different , bless 'em , [I]38-silas should ha ' been glad for one of 'em to be [a little gell]2748-a little gell ; and to think as [I]38-silas could [ha]2749-ha ' taught [her]451-the child to scour , and mend , and the knitting , and everything . But [I]38-silas can teach ['em]451-the child [this little un]2750-this little un , [Master Marner]42-master marner , when [she]451-the child gets old enough . "[38-silas] " But [she]451-the child 'll be [my]38-silas little un , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , rather hastily . " [She]451-the child 'll be [nobody else]2422-nobody else 's . "[38-silas] " No , to be sure ; [you]42-master marner 'll have a right to [her]451-the child if [you]42-master marner 're [a father to [her]451-the child]2752-a father to her , and bring [her]451-the child up according . But , "[113-dolly] added [Dolly]113-dolly , coming to a point which [she]113-dolly had determined beforehand to touch upon , " [you]42-master marner must bring [her]451-the child up like [[christened folk]2753-christened folk 's children]2754-christened folk 's children , and take [her]451-the child to [church]363-church , and let [her]451-the child learn [her]451-the child catechise , as [[my]113-dolly little [Aaron]89-aaron]2756-my little aaron can say off — the ' [I]113-dolly believe , ' and everything , and ' hurt [nobody]444-nobody by word or deed , ' — as well as if [he]89-aaron was [the clerk]2758-the clerk . That 's what [you]38-silas must do , [Master Marner]42-master marner , if [you]38-silas 'd do the right thing by [the orphin child]2759-the orphin child . "[113-dolly] [Marner]38-silas 's pale face flushed suddenly under a new anxiety . [His]38-silas mind was too busy trying to give some definite bearing to [Dolly]113-dolly 's words for [him]38-silas to think of answering [her]113-dolly . " And it 's [my]113-dolly belief , "[113-dolly] [she]113-dolly went on , " as [the poor little creatur]2760-the poor little creatur has never been christened , and it 's nothing but right as [the parson]273-the parson should be spoke to ; and if [you]38-silas was noways unwilling , [I]113-dolly 'd talk to [Mr Macey]41-mr macey about it this very day . For if [the child]451-the child ever went anyways wrong , and [you]38-silas had n't done [your]38-silas part by it , [Master Marner—'noculation]144-master marner—'noculation , and everything to save it from harm — it ' ud be a thorn [i]113-dolly ' [your]38-silas bed for ever o ' this side the grave ; and [I]113-dolly ca n't think as it ' ud be easy lying down for [anybody]263-anybody when [they]263-anybody 'd got to [another world]2764-another world , if [they]263-anybody had n't done [their]263-anybody part by [the helpless children]2765-the helpless children as come wi'out [their]263-anybody own asking . "[113-dolly] [Dolly]113-dolly [herself]113-dolly was disposed to be silent for some time now , for [she]113-dolly had spoken from the depths of [her]113-dolly own simple belief , and was much concerned to know whether [her]113-dolly words would produce the desired effect on [Silas]38-silas . [He]38-silas was puzzled and anxious , for [Dolly]113-dolly 's word " christened "[113-dolly] conveyed no distinct meaning to [him]38-silas . [He]38-silas had only heard of baptism , and had only seen the baptism of [grown - up men]1591-grown - up men and [women]409-women . " What is it as [you]113-dolly mean by ' christened ' ? "[38-silas] [he]38-silas said at last , timidly . " Wo n't [folks]214-folks be good to [her]113-dolly without it ? "[38-silas] " [Dear]2767-dear , [dear]2767-dear ! [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , with gentle distress and compassion . " Had [you]38-silas never [no father]2707-no father nor [mother]189-mother as taught [you]38-silas to say [your]38-silas prayers , and as there 's good words and good things to keep [us]2771-us from harm ? "[113-dolly] " Yes , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , in a low voice ; " [I]38-silas know a deal about that — used to , used to . But [your]113-dolly ways are different : [[my]38-silas country]2772-my country was a good way off . "[38-silas] [He]38-silas paused a few moments , and then added , more decidedly , " But [I]38-silas want to do everything as can be done for [the child]451-the child . And whatever 's right for it [i]38-silas ' [this country]2164-this country , and [you]113-dolly think ' ull do it good , [I]38-silas 'll act according , if [you]113-dolly 'll tell [me]38-silas . "[38-silas] " Well , then , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , inwardly rejoiced , " [I]113-dolly 'll ask [Mr Macey]41-mr macey to speak to [the parson]273-the parson about it ; and [you]41-mr macey must fix on a name for it , because it must have a name giv ' it when it 's christened . "[113-dolly] " [[My]38-silas mother]2776-my mother 's name was [Hephzibah]145-hephzibah , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , " and [[my]38-silas little sister]2777-my little sister was named after [her]2776-my mother . "[38-silas] " Eh , that 's a hard name , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly . " [I]113-dolly partly think it is n't a christened name . "[113-dolly] " It 's a Bible name , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , old ideas recurring . " Then [I]113-dolly 've no call to speak again ' it , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , rather startled by [Silas]38-silas 's knowledge on this head ; " but [you]38-silas see [I]113-dolly 'm [no scholard]2778-no scholard , and [I]113-dolly 'm slow at catching the words . [[My]113-dolly husband]2688-my husband says [I]113-dolly 'm allays like as if [I]113-dolly was putting the haft for the handle — that 's what [he]2688-my husband says — for [he]2688-my husband 's very sharp , [God]128-god help [him]2688-my husband . But it was awk'ard calling [[your]38-silas little sister]2780-your little sister by such a hard name , when [you]38-silas 'd got nothing big to say , like — wasn't it , [Master Marner]42-master marner ? "[113-dolly] " [We]2781-we called [her]2780-your little sister [Eppie]146-eppie , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas . " Well , if it was noways wrong to shorten the name , it ' ud be a deal handier . And so [I]38-silas 'll go now , [Master Marner]42-master marner , and [I]38-silas 'll speak about the christening afore dark ; and [I]38-silas wish [you]38-silas the best o ' luck , and it 's [my]38-silas belief as it 'll come to [you]38-silas , if [you]38-silas do what 's right by [the orphin child]2759-the orphin child ; — and there 's the ' noculation to be seen to ; and as to washing its bits o ' things , [you]38-silas need look to [nobody]444-nobody but [me]38-silas , for [I]38-silas can do 'em wi ' one hand when [I]38-silas 've got [my]38-silas suds about . Eh , [the blessed angil]2784-the blessed angil ! [You]38-silas 'll let [me]38-silas bring [my]38-silas Aaron one o ' these days , and [he]38-silas 'll show [her]2784-the blessed angil [[his]38-silas little cart]2785-his little cart as [[his]38-silas father]592-his father 's made for [him]38-silas , and the black - and - white pup as [he]38-silas 's got a - rearing . "[38-silas] [Baby]143-baby was christened , [the rector]911-the rector deciding that a double baptism was the lesser risk to incur ; and on this occasion [Silas]38-silas , making [himself]38-silas as clean and tidy as [he]38-silas could , appeared for the first time within [the church]322-the church , and shared in the observances held sacred by [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours . [He]38-silas was quite unable , by means of anything [he]38-silas heard or saw , to identify the Raveloe religion with [his]38-silas old faith : if [he]38-silas could at any time in [his]38-silas previous life have done so , it must have been by the aid of a strong feeling ready to vibrate with sympathy , rather than by a comparison of phrases and ideas ; and now for long years that feeling had been dormant . [He]38-silas had no distinct idea about the baptism and the church - going , except that [Dolly]113-dolly had said it was for the good of [the child]451-the child ; and in this way , as the weeks grew to months , [the child]451-the child created fresh and fresh links between [his]38-silas life and the lives from which [he]38-silas had hitherto shrunk continually into narrower isolation . Unlike the gold which needed nothing , and must be worshipped in close - locked solitude — which was hidden away from the daylight , was deaf to the song of birds , and started to no human tones — [Eppie]146-eppie was [a creature of endless claims and ever - growing desires , seeking and loving sunshine , and living sounds , and living movements]1598-a creature of endless claims and ever - growing desires , seeking and loving sunshine , and living sounds , and living movements ; making trial of everything , with trust in new joy , and stirring the human kindness in all eyes that looked on [her]146-eppie . The gold had kept [his]38-silas thoughts in an ever - repeated circle , leading to nothing beyond itself ; but [Eppie]146-eppie was an object compacted of changes and hopes that forced [his]38-silas thoughts onward , and carried [them]1599-them far away from [their]1599-them old eager pacing towards the same blank limit — carried [them]1599-them away to the new things that would come with the coming years , when [Eppie]146-eppie would have learned to understand how [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father [Silas]38-silas cared for [her]146-eppie ; and made [him]38-silas look for images of that time in the ties and charities that bound together [the families of [[his]38-silas neighbours]435-his neighbours]1601-the families of his neighbours . The gold had asked that [he]38-silas should sit weaving longer and longer , deafened and blinded more and more to all things except the monotony of [his]38-silas loom and the repetition of [his]38-silas web ; but [Eppie]146-eppie called [him]38-silas away from [his]38-silas weaving , and made [him]38-silas think all its pauses a holiday , reawakening [his]38-silas senses with [her]146-eppie fresh life , even to the old winter - flies that came crawling forth in the early spring sunshine , and warming [him]38-silas into joy because [she]146-eppie had joy . And when the sunshine grew strong and lasting , so that the buttercups were thick in [the meadows]1603-the meadows , [Silas]38-silas might be seen in the sunny mid - day , or in the late afternoon when the shadows were lengthening under the hedgerows , strolling out with uncovered head to carry [Eppie]146-eppie beyond [the Stone - pits]658-the stone - pits to where the flowers grew , till [they]1605-they reached some favourite bank where [he]38-silas could sit down , while [Eppie]146-eppie toddled to pluck the flowers , and make remarks to the winged things that murmured happily above the bright petals , calling " [Dad - dad]147-dad - dad 's "[146-eppie] attention continually by bringing [him]38-silas the flowers . Then [she]146-eppie would turn [her]146-eppie ear to some sudden bird - note , and [Silas]38-silas learned to please [her]146-eppie by making signs of hushed stillness , that [they]1605-they might listen for the note to come again : so that when it came , [she]146-eppie set up [her]146-eppie small back and laughed with gurgling triumph . Sitting on [the banks]1606-the banks in this way , [Silas]38-silas began to look for the once familiar herbs again ; and as the leaves , with their unchanged outline and markings , lay on [his]38-silas palm , there was a sense of crowding remembrances from which [he]38-silas turned away timidly , taking refuge in [Eppie]146-eppie 's little world , that lay lightly on [his]38-silas enfeebled spirit . As [the child]451-the child 's mind was growing into knowledge , [his]38-silas mind was growing into memory : as [her]146-eppie life unforlded , [his]38-silas soul , long stupefied in a cold narrow prison , was unfolding too , and trembling gradually into full consciousness . It was an influence which must gather force with every new year : the tones that stirred [Silas]38-silas 's heart grew articulate , and called for more distinct answers ; shapes and sounds grew clearer for [Eppie]146-eppie 's eyes and ears , and there was more that " [Dad - dad]147-dad - dad "[38-silas] was imperatively required to notice and account for . Also , by the time [Eppie]146-eppie was three years old , [she]146-eppie developed a fine capacity for mischief , and for devising ingenious ways of being troublesome , which found much exercise , not only for [Silas]38-silas 's patience , but for [his]38-silas watchfulness and penetration . [Sorely]148-sorely was poor [Silas]38-silas puzzled on such occasions by the incompatible demands of love . [Dolly Winthrop]113-dolly told [him]38-silas punishment was good for [Eppie]146-eppie , and that , as for rearing [a child]2502-a child without making it tingle a little in soft and safe places now and then , it was not to be done . " To be sure , there 's another thing [you]38-silas might do , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] added [Dolly]113-dolly , meditatively : " [you]38-silas might shut [her]146-eppie up once [i]113-dolly ' the coal - hole . That was what [I]113-dolly did wi ' [Aaron]89-aaron ; for [I]113-dolly was that silly wi ' [the youngest lad]2787-the youngest lad , as [I]113-dolly could never bear to smack [him]89-aaron . Not as [I]113-dolly could find [i]113-dolly ' [my]113-dolly heart to let [him]89-aaron stay [i]113-dolly ' the coal - hole more nor a minute , but it was enough to colly [him]89-aaron all over , so as [he]89-aaron must be new washed and dressed , and it was as good as a rod to [him]89-aaron — that was . But [I]113-dolly put it upo ' [your]38-silas conscience , [Master Marner]42-master marner , as there 's one of 'em [you]38-silas must choose — ayther smacking or the coal - hole — else [she]146-eppie 'll get so masterful , there 'll be no holding [her]146-eppie . "[113-dolly] [Silas]38-silas was impressed with the melancholy truth of this last remark ; but [his]38-silas force of mind failed before the only two penal methods open to [him]38-silas , not only because it was painful to [him]38-silas to hurt [Eppie]146-eppie , but because [he]38-silas trembled at a moment 's contention with [her]146-eppie , lest [she]146-eppie should love [him]38-silas the less for it . Let even [an affectionate Goliath]1609-an affectionate goliath get [himself]1609-an affectionate goliath tied to a small tender thing , dreading to hurt it by pulling , and dreading still more to snap the cord , and which of the two , pray , will be [master]2433-master ? It was clear that [Eppie]146-eppie , with [her]146-eppie short toddling steps , must lead [father Silas]38-silas a pretty dance on any fine morning when circumstances favoured mischief . For example . [He]38-silas had wisely chosen a broad strip of linen as a means of fastening [her]146-eppie to [[his]38-silas loom]424-his loom when [he]38-silas was busy : it made a broad belt round [her]146-eppie waist , and was long enough to allow of [her]146-eppie reaching the truckle - bed and sitting down on it , but not long enough for [her]146-eppie to attempt any dangerous climbing . One bright summer 's morning [Silas]38-silas had been more engrossed than usual in " setting up "[38-silas] a new piece of work , an occasion on which [his]38-silas scissors were in requisition . These scissors , owing to an especial warning of [Dolly]113-dolly 's , had been kept carefully out of [Eppie]146-eppie 's reach ; but the click of them had had a peculiar attraction for [her]146-eppie ear , and , watching the results of that click , [she]146-eppie had derived the philosophic lesson that the same cause would produce the same effect . [Silas]38-silas had seated [himself]38-silas in [[his]38-silas loom]424-his loom , and the noise of weaving had begun ; but [he]38-silas had left [his]38-silas scissors on a ledge which [Eppie]146-eppie 's arm was long enough to reach ; and now , like a small mouse , watching [her]146-eppie opportunity , [she]146-eppie stole quietly from [her]146-eppie corner , secured the scissors , and toddled to the bed again , setting up [her]146-eppie back as a mode of concealing the fact . [She]146-eppie had a distinct intention as to the use of the scissors ; and having cut the linen strip in a jagged but effectual manner , in two moments [she]146-eppie had run out at the open door where the sunshine was inviting [her]146-eppie , while poor [Silas]38-silas believed [her]146-eppie to be [a better child than usual]1613-a better child than usual . It was not until [he]38-silas happened to need [his]38-silas scissors that the terrible fact burst upon [him]38-silas : [Eppie]146-eppie had run out by [herself]146-eppie — had perhaps fallen into the Stone - pit . [Silas]38-silas , shaken by the worst fear that could have befallen [him]38-silas , rushed out , calling " [Eppie]146-eppie ! "[38-silas] and ran eagerly about [the unenclosed space]1614-the unenclosed space , exploring the dry cavities into which [she]146-eppie might have fallen , and then gazing with questioning dread at the smooth red surface of [the water]1615-the water . The cold drops stood on [his]38-silas brow . How long had [she]146-eppie been out ? There was one hope — that [she]146-eppie had crept through the stile and got into [the fields where [he]38-silas habitually took [her]146-eppie to stroll]1616-the fields where he habitually took her to stroll . But the grass was high in [the meadow]1617-the meadow , and there was no descrying [her]146-eppie , if [she]146-eppie were there , except by a close search that would be a trespass on [[Mr Osgood]59-mr osgood 's crop]1618-mr osgood 's crop . Still , that misdemeanour must be committed ; and [poor [Silas]38-silas]1619-poor silas , after peering all round the hedgerows , traversed the grass , beginning with perturbed vision to see [Eppie]146-eppie behind every group of red sorrel , and to see [her]146-eppie moving always farther off as [he]38-silas approached . [The meadow]1617-the meadow was searched in vain ; and [he]38-silas got over [the stile]1621-the stile into [the next field]1622-the next field , looking with dying hope towards [a small pond which was now reduced to [its]1623-a small pond which was now reduced to its summer shallowness summer shallowness]1623-a small pond which was now reduced to its summer shallowness , so as to leave a wide margin of good adhesive mud . Here , however , sat [Eppie]146-eppie , discoursing cheerfully to [her]146-eppie own small boot , which [she]146-eppie was using as a bucket to convey the water into a deep hoof - mark , while [her]146-eppie little naked foot was planted comfortably on a cushion of olive - green mud . A red - headed calf was observing [her]146-eppie with alarmed doubt through the opposite hedge . Here was clearly a case of aberration in [a christened child which demanded severe treatment]1624-a christened child which demanded severe treatment ; but [Silas]38-silas , overcome with convulsive joy at finding [his]38-silas treasure again , could do nothing but snatch [her]146-eppie up , and cover [her]146-eppie with half - sobbing kisses . It was not until [he]38-silas had carried [her]146-eppie [home]374-home , and had begun to think of the necessary washing , that [he]38-silas recollected the need that [he]38-silas should punish [Eppie]146-eppie , and " make [her]146-eppie remember . "[38-silas] The idea that [she]146-eppie might run away again and come to harm , gave [him]38-silas unusual resolution , and for the first time [he]38-silas determined to try [the coal - hole]1626-the coal - hole — [a small closet near the hearth]1627-a small closet near the hearth . " Naughty , [naughty Eppie]146-eppie , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas suddenly began , holding [her]146-eppie on [his]38-silas knee , and pointing to [her]146-eppie muddy feet and clothes—"naughty to cut with the scissors , and run away . [Eppie]146-eppie must go into [the coal - hole]1626-the coal - hole for being naughty . [Daddy]149-daddy must put [her]146-eppie in [the coal - hole]1626-the coal - hole . "[38-silas] [He]38-silas half expected that this would be shock enough , and that [Eppie]146-eppie would begin to cry . But instead of that , [she]146-eppie began to shake [herself]146-eppie on [his]38-silas knee , as if the proposition opened a pleasing novelty . Seeing that [he]38-silas must proceed to extremities , [he]38-silas put [her]146-eppie into the coal - hole , and held the door closed , with a trembling sense that [he]38-silas was using a strong measure . For a moment there was silence , but then came a little cry , " Opy , [opy]2790-opy ! "[38-silas] and [Silas]38-silas let [her]146-eppie out again , saying , " Now [Eppie]146-eppie ' ull never be naughty again , else [she]146-eppie must go in [the coal - hole]1626-the coal - hole — a black naughty place . "[38-silas] The weaving must stand still a long while this morning , for now [Eppie]146-eppie must be washed and have clean clothes on ; but it was to be hoped that this punishment would have a lasting effect , and save time in future — though , perhaps , it would have been better if [Eppie]146-eppie had cried more . In half an hour [she]146-eppie was clean again , and [Silas]38-silas having turned [his]38-silas back to see what [he]38-silas could do with the linen band , threw it down again , with the reflection that [Eppie]146-eppie would be good without fastening for the rest of the morning . [He]38-silas turned round again , and was going to place [her]146-eppie in [her]146-eppie little chair near the loom , when [she]146-eppie peeped out at [him]38-silas with black face and hands again , and said , " [Eppie]146-eppie in [de toal - hole]2792-de toal - hole ! "[146-eppie] This total failure of the coal - hole discipline shook [Silas]38-silas 's belief in the efficacy of punishment . " [She]146-eppie 'd take it all for fun , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas observed to [Dolly]113-dolly , " if [I]38-silas did n't hurt [her]146-eppie , and that [I]38-silas ca n't do , [Mrs Winthrop]111-mrs winthrop . If [she]146-eppie makes [me]38-silas a bit o ' trouble , [I]38-silas can bear it . And [she]146-eppie 's got no tricks but what [she]146-eppie 'll grow out of . "[38-silas] " Well , that 's partly true , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly , sympathetically ; " and if [you]38-silas ca n't bring [your]38-silas mind to frighten [her]146-eppie off touching things , [you]38-silas must do what [you]38-silas can to keep ['em]2793-'em out of [her]146-eppie way . That 's what [I]113-dolly do wi ' [the pups]2794-the pups as [the lads]2745-the lads are allays a - rearing . [They]2745-the lads will worry and gnaw — worry and gnaw [they]2745-the lads will , if it was one 's Sunday cap as hung anywhere so as [they]2745-the lads could drag it . [They]2745-the lads know no difference , [God]128-god help ['em]2796-'em : it 's the pushing o ' the teeth as sets them on , that 's what it is . "[113-dolly] So [Eppie]146-eppie was reared without punishment , the burden of [her]146-eppie misdeeds being borne vicariously by [father Silas]38-silas . [The stone hut]1628-the stone hut was made a soft nest for [her]146-eppie , lined with downy patience : and also in [the world that lay beyond [the stone hut]1628-the stone hut for [her]146-eppie]1629-the world that lay beyond the stone hut for her , [she]146-eppie knew nothing of frowns and denials . Notwithstanding the difficulty of carrying [her]146-eppie and [his]38-silas yarn or linen at the same time , [Silas]38-silas took [her]146-eppie with [him]38-silas in most of [his]38-silas journeys to [the farm - houses]1631-the farm - houses , unwilling to leave [her]146-eppie behind at [Dolly Winthrop]113-dolly 's , who was always ready to take care of [her]146-eppie ; and little curly - headed [Eppie]146-eppie , [[the weaver]209-the weaver 's child]1633-the weaver 's child , became an object of interest at [several out - lying homesteads]1634-several out - lying homesteads , as well as in [the village]247-the village . Hitherto [he]38-silas had been treated very much as if [he]38-silas had been a useful gnome or brownie — [a queer and unaccountable creature , who must necessarily be looked at with wondering curiosity and repulsion]1636-a queer and unaccountable creature , who must necessarily be looked at with wondering curiosity and repulsion , and with whom [one]2512-one would be glad to make all greetings and bargains as brief as possible , but who must be dealt with in a propitiatory way , and occasionally have a present of pork or garden - stuff to carry [home]374-home with [him]38-silas , seeing that without [him]38-silas there was no getting the yarn woven . But now [Silas]38-silas met with open smiling faces and cheerful questioning , as [a person whose satisfactions and difficulties could be understood]1639-a person whose satisfactions and difficulties could be understood . Everywhere [he]38-silas must sit a little and talk about [the child]451-the child , and words of interest were always ready for [him]38-silas : " Ah , [Master Marner]42-master marner , [you]42-master marner 'll be lucky if [she]451-the child takes the measles soon and easy!"—or[38-silas] , " Why , there is n't many [lone men ' ud ha ' been wishing to take up with a little un like that]2797-lone men ' ud ha ' been wishing to take up with a little un like that : but [I]38-silas reckon the weaving makes [you]42-master marner handier than [men]372-men as do out - door work — [you're]42-master marner partly as handy as [a woman]2412-a woman , for weaving comes next to spinning . "[38-silas] [Elderly masters]1641-elderly masters and [mistresses]1642-mistresses , seated observantly in large kitchen arm - chairs , shook [their]1641-elderly masters heads over the difficulties attendant on rearing [children]1574-children , felt [Eppie]146-eppie 's round arms and legs , and pronounced [them]1644-them remarkably firm , and told [Silas]38-silas that , if [she]146-eppie turned out well ( which , however , there was no telling ) , it would be a fine thing for [him]38-silas to have a steady lass to do for [him]38-silas when [he]38-silas got helpless . [Servant maidens]1645-servant maidens were fond of carrying [her]146-eppie out to look at the hens and chickens , or to see if any cherries could be shaken down in [the orchard]1646-the orchard ; and [the small boys]1647-the small boys and [girls]1648-girls approached [her]146-eppie slowly , with cautious movement and steady gaze , like little dogs face to face with one of [their]1647-the small boys own kind , till attraction had reached the point at which the soft lips were put out for a kiss . [No child]1649-no child was afraid of approaching [Silas]38-silas when [Eppie]146-eppie was near [him]38-silas : there was no repulsion around [him]38-silas now , either for young or old ; for [the little child]399-the little child had come to link [him]38-silas once more with [the whole world]1651-the whole world . There was love between [him]38-silas and [the child]451-the child that blent [them]1653-them into one , and there was love between [the child]451-the child and [the world]410-the world — from [men]372-men and [women with parental looks and tones]1657-women with parental looks and tones , to the red lady - birds and the round pebbles . [Silas]38-silas began now to think of [Raveloe]1-raveloe life entirely in relation to [Eppie]146-eppie : [she]146-eppie must have everything that was a good in [Raveloe]1-raveloe ; and [he]38-silas listened docilely , that [he]38-silas might come to understand better what this life was , from which , for fifteen years , [he]38-silas had stood aloof as from a strange thing , with which [he]38-silas could have no communion : as [some man who has a precious plant to which [he]38-silas would give a nurturing home in [a new soil]1659-a new soil]1658-some man who has a precious plant to which he would give a nurturing home in a new soil , thinks of the rain and sunshine , and all influences , in relation to [his]38-silas nursling , and asks industriously for all knowledge that will help [him]38-silas to satisfy the wants of the searching roots , or to guard leaf and bud from invading harm . The disposition to hoard had been utterly crushed at the very first by the loss of [his]38-silas long - stored gold : the coins [he]38-silas earned afterwards seemed as irrelevant as stones brought to complete [a house]1660-a house suddenly burried by an earthquake ; the sense of bereavement was too heavy upon [him]38-silas for the old thrill of satisfaction to arise again at the touch of the newly - earned coin . And now something had come to replace [his]38-silas hoard which gave a growing purpose to the earnings , drawing [his]38-silas hope and joy continually onward beyond the money . In old days there were angels who came and took [men]372-men by the hand and led [them]372-men away from [the city of destruction]1662-the city of destruction . [We]1663-we see [no white - winged angels]1664-no white - winged angels now . But yet [men]372-men are led away from threatening destruction : a hand is put into [theirs]372-men , which leads [them]372-men forth gently towards [a calm and bright land]1666-a calm and bright land , so that [they]372-men look no more backward ; and the hand may be [a little child]1542-a little child 's . There was [one person , as [you]1669-you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of [Eppie]146-eppie under [the weaver]209-the weaver 's care]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care . [He]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care dared not do anything that would imply a stronger interest in [[a poor man]1025-a poor man 's adopted child]1672-a poor man 's adopted child than could be expected from the kindliness of [the young Squire]624-the young squire , when a chance meeting suggested a little present to [a simple old fellow]1674-a simple old fellow whom [others]297-others noticed with goodwill ; but [he]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care told [himself]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care that the time would come when [he]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care might do something towards furthering the welfare of [[his]1668-one person , as you will believe , who watched with keener though more hidden interest than any other , the prosperous growth of eppie under the weaver 's care daughter]2418-his daughter without incurring suspicions .
