" [You]67-nancy 'll be in again by tea - time , [dear]2767-dear ? "[66-godfrey] " O yes , [I]66-godfrey shall be back in an hour . "[66-godfrey] It was [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's custom on a Sunday afternoon to do a little contemplative farming in a leisurely walk . [Nancy]67-nancy seldom accompanied [him]66-godfrey ; for [the women of [her]67-nancy generation]1832-the women of her generation — unless , like [Priscilla]80-priscilla , [they]1832-the women of her generation took to outdoor management — were not given to much walking beyond [[their]1832-the women of her generation own house]1833-their own house and garden , finding sufficient exercise in domestic duties . So , when [Priscilla]80-priscilla was not with [her]67-nancy , [she]67-nancy usually sat with [Mant]161-mant 's Bible before [her]67-nancy , and after following the text with [her]67-nancy eyes for a little while , [she]67-nancy would gradually permit them to wander as [her]67-nancy thoughts had already insisted on wandering . But [Nancy]67-nancy 's Sunday thoughts were rarely quite out of keeping with the devout and reverential intention implied by the book spread open before [her]67-nancy . [She]67-nancy was not theologically instructed enough to discern very clearly the relation between the sacred documents of the past which [she]67-nancy opened without method , and [her]67-nancy own obscure , simple life ; but the spirit of rectitude , and the sense of responsibility for the effect of [her]67-nancy conduct on [others]297-others , which were strong elements in [Nancy]67-nancy 's character , had made it a habit with [her]67-nancy to scrutinise [her]67-nancy past feelings and actions with self - questioning solicitude . [Her]67-nancy mind not being courted by a great variety of subjects , [she]67-nancy filled the vacant moments by living inwardly , again and again , through all [her]67-nancy remembered experience , especially through the fifteen years of [her]67-nancy married time , in which [her]67-nancy life and its significance had been doubled . [She]67-nancy recalled the small details , the words , tones , and looks , in the critical scenes which had opened a new epoch for [her]67-nancy , by giving [her]67-nancy a deeper insight into the relations and trials of life , or which had called on [her]67-nancy for some little effort of forbearance , or of painful adherence to an imagined or real duty — asking [herself]67-nancy continually whether [she]67-nancy had been in any respect blamable . This excessive rumination and self - questioning is perhaps a morbid habit inevitable to a mind of much moral sensibility when shut out from its due share of outward activity and of practical claims on its affections — inevitable to [a noblehearted , childless woman]1835-a noblehearted , childless woman , when [her]1835-a noblehearted , childless woman lot is narrow . " [I]67-nancy can do so little — have [I]67-nancy done it all well ? "[67-nancy] is the perpetually recurring thought ; and there are no voices calling [her]67-nancy away from that soliloquy , no peremptory demands to divert energy from vain regret or superfluous scruple . There was one main thread of painful experience in [Nancy]67-nancy 's married life , and on it hung certain deeply - felt scenes , which were the oftenest revived in retrospect . The short dialogue with [Priscilla]80-priscilla in [the garden]2830-the garden had determined the current of retrospect in that frequent direction this particular Sunday afternoon . The first wandering of [her]67-nancy thought from the text , which [she]67-nancy still attempted dutifully to follow with [her]67-nancy eyes and silent lips , was into an imaginary enlargement of the defence [she]67-nancy had set up for [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband against [Priscilla]80-priscilla 's implied blame . The vindication of [the loved object]1838-the loved object is the best balm affection can find for its wounds : — " [A man]185-a man must have so much on [his]185-a man mind , "[1839-a wife] is the belief by which [a wife]1839-a wife often supports a cheerful face under rough answers and unfeeling words . And [Nancy]67-nancy 's deepest wounds had all come from the perception that the absence of [children]1574-children from [[their]1841-their hearth]1842-their hearth was dwelt on in [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's mind as a privation to which [he]2414-her husband could not reconcile [himself]2414-her husband . Yet [sweet Nancy]67-nancy might have been expected to feel still more keenly the denial of a blessing to which [she]67-nancy had looked forward with all the varied expectations and preparations , solemn and prettily trivial , which fill the mind of [a loving woman]1844-a loving woman when [she]67-nancy expects to become [a mother]1798-a mother . Was there not a drawer filled with the neat work of [her]67-nancy hands , all unworn and untouched , just as [she]67-nancy had arranged it there fourteen years ago — just , but for one little dress , which had been made the burial - dress ? But under this immediate personal trial [Nancy]67-nancy was so firmly unmurmuring , that years ago [she]67-nancy had suddenly renounced the habit of visiting this drawer , lest [she]67-nancy should in this way be cherishing a longing for what was not given . Perhaps it was this very severity towards any indulgence of what [she]67-nancy held to be sinful regret in [herself]67-nancy , that made [her]67-nancy shrink from applying [her]67-nancy own standard to [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband . " It was very different — it was much worse for [a man]185-a man to be disappointed in that way : [a woman]2412-a woman could always be satisfied with devoting [herself]2412-a woman to [[her]2412-a woman husband]2414-her husband , but [a man]185-a man wanted something that would make [him]185-a man look forward more — and sitting by the fire was so much duller to [him]185-a man than to [a woman]2412-a woman . "[67-nancy] And always , when [Nancy]67-nancy reached this point in [her]67-nancy meditations — trying , with predetermined sympathy , to see everything as [Godfrey]66-godfrey saw it — there came a renewal of self - questioning . Had [she]67-nancy done everything in [her]67-nancy power to lighten [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's privation ? Had [she]67-nancy really been right in the resistance which had cost [her]67-nancy so much pain six years ago , and again four years ago — the resistance to [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's wish that [they]1848-they should adopt [a child]2502-a child ? Adoption was more remote from the ideas and habits of that time than of [our]1850-our own ; still [Nancy]67-nancy had [her]67-nancy opinion on it . It was as necessary to [her]67-nancy mind to have an opinion on all topics , not exclusively masculine , that had come under [her]67-nancy notice , as for [her]67-nancy to have a precisely marked place for every article of [her]67-nancy personal property : and [her]67-nancy opinions were always principles , to be unwaveringly acted on . They were firm , not because of their basis , but because [she]67-nancy held [them]1851-them with a tenacity inseparable from [her]67-nancy mental action . On all the duties and proprieties of life , from filial behaviour to the arrangement of the evening toilette , pretty [Nancy Lammeter]67-nancy , by the time [she]67-nancy was three - and - twenty , had [her]67-nancy unalterable little code , and had formed every one of [her]67-nancy habits in strict accordance with that code . [She]67-nancy carried these decided judgments within [her]67-nancy in the most unobtrusive way : they rooted themselves in [her]67-nancy mind , and grew there as quietly as grass . Years ago , [we]1850-our know , [she]67-nancy insisted on dressing like [Priscilla]80-priscilla , because " it was right for [sisters]328-sisters to dress alike , "[67-nancy] and because " [she]67-nancy would do what was right if [she]67-nancy wore a gown dyed with cheese - colouring . "[67-nancy] That was a trivial but typical instance of the mode in which [Nancy]67-nancy 's life was regulated . It was one of those rigid principles , and no petty egoistic feeling , which had been the ground of [Nancy]67-nancy 's difficult resistance to [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's wish . To adopt [a child]2502-a child , because [children of [your]1855-your own]1854-children of your own had been denied [you]1855-your , was to try and choose [your]1855-your lot in spite of Providence : [the adopted child]1856-the adopted child , [she]67-nancy was convinced , would never turn out well , and would be a curse to those who had wilfully and rebelliously sought what it was clear that , for some high reason , [they]1857-they were better without . When [you]1855-your saw a thing was not meant to be , said nancy , it was a bounden duty to leave off so much as wishing for it . And so far , perhaps , [the wisest of men]1858-the wisest of men could scarcely make more than a verbal improvement in [her]67-nancy principle . But the conditions under which [she]67-nancy held it apparent that a thing was not meant to be , depended on a more peculiar mode of thinking . [She]67-nancy would have given up making a purchase at [a particular place]1859-a particular place if , on three successive times , rain , or some other cause of [Heaven]112-heaven 's sending , had formed an obstacle ; and [she]67-nancy would have anticipated a broken limb or other heavy misfortune to [any one who persisted in spite of such indications]1860-any one who persisted in spite of such indications . " But why should [you]66-godfrey think [the child]451-the child would turn out ill ? "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , in [his]66-godfrey remonstrances . " [She]451-the child has thriven as well as [child]2550-child can do with [the weaver]209-the weaver ; and [he]209-the weaver adopted [her]451-the child . There is n't such [a pretty little girl anywhere else in [the parish]262-the parish]2990-a pretty little girl anywhere else in the parish , or one fitter for [the station [we]2993-we could give [her]451-the child]2992-the station we could give her . Where can be the likelihood of [her]451-the child being a curse to [anybody]263-anybody ? "[66-godfrey] " Yes , [[my]67-nancy dear]2469-my dear [Godfrey]66-godfrey , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , who was sitting with [her]67-nancy hands tightly clasped together , with yearning , regretful affection in [her]67-nancy eyes . " [The child]451-the child may not turn out ill with [the weaver]209-the weaver . But , then , [he]209-the weaver did n't go to seek [her]451-the child , as [we]2993-we should be doing . It will be wrong : [I]67-nancy feel sure it will . Do n't [you]66-godfrey remember what [that lady [we]2993-we met at [the Royston Baths]34-the royston baths]2998-that lady we met at the royston baths told [us]2993-we about [the child [[her]2998-that lady we met at the royston baths sister]1188-her sister adopted]2999-the child her sister adopted ? That was the only adopting [I]67-nancy ever heard of : and [the child]451-the child was transported when it was twentythree . [Dear Godfrey]66-godfrey , do n't ask [me]67-nancy to do what [I]67-nancy know is wrong : [I]67-nancy should never be happy again . [I]67-nancy know it 's very hard for [you]66-godfrey — it 's easier for [me]67-nancy — but it 's the will of [Providence]61-providence . "[67-nancy] It might seem singular that [Nancy]67-nancy — with [her]67-nancy religious theory pieced together out of narrow social traditions , fragments of church doctrine imperfectly understood , and girlish reasonings on [her]67-nancy small experience — should have arrived by [herself]67-nancy at a way of thinking so nearly akin to that of [many devout people , whose beliefs are held in the shape of a system]1861-many devout people , whose beliefs are held in the shape of a system quite remote from [her]67-nancy knowledge — singular , if [we]1862-we did not know that human beliefs , like all other natural growths , elude the barriers of system . [Godfrey]66-godfrey had from the first specified [Eppie]146-eppie , then about twelve years old , as [a child suitable for [them]1864-them to adopt]1863-a child suitable for them to adopt . It had never occurred to [him]66-godfrey that [Silas]38-silas would rather part with [his]38-silas life than with [Eppie]146-eppie . Surely [the weaver]209-the weaver would wish the best to [the child [he]209-the weaver had taken so much trouble with]1866-the child he had taken so much trouble with , and would be glad that such good fortune should happen to [her]1866-the child he had taken so much trouble with : [she]1866-the child he had taken so much trouble with would always be very grateful to [him]66-godfrey , and [he]66-godfrey would be well provided for to the end of [his]66-godfrey life — provided for as the excellent part [he]66-godfrey had done by [the child]451-the child deserved . Was it not an appropriate thing for [people in a higher station]1868-people in a higher station to take a charge off the hands of [a man in a lower]1869-a man in a lower ? It seemed an eminently appropriate thing to [Godfrey]66-godfrey , for reasons that were known only to [himself]66-godfrey ; and by a common fallacy , [he]66-godfrey imagined the measure would be easy because [he]66-godfrey had private motives for desiring it . This was rather a coarse mode of estimating [Silas]38-silas 's relation to [Eppie]146-eppie ; but [we]1870-we must remember that many of the impressions which [Godfrey]66-godfrey was likely to gather concerning [the labouring people around [him]66-godfrey]1871-the labouring people around him would favour the idea that deep affections can hardly go along with callous palms and scant means ; and [he]66-godfrey had not had the opportunity , even if [he]66-godfrey had had the power , of entering intimately into all that was exceptional in [the weaver]209-the weaver 's experience . It was only the want of adequate knowledge that could have made it possible for [Godfrey]66-godfrey deliberately to entertain an unfeeling project : [his]66-godfrey natural kindness had outlived that blighting time of cruel wishes , and [Nancy]67-nancy 's praise of [him]66-godfrey as [a husband]1790-a husband was not founded entirely on a wilful illusion . " [I]67-nancy was right , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy said to [herself]67-nancy , when [she]67-nancy had recalled all [their]1874-their scenes of discussion—"I feel [I]67-nancy was right to say [him]66-godfrey nay , though it hurt [me]67-nancy more than anything ; but how good [Godfrey]66-godfrey has been about it ! [Many men]3002-many men would have been very angry with [me]67-nancy for standing out against [their]3002-many men wishes ; and [they]3002-many men might have thrown out that [they]3002-many men 'd had ill - luck in marrying [me]67-nancy ; but [Godfrey]66-godfrey has never been [the man]731-the man to say [me]67-nancy an unkind word . It 's only what [he]66-godfrey ca n't hide : everything seems so blank to [him]66-godfrey , [I]67-nancy know ; and [the land]553-the land — what a difference it ' ud make to [him]66-godfrey , when [he]66-godfrey goes to see after things , if [he]66-godfrey 'd [children]1574-children growing up that [he]66-godfrey was doing it all for ! But [I]67-nancy wo n't murmur ; and perhaps if [he]1876-him 'd married [a woman who 'd have had children]3006-a woman who 'd have had children , [she]3006-a woman who 'd have had children 'd have vexed [him]1876-him in other ways . "[67-nancy] This possibility was [Nancy]67-nancy 's chief comfort ; and to give it greater strength , [she]67-nancy laboured to make it impossible that [any other wife]1875-any other wife should have had more perfect tenderness . [She]67-nancy had been forced to vex [him]1876-him by that one denial . [Godfrey]66-godfrey was not insensible to [her]67-nancy loving effort , and did [Nancy]67-nancy no injustice as to the motives of [her]67-nancy obstinacy . It was impossible to have lived with [her]67-nancy fifteen years and not be aware that [an unselfish clinging to the right , and a sincerity clear as the flower - born dew]1877-an unselfish clinging to the right , and a sincerity clear as the flower - born dew , were [her]67-nancy main characteristics ; indeed , [Godfrey]66-godfrey felt this so strongly , that [his]66-godfrey own more wavering nature , too averse to facing difficulty to be unvaryingly simple and truthful , was kept in a certain awe of [this gentle wife who watched [his]66-godfrey looks]1878-this gentle wife who watched his looks with a yearning to obey [them]1879-them . It seemed to [him]66-godfrey impossible that [he]66-godfrey should ever confess to [her]1878-this gentle wife who watched his looks the truth about [Eppie]146-eppie : [she]1878-this gentle wife who watched his looks would never recover from the repulsion the story of [his]66-godfrey earlier marriage would create , told to [her]1878-this gentle wife who watched his looks now , after that long concealment . And [the child]451-the child , too , [he]66-godfrey thought , must become an object of repulsion : the very sight of [her]1878-this gentle wife who watched his looks would be painful . The shock to [Nancy]67-nancy 's mingled pride and ignorance of [the world]410-the world 's evil might even be too much for [her]67-nancy delicate frame . Since [he]66-godfrey had married [her]67-nancy with that secret on [his]66-godfrey heart , [he]66-godfrey must keep it there to the last . Whatever else [he]66-godfrey did , [he]66-godfrey could not make an irreparable breach between [himself]66-godfrey and [this long - loved wife]1882-this long - loved wife . Meanwhile , why could [he]66-godfrey not make up [his]66-godfrey mind to the absence of [children]1574-children from a hearth brightened by [such a wife]1884-such a wife ? Why did [his]66-godfrey mind fly uneasily to that void , as if it were the sole reason why life was not thoroughly joyous to [him]66-godfrey ? [I]0-i suppose it is the way with [all men]1885-all men and women who reach middle age without the clear perception that life never can be thoroughly joyous : under the vague dulness of the grey hours , dissatisfaction seeks a definite object , and finds it in the privation of an untried good . [Dissatisfaction]162-dissatisfaction , seated musingly on a childless hearth , thinks with envy of [the father whose return is greeted by young voices]1886-the father whose return is greeted by young voices — seated at the meal where the little heads rise one above another like nursery plants , it sees a black care hovering behind every one of [them]1887-them , and thinks the impulses by which [men]372-men abandon freedom , and seek for ties , are surely nothing but a brief madness . In [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's case there were further reasons why [his]66-godfrey thoughts should be continually solicited by this one point in [his]66-godfrey lot : [his]66-godfrey conscience , never thoroughly easy about [Eppie]146-eppie , now gave [[his]66-godfrey childless [home]374-home]1889-his childless home the aspect of a retribution ; and as the time passed on , under [Nancy]67-nancy 's refusal to adopt [her]67-nancy , any retrieval of [his]66-godfrey error became more and more difficult . On this Sunday afternoon it was already four years since there had been any allusion to the subject between [them]1891-them , and [Nancy]67-nancy supposed that it was for ever buried . " [I]67-nancy wonder if [he]66-godfrey 'll mind it less or more as [he]66-godfrey gets older , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy thought ; " [I]67-nancy 'm afraid more . [Aged people]3007-aged people feel the miss of [children]1574-children : what would [father]2569-father do without [Priscilla]80-priscilla ? And if [I]67-nancy die , [Godfrey]66-godfrey will be very lonely — not holding together with [[his]66-godfrey brothers]3010-his brothers much . But [I]67-nancy wo n't be over - anxious , and trying to make things out beforehand : [I]67-nancy must do [my]67-nancy best for the present . "[67-nancy] With that last thought [Nancy]67-nancy roused [herself]67-nancy from [her]67-nancy reverie , and turned [her]67-nancy eyes again towards the forsaken page . It had been forsaken longer than [she]67-nancy imagined , for [she]67-nancy was presently surprised by the appearance of [the servant]1189-the servant with the tea - things . It was , in fact , a little before the usual time for tea ; but [Jane]163-jane had [her]163-jane reasons . " Is [[your]163-jane master]3011-your master come into [the yard]1815-the yard , [Jane]163-jane ? "[163-jane] " No ' m , [he]3011-your master is n't , "[163-jane] said [Jane]163-jane , with a slight emphasis , of which , however , [[her]163-jane mistress]1893-her mistress took no notice . " [I]163-jane do n't know whether [you]163-jane 've seen ['em]3013-'em , ' m , "[163-jane] continued [Jane]163-jane , after a pause , " but there 's [folks]214-folks making haste all one way , afore the front window . [I]163-jane doubt something 's happened . There 's niver [a man]185-a man to be seen [i]163-jane ' [the yard]1815-the yard , else [I]163-jane 'd send and see . [I]163-jane 've been up into [the top attic]3017-the top attic , but there 's no seeing anything for trees . [I]163-jane hope [nobody]444-nobody 's hurt , that 's all . "[163-jane] " O , no , [I]67-nancy daresay there 's nothing much the matter , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy . " It 's perhaps [Mr Snell]82-mr snell 's bull got out again , as [he]185-a man did before . " [That girl]3020-that girl is always terrifying [me]67-nancy , "[67-nancy] thought [Nancy]67-nancy ; " [I]67-nancy wish [Godfrey]66-godfrey would come in . "[67-nancy] [She]67-nancy went to the front window and looked as far as [she]67-nancy could see along [the road]648-the road , with an uneasiness which [she]67-nancy felt to be childish , for there were now no such signs of excitement as [Jane]163-jane had spoken of , and [Godfrey]66-godfrey would not be likely to return by [the village road]1895-the village road , but by [the fields]303-the fields . [She]67-nancy continued to stand , however , looking at [the placid churchyard]1897-the placid churchyard with the long shadows of the gravestones across [the bright green hillocks]1898-the bright green hillocks , and at the glowing autumn colours of the Rectory trees beyond . Before such calm external beauty the presence of a vague fear is more distinctly felt — like a raven flapping its slow wing across the sunny air . [Nancy]67-nancy wished more and more that [Godfrey]66-godfrey would come in . [Some one]568-some one opened the door at the other end of [the room]611-the room , and [Nancy]67-nancy felt that it was [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband . [She]67-nancy turned from the window with gladness in [her]67-nancy eyes , for [the wife]534-the wife 's chief dread was stilled . " [Dear]2767-dear , [I]67-nancy 'm so thankful [you]66-godfrey 're come , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy said , going towards [him]66-godfrey . " [I]67-nancy began to get . ... "[67-nancy] [She]67-nancy paused abruptly , for [Godfrey]66-godfrey was laying down [his]66-godfrey hat with trembling hands , and turned towards [her]67-nancy with a pale face and a strange unanswering glance , as if [he]66-godfrey saw [her]67-nancy indeed , but saw [her]67-nancy as part of a scene invisible to [herself]67-nancy . [She]67-nancy laid [her]67-nancy hand on [his]66-godfrey arm , not daring to speak again ; but [he]66-godfrey left the touch unnoticed , and threw [himself]66-godfrey into [his]66-godfrey chair . [Jane]163-jane was already at the door with the hissing urn . " Tell [her]67-nancy to keep away , will [you]67-nancy ? "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey ; and when the door was closed again [he]66-godfrey exerted [himself]66-godfrey to speak more distinctly . " Sit down , [Nancy]67-nancy — there , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said , pointing to a chair opposite [him]66-godfrey . " [I]66-godfrey came back as soon as [I]66-godfrey could , to hinder [anybody]263-anybody 's telling [you]67-nancy but [me]66-godfrey . " No , it 's [nobody living]3024-nobody living , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , unequal to the considerate skill with which [he]66-godfrey would have wished to make [his]66-godfrey revelation . [We]3026-we 've found [him]63-dunstan — found [his]63-dunstan body — [his]63-dunstan skeleton . "[66-godfrey] The deep dread [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's look had created in [Nancy]67-nancy made [her]67-nancy feel these words a relief . [She]67-nancy sat in comparative calmness to hear what else [he]66-godfrey had to tell . [He]66-godfrey went on : " [The Stone - pit]684-the stone - pit has gone dry suddenly — from the draining , [I]66-godfrey suppose ; and there [he]63-dunstan lies — has lain for sixteen years , wedged between two great stones . There 's [his]63-dunstan watch and seals , and there 's [my]66-godfrey gold - handled hunting - whip , with [my]66-godfrey name on : [he]63-dunstan took it away , without [my]66-godfrey knowing , the day [he]63-dunstan went hunting on Wildfire , the last time [he]63-dunstan was seen . "[66-godfrey] [Godfrey]66-godfrey paused : it was not so easy to say what came next . " Do [you]66-godfrey think [he]63-dunstan drowned [himself]63-dunstan ? " No , [he]63-dunstan fell in , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , in a low but distinct voice , as if [he]66-godfrey felt some deep meaning in the fact . "[66-godfrey] The blood rushed to [Nancy]67-nancy 's face and neck at this surprise and shame , for [she]67-nancy had been bred up to regard even a distant kinship with crime as a dishonour . " O [Godfrey]66-godfrey ! "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy said , with compassion in [her]67-nancy tone , for [she]67-nancy had immediately reflected that the dishonour must be felt still more keenly by [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband . " There was the money in the pit , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey continued — " all the weaver 's money . Everything 's being gathered up , and [they]3029-they 're taking the skeleton to [the Rainbow]741-the rainbow . But [I]66-godfrey came back to tell [you]67-nancy : there was no hindering it ; [you]67-nancy must know . "[66-godfrey] [He]66-godfrey was silent , looking on the ground for two long minutes . [Nancy]67-nancy would have said some words of comfort under this disgrace , but [she]67-nancy refrained , from an instinctive sense that there was something behind — that [Godfrey]66-godfrey had something else to tell [her]67-nancy . [That woman [Marner]38-silas found dead in the snow]3033-that woman marner found dead in the snow — [[Eppie]146-eppie 's mother]3034-eppie 's mother — [that wretched woman]3035-that wretched woman — was [[my]66-godfrey wife]2284-my wife : [Eppie]146-eppie is [[my]66-godfrey child]3037-my child . "[66-godfrey] [He]66-godfrey paused , dreading the effect of [his]66-godfrey confession . But [Nancy]67-nancy sat quite still , only that [her]67-nancy eyes dropped and ceased to meet [his]66-godfrey . [She]67-nancy was pale and quiet as a meditative statue , clasping [her]67-nancy hands on [her]67-nancy lap . " [You]67-nancy 'll never think the same of [me]66-godfrey again , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , after a little while , with some tremor in [his]66-godfrey voice . "[67-nancy] Still [Nancy]67-nancy was silent , looking down ; and [he]66-godfrey almost expected that [she]67-nancy would presently get up and say [she]67-nancy would go to [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father 's . "[66-godfrey] Between eight and nine o'clock that evening , [Eppie]146-eppie and [Silas]38-silas were seated alone in [the cottage]616-the cottage . After the great excitement [the weaver]209-the weaver had undergone from the events of the afternoon , [he]209-the weaver had felt a longing for this quietude , and had even begged [Mrs Winthrop]111-mrs winthrop and [Aaron]89-aaron , who had naturally lingered behind [every one else]893-every one else , to leave [him]209-the weaver alone with [[his]209-the weaver child]1914-his child . The excitement had not passed away : it had only reached that stage when the keenness of the susceptibility makes external stimulus intolerable — when there is no sense of weariness , but rather an intensity of inward life , under which sleep is an impossibility . [Any one who has watched such moments in [other men]883-other men]1915-any one who has watched such moments in other men remembers the brightness of the eyes and the strange definiteness that comes over coarse features from that transient influence . It is as if a new fineness of ear for all spiritual voices had sent wonder - working vibrations through the heavy mortal frame — as if " beauty born of murmuring sound "[146-eppie] had passed into the face of [the listener]1917-the listener . [Silas]38-silas 's face showed that sort of transfiguration , as [he]38-silas sat in [his]38-silas arm - chair and looked at [Eppie]146-eppie . [She]146-eppie had drawn [her]146-eppie own chair towards [his]38-silas knees , and leaned forward , holding both [his]38-silas hands , while [she]146-eppie looked up at [him]38-silas . On the table near [them]1918-them , lit by a candle , lay the recovered gold — the old long - loved gold , ranged in orderly heaps , as [Silas]38-silas used to range it in the days when it was [his]38-silas only joy . [He]38-silas had been telling [her]146-eppie how [he]38-silas used to count it every night , and how [his]38-silas soul was utterly desolate till [she]146-eppie was sent to [him]38-silas . " At first , [I]38-silas 'd a sort o ' feeling come across [me]38-silas now and then , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas was saying in a subdued tone , " as if [you]146-eppie might be changed into the gold again ; for sometimes , turn [my]38-silas head which way [I]38-silas would , [I]38-silas seemed to see the gold ; and [I]38-silas thought [I]38-silas should be glad if [I]38-silas could feel it , and find it was come back . But that did n't last long . After a bit , [I]38-silas should have thought it was a curse come again , if it had drove [you]146-eppie from [me]38-silas , for [I]38-silas 'd got to feel the need o ' [your]146-eppie looks and [your]146-eppie voice and the touch o ' [your]146-eppie little fingers . [You]146-eppie did n't know then , [Eppie]146-eppie , when [you]146-eppie were such [a little un]2472-a little un — [you]146-eppie did n't know what [[your]146-eppie old father]3053-your old father [Silas]38-silas felt for [you]146-eppie . "[38-silas] " But [I]146-eppie know now , [father]2569-father , "[146-eppie] said [Eppie]146-eppie . " If it had n't been for [you]2569-father , [they]3055-they 'd have taken [me]38-silas to [the workhouse]2699-the workhouse , and there 'd have been [nobody]444-nobody to love [me]38-silas . "[38-silas] " Eh , [[my]38-silas precious child]3058-my precious child , the blessing was [mine]38-silas . If [you]2569-father had n't been sent to save [me]38-silas , [I]38-silas should ha ' gone to the grave in [my]38-silas misery . The money was taken away from [me]38-silas in time ; and [you]3058-my precious child see it 's been kept — kept till it was wanted for [you]3058-my precious child . It 's wonderful — [our]3059-our life is wonderful . "[38-silas] [Silas]38-silas sat in silence a few minutes , looking at the money . " It takes no hold of [me]38-silas now , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas said , ponderingly—"the money does n't . "[38-silas] At that moment there was a knocking at the door ; and [Eppie]146-eppie was obliged to rise without answering [Silas]38-silas . Beautiful [she]146-eppie looked , with the tenderness of gathering tears in [her]146-eppie eyes and a slight flush on [her]146-eppie cheeks , as [she]146-eppie stepped to open the door . The flush deepened when [she]146-eppie saw [Mr]1919-mr and [Mrs Godfrey Cass]151-mrs godfrey cass . [She]146-eppie made [her]146-eppie little rustic curtsy , and held the door wide for [them]1920-them to enter . " [We]1920-them 're disturbing [you]146-eppie very late , [[my]151-mrs godfrey cass dear]2469-my dear , "[151-mrs godfrey cass] said [Mrs Cass]151-mrs godfrey cass , taking [Eppie]146-eppie 's hand , and looking in [her]146-eppie face with an expression of anxious interest and admiration . [Nancy]67-nancy [herself]67-nancy was pale and tremulous . [Eppie]146-eppie , after placing chairs for [Mr]1921-mr and [Mrs Cass]151-mrs godfrey cass , went to stand against [Silas]38-silas , opposite to [them]1920-them . " Well , [Marner]38-silas , "[151-mrs godfrey cass] said [Godfrey]151-mrs godfrey cass , trying to speak with perfect firmness , " it 's a great comfort to [me]151-mrs godfrey cass to see [you]146-eppie with [your]146-eppie money again , that [you]146-eppie 've been deprived of so many years . It was one of [[my]151-mrs godfrey cass family]2419-my family did [you]146-eppie the wrong — the more grief to [me]151-mrs godfrey cass — and [I]151-mrs godfrey cass feel bound to make up to [you]146-eppie for it in every way . Whatever [I]151-mrs godfrey cass can do for [you]146-eppie will be nothing but paying a debt , even if [I]151-mrs godfrey cass looked no farther than the robbery . But there are other things [I]151-mrs godfrey cass 'm beholden — shall be beholden to [you]146-eppie for , [Marner]38-silas . "[151-mrs godfrey cass] [Godfrey]151-mrs godfrey cass checked [himself]151-mrs godfrey cass . It had been agreed between [him]1922-his and [[his]1922-his wife]223-his wife that the subject of [[his]1922-his fatherhood]1924-his fatherhood should be approached very carefully , and that , if possible , the disclosure should be reserved for the future , so that it might be made to [Eppie]146-eppie gradually . [Nancy]67-nancy had urged this , because [she]67-nancy felt strongly the painful light in which [Eppie]146-eppie must inevitably see the relation between [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father and [mother]189-mother . [Silas]38-silas , always ill at ease when [he]38-silas was being spoken to by " betters , "[66-godfrey] such as [Mr Cass]66-godfrey — tall , powerful , [florid men , seen chiefly on horse - back]1927-florid men , seen chiefly on horse - back — answered with some constraint , — " [Sir]2360-sir , [I]66-godfrey 've a deal to thank [you]2360-sir for a'ready . As for the robbery , [I]66-godfrey count it no loss to [me]66-godfrey . And if [I]66-godfrey did , [you]2360-sir could n't help it : [you]2360-sir are n't answerable for it . "[66-godfrey] " [You]2360-sir may look at it in that way , [Marner]38-silas , but [I]66-godfrey never can ; and [I]66-godfrey hope [you]2360-sir 'll let [me]66-godfrey act according to [my]66-godfrey own feeling of what 's just . [I]66-godfrey know [you]2360-sir 're easily contented : [you]2360-sir 've been [a hard - working man]3063-a hard - working man all [your]2360-sir life . "[66-godfrey] " Yes , [sir]2360-sir , yes , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , meditatively . " [I]38-silas should ha ' been bad off without [my]38-silas work : it was what [I]38-silas held by when everything else was gone from [me]38-silas . "[38-silas] " Ah , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , applying [Marner]38-silas 's words simply to [his]66-godfrey bodily wants , " it was a good trade for [you]2360-sir in [this country]2164-this country , because there 's been a great deal of linen - weaving to be done . But [you]2360-sir 're getting rather past such close work , [Marner]38-silas : it 's time [you]2360-sir laid by and had some rest . [You]2360-sir look a good deal pulled down , though [you]2360-sir 're not [an old man]3066-an old man , are [you]2360-sir ? "[66-godfrey] " Fifty - five , as near as [I]38-silas can say , [sir]2360-sir , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas . " O , why , [you]2360-sir may live thirty years longer — look at [old Macey]41-mr macey ! And that money on the table , after all , is but little . It wo n't go far either way — whether it 's put out to interest , or [you]2360-sir were to live on it as long as it would last : it would n't go far if [you]2360-sir 'd [nobody]444-nobody to keep but [yourself]2360-sir , and [you]2360-sir 've had two to keep for a good many years now . "[38-silas] " Eh , [sir]2360-sir , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , unaffected by anything [Godfrey]66-godfrey was saying , " [I]66-godfrey 'm in no fear o ' want . [We]3070-we shall do very well — [Eppie]146-eppie and [me]66-godfrey ' ull do well enough . There 's [few working - folks]3071-few working - folks have got so much laid by as that . [I]66-godfrey do n't know what it is to [gentlefolks]3072-gentlefolks , but [I]66-godfrey look upon it as a deal — almost too much . And as for [us]3070-we , it 's little [we]3070-we want . "[66-godfrey] " Only [the garden]2830-the garden , [father]2569-father , "[146-eppie] said [Eppie]146-eppie , blushing up to the ears the moment after . " [You]2414-her husband love [a garden]2823-a garden , do [you]2414-her husband , [[my]67-nancy dear]2469-my dear ? " [We]3070-we should agree in that : [I]67-nancy ' give a deal of time to [the garden]2830-the garden . "[67-nancy] " Ah , there 's plenty of gardening at [the Red House]533-the red house , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , surprised at the difficulty [he]66-godfrey found in approaching a proposition which had seemed so easy to [him]66-godfrey in the distance . " [You]2414-her husband 've done a good part by [Eppie]146-eppie , [Marner]38-silas , for sixteen years . It ' ud be a great comfort to [you]2414-her husband to see [her]146-eppie well provided for , would n't it ? [She]146-eppie looks blooming and healthy , but not fit for any hardships : [she]146-eppie does n't look like [a strapping girl]3079-a strapping girl come of [working parents]3080-working parents . [You]2414-her husband 'd like to see [her]146-eppie taken care of by those who can leave [her]146-eppie well off , and make [a lady of [her]146-eppie]3081-a lady of her ; [she]146-eppie 's more fit for it than for a rough life , such as [she]146-eppie might come to have in a few years ' time . "[66-godfrey] A slight flush came over [Marner]38-silas 's face , and disappeared , like a passing gleam . [Eppie]146-eppie was simply wondering [Mr Cass]66-godfrey should talk so about things that seemed to have nothing to do with reality ; but [Silas]38-silas was hurt and uneasy . " [I]38-silas do n't take [your]38-silas meaning , [sir]2360-sir , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas answered , not having words at command to express the mingled feelings with which [he]38-silas had heard [Mr Cass]66-godfrey 's words . " Well , [my]66-godfrey meaning is this , [Marner]38-silas , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , determined to come to the point . " [Mrs Cass]151-mrs godfrey cass and [I]66-godfrey , [you]38-silas know , have [no children]266-no children — [nobody]444-nobody to benefit by [[our]3085-we good home]3086-our good home and everything else [we]3085-we have — more than enough for [ourselves]3085-we . And [we]3085-we should like to have [somebody]2086-somebody in the place of [a daughter]3088-a daughter to [us]3085-we — [we]3085-we should like to have [Eppie]146-eppie , and treat [her]146-eppie in every way as [[our]3085-we own child]3089-our own child . And it 's right [you]38-silas should have every reward for that . "[66-godfrey] [A plain man like [Godfrey Cass]66-godfrey]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass , speaking under some embarrassment , necessarily blunders on words that are coarser than [his]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass intentions , and that are likely to fall gratingly on susceptible feelings . While [he]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass had been speaking , [Eppie]146-eppie had quietly passed [her]146-eppie arm behind [Silas]38-silas 's head , and let [her]146-eppie hand rest against it caressingly : [she]146-eppie felt [him]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass trembling violently . [He]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass was silent for some moments when [Mr Cass]66-godfrey had ended — powerless under the conflict of emotions , all alike painful . [Eppie]146-eppie 's heart was swelling at the sense that [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father was in distress ; and [she]146-eppie was just going to lean down and speak to [him]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass , when one struggling dread at last gained the mastery over every other in [Silas]38-silas , and [he]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass said , faintly — " [Eppie]146-eppie , [[my]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass child]3037-my child , speak . [I]1929-a plain man like godfrey cass wo n't stand in [your]146-eppie way . Thank [Mr and Mrs Cass]164-mr and mrs cass . "[1929-a plain man like godfrey cass] [Eppie]146-eppie took [her]146-eppie hand from [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father 's head , and came forward a step . [Her]146-eppie cheeks were flushed , but not with shyness this time : the sense that [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father was in doubt and suffering banished that sort of self - consciousness . [She]146-eppie dropped a low curtsy , first to [Mrs Cass]164-mr and mrs cass and then to [Mr Cass]164-mr and mrs cass , and said — " Thank [you]164-mr and mrs cass , [ma'am]2521-ma'am — thank [you]164-mr and mrs cass , [sir]2360-sir . But [I]146-eppie ca n't leave [[my]146-eppie father]2068-my father , nor own [anybody nearer than [him]2068-my father]3095-anybody nearer than him . " [I]146-eppie could n't give up [the folks [I]146-eppie 've been used to]3097-the folks i 've been used to . "[146-eppie] [Eppie]146-eppie 's lip began to tremble a little at the last words . [She]146-eppie retreated to [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father 's chair again , and held [him]1190-her father round the neck ; while [Silas]38-silas , with a subdued sob , put up [his]38-silas hand to grasp [hers]146-eppie . The tears were in [Nancy]67-nancy 's eyes , but [her]67-nancy sympathy with [Eppie]146-eppie was , naturally , divided with distress on [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's account . [She]146-eppie dared not speak , wondering what was going on in [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's mind . [Godfrey]66-godfrey felt an irritation inevitable to almost all of [us]1936-us when [we]1936-us encounter an unexpected obstacle . [He]66-godfrey had been full of [his]66-godfrey own penitence and resolution to retrieve [his]66-godfrey error as far as the time was left to [him]66-godfrey ; [he]66-godfrey was possessed with all - important feelings , that were to lead to a predetermined course of action which [he]66-godfrey had fixed on as the right , and [he]66-godfrey was not prepared to enter with lively appreciation into [other people]548-other people 's feelings counteracting [his]66-godfrey virtuous resolves . The agitation with which [he]66-godfrey spoke again was not quite unmixed with anger . " But [I]66-godfrey have a claim on [you]146-eppie , [Eppie]146-eppie — the strongest of all claims . It is [my]66-godfrey duty , [Marner]38-silas , to own [Eppie]146-eppie as [[my]66-godfrey child]3037-my child , and provide for [her]146-eppie . [She]146-eppie is [[my]66-godfrey own child]3099-my own child — [[her]146-eppie mother]2585-her mother was [[my]66-godfrey wife]2284-my wife . [I]66-godfrey have a natural claim on [her]146-eppie that must stand before every other . "[66-godfrey] [Eppie]146-eppie had given a violent start , and turned quite pale . [Silas]38-silas , on the contrary , who had been relieved , by [Eppie]146-eppie 's answer , from the dread lest [his]38-silas mind should be in opposition to [hers]146-eppie , felt the spirit of resistance in [him]38-silas set free , not without a touch of parental fierceness . " Then , [sir]2360-sir , "[38-silas] [he]38-silas answered , with an accent of bitterness that had been silent in [him]38-silas since the memorable day when [his]38-silas youthful hope had perished—"then , [sir]2360-sir , why did n't [you]2360-sir say so sixteen year ago , and claim [her]146-eppie before [I]38-silas 'd come to love [her]146-eppie , [i'stead]38-silas o ' coming to take [her]146-eppie from [me]38-silas now , when [you]2360-sir might as well take the heart out o ' [my]38-silas body ? [God]48-god gave [her]146-eppie to [me]38-silas because [you]2360-sir turned [your]2360-sir back upon [her]146-eppie , and [He]48-god looks upon [her]146-eppie as [mine]38-silas : [you]2360-sir 've no right to [her]146-eppie ! When [a man]185-a man turns a blessing from [his]185-a man door , it falls to [them]185-a man as take it in . "[38-silas] " [I]66-godfrey know that , [Marner]38-silas . [I]66-godfrey was wrong . [I]66-godfrey 've repented of [my]66-godfrey conduct in that matter , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , who could not help feeling the edge of [Silas]38-silas 's words . " [I]38-silas 'm glad to hear it , [sir]2360-sir , "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , with gathering excitement ; " but repentance does n't alter what 's been going on for sixteen year . [Your]2360-sir coming now and saying ' [I]38-silas 'm [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father ' does n't alter the feelings inside [us]3107-us . "[38-silas] " But [I]66-godfrey think [you]38-silas might look at the thing more reasonably , [Marner]38-silas , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , unexpectedly awed by [the weaver]209-the weaver 's direct truth - speaking . " It is n't as if [she]146-eppie was to be taken quite away from [you]38-silas , so that [you]38-silas 'd never see [her]146-eppie again . [She]146-eppie 'll be very near [you]38-silas , and come to see [you]38-silas very often . [She]146-eppie 'll feel just the same towards [you]38-silas . "[66-godfrey] " Just the same ? "[38-silas] said [Marner]38-silas , more bitterly than ever . " How 'll [she]146-eppie feel just the same for [me]38-silas as [she]146-eppie does now , when [we]3109-we eat o ' the same bit , and drink o ' the same cup , and think o ' the same things from one day 's end to another ? Just the same ? that 's idle talk . [You]66-godfrey 'd cut [us]3109-we [i]38-silas ' two . "[38-silas] [Godfrey]66-godfrey , unqualified by experience to discern the pregnancy of [Marner]38-silas 's simple words , felt rather angry again . It seemed to [him]66-godfrey that [the weaver]209-the weaver was very selfish ( a judgment readily passed by those who have never tested [their]1940-their own power of sacrifice ) to oppose what was undoubtedly for [Eppie]146-eppie 's welfare ; and [he]66-godfrey felt [himself]66-godfrey called upon , for [her]146-eppie sake , to assert [his]66-godfrey authority . " [I]66-godfrey should have thought , [Marner]38-silas , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said , severely—"I should have thought [your]38-silas affection for [Eppie]146-eppie would have made [you]38-silas rejoice in what was for [her]146-eppie good , even if it did call upon [you]38-silas to give up something . [You]38-silas ought to remember that [your]38-silas own life is uncertain , and that [she]146-eppie 's at an age now when [her]146-eppie lot may soon be fixed in a way very different from what it would be in [[[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father 's home]3111-her father 's home : [she]146-eppie may marry [some low working - man]3112-some low working - man , and then , whatever [I]66-godfrey might do for [her]146-eppie , [I]66-godfrey could n't make [her]146-eppie well - off . [You]38-silas 're putting [yourself]38-silas in the way of [her]146-eppie welfare ; and though [I]66-godfrey 'm sorry to hurt [you]38-silas after what [you]38-silas 've done , and what [I]66-godfrey 've left undone , [I]66-godfrey feel now it 's [my]66-godfrey duty to insist on taking care of [[my]66-godfrey own daughter]3113-my own daughter . [I]66-godfrey want to do [my]66-godfrey duty . "[66-godfrey] It would be difficult to say whether it were [Silas]38-silas or [Eppie]146-eppie that was most deeply stirred by this last speech of [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's . [Thought]53-thought had been very busy in [Eppie]146-eppie as [she]146-eppie listened to the contest between [[her]146-eppie old long - loved father]1941-her old long - loved father and [this new unfamiliar father who had suddenly come to fill the place of that black featureless shadow which had held the ring and placed it on [[her]146-eppie mother]2585-her mother 's finger]1942-this new unfamiliar father who had suddenly come to fill the place of that black featureless shadow which had held the ring and placed it on her mother 's finger . [Her]146-eppie imagination had darted backward in conjectures , and forward in previsions , of what this revealed fatherhood implied ; and there were words in [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's last speech which helped to make the previsions especially definite . Not that these thoughts , either of past or future , determined [her]146-eppie resolution — that was determined by the feelings which vibrated to every word [Silas]38-silas had uttered ; but they raised , even apart from these feeling , a repulsion towards [the offered lot]1944-the offered lot and [the newly - revealed father]1945-the newly - revealed father . [Silas]38-silas , on the other hand , was again stricken in conscience , and alarmed lest [Godfrey]66-godfrey 's accusation should be true — lest [he]38-silas should be raising [his]38-silas own will as an obstacle to [Eppie]146-eppie 's good . For many moments [he]38-silas was mute , struggling for the self - conquest necessary to the uttering of the difficult words . They came out tremulously . " [I]38-silas 'll say no more . Let it be as [you]38-silas will . Speak to [the child]451-the child . [I]38-silas 'll hinder nothing . "[38-silas] Even [Nancy]67-nancy , with all the acute sensibility of [her]67-nancy own affections , shared [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's view , that [Marner]38-silas was not justifiable in [his]38-silas wish to retain [Eppie]146-eppie , after [[her]146-eppie real father]1947-her real father had avowed [himself]38-silas . [She]67-nancy felt that it was a very hard trial for [the poor weaver]1948-the poor weaver , but [her]67-nancy code allowed no question that [a father by blood]1949-a father by blood must have a claim above that of [any foster - father]1950-any foster - father . Besides , [Nancy]67-nancy , used all [her]67-nancy life to plenteous circumstances and the privileges of " respectability , "[67-nancy] could not enter into the pleasures which early nurture and habit connect with all the little aims and efforts of [the poor who are born poor]1951-the poor who are born poor : to [her]67-nancy mind , [Eppie]146-eppie , in being restored to [her]146-eppie birthright , was entering on a too long with - held but unquestionable good . Hence [she]146-eppie heard [Silas]38-silas 's last words with relief , and thought , as [Godfrey]66-godfrey did , that [their]1952-we wish was achieved . " [Eppie]146-eppie , [[my]66-godfrey dear]2469-my dear , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , looking at [[his]66-godfrey daughter]2418-his daughter , not without some embarrassment , under the sense that [she]146-eppie was old enough to judge [him]66-godfrey , " it 'll always be [our]1952-we wish that [you]146-eppie should show [your]146-eppie love and gratitude to one who 's been [a father]1788-a father to [you]146-eppie so many years , and [we]1952-we shall want to help [you]146-eppie to make [him]66-godfrey comfortable in every way . But [we]1952-we hope [you]146-eppie 'll come to love [us]1952-we as well ; and though [I]146-eppie have n't been what [a father]1788-a father should have been to [you]146-eppie all these years , [I]146-eppie wish to do the utmost in [my]146-eppie power for [you]146-eppie for the rest of [my]146-eppie life , and provide for [you]146-eppie as [[my]146-eppie only child]3118-my only child . And [you]146-eppie 'll have the best of [mothers]213-mothers in [[my]146-eppie wife]2284-my wife — that'll be a blessing [you]146-eppie have n't known since [you]146-eppie were old enough to know it . "[146-eppie] " [[My]67-nancy dear]2469-my dear , [you]146-eppie 'll be a treasure to [me]67-nancy , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , in [her]67-nancy gentle voice . " [We]3122-we shall want for nothing when [we]3122-we have [[our]3122-we daughter]3123-our daughter . "[67-nancy] [Eppie]146-eppie did not come forward and curtsy , as [she]146-eppie had done before . [She]146-eppie held [Silas]38-silas 's hand in [hers]146-eppie , and grasped it firmly — it was [a weaver]443-a weaver 's hand , with a palm and finger - tips that were sensitive to such pressure — while [she]146-eppie spoke with colder decision than before . " Thank [you]38-silas , [ma'am]2521-ma'am — thank [you]38-silas , [sir]2360-sir , for [your]38-silas offers — they're very great , and far above [my]146-eppie wish . For [I]146-eppie should have no delight [i]146-eppie ' life any more if [I]146-eppie was forced to go away from [[my]146-eppie father]2068-my father , and knew [he]2068-my father was sitting at [home]374-home , a - thinking of [me]146-eppie and feeling lone . And [he]2068-my father 's took care of [me]146-eppie and loved [me]146-eppie from the first , and [I]146-eppie 'll cleave to [him]2068-my father as long as [he]2068-my father lives , and [nobody]444-nobody shall ever come between [him]2068-my father and [me]146-eppie . "[146-eppie] " But [you]146-eppie must make sure , [Eppie]146-eppie , "[38-silas] said [Silas]38-silas , in a low voice—"you must make sure as [you]146-eppie wo n't ever be sorry , because [you]146-eppie 've made [your]146-eppie choice to stay among [poor folks]2844-poor folks , and with poor clothes and things , when [you]146-eppie might ha ' had everything o ' the best . "[38-silas] [His]38-silas sensitiveness on this point had increased as [he]38-silas listened to [Eppie]146-eppie 's words of faithful affection . " [I]146-eppie can never be sorry , [father]2569-father , "[146-eppie] said [Eppie]146-eppie . " [I]146-eppie should n't know what to think on or to wish for with fine things about [me]146-eppie , as [I]146-eppie have n't been used to . What could [I]146-eppie care for then ? "[146-eppie] [Nancy]67-nancy looked at [Godfrey]66-godfrey with a pained questioning glance . But [his]66-godfrey eyes were fixed on the floor , where [he]66-godfrey was moving the end of [his]66-godfrey stick , as if [he]66-godfrey were pondering on something absently . " What [you]66-godfrey say is natural , [[my]67-nancy dear child]2948-my dear child — it 's natural [you]66-godfrey should cling to those who 've brought [you]66-godfrey up , "[67-nancy] [she]67-nancy said , mildly ; " but there 's a duty [you]66-godfrey owe to [[your]66-godfrey lawful father]3138-your lawful father . "[67-nancy] " [I]146-eppie ca n't feel as [I]146-eppie 've got [any father]3141-any father but one , "[146-eppie] said [Eppie]146-eppie , impetuously , while the tears gathered . " [I]146-eppie 've always thought of [a little home where [he]2520-your father 'd sit [i]146-eppie ' the corner , and [I]146-eppie should fend and do everything for [him]2520-your father]3142-a little home where he 'd sit i ' the corner , and i should fend and do everything for him : [I]146-eppie ca n't think o ' [no other home]3143-no other home . And , "[146-eppie] [she]146-eppie ended passionately , while the tears fell , " [I]146-eppie 'm promised to marry [a working man]3147-a working man , as 'll live with [father]2569-father , and help [me]146-eppie to take care of [him]2569-father . "[146-eppie] [Godfrey]66-godfrey looked up at [Nancy]67-nancy with a flushed face and a smarting dilation of the eyes . This frustration of a purpose towards which [he]66-godfrey had set out under the exalted consciousness that [he]66-godfrey was about to compensate in some degree for the greatest demerit of [his]66-godfrey life , made [him]66-godfrey feel the air of [the room]611-the room stifling . " Let [us]3149-we go , "[66-godfrey] [he]66-godfrey said , in an under - tone . " [We]3149-we wo n't talk of this any longer now , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , rising . " [We]3149-we 're [[your]66-godfrey well - wishers]3150-your well - wishers , [[my]67-nancy dear]2469-my dear — and [yours]66-godfrey too , [Marner]38-silas . [We]3149-we shall come and see [you]66-godfrey again . It 's getting late now . "[67-nancy] In this way [she]67-nancy covered [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband 's abrupt departure , for [Godfrey]66-godfrey had gone straight to the door , unable to say more . [Nancy]67-nancy and [Godfrey]66-godfrey walked [home]374-home under the starlight in silence . When [they]1958-we entered [the oaken parlour]1959-the oaken parlour , [Godfrey]66-godfrey threw [himself]66-godfrey into [his]66-godfrey chair , while [Nancy]67-nancy laid down [her]67-nancy bonnet and shawl , and stood on the hearth near [[her]67-nancy husband]2414-her husband , unwilling to leave [him]2414-her husband even for a few minutes , and yet fearing to utter any word lest it might jar on [his]2414-her husband feeling . At last [Godfrey]66-godfrey turned [his]66-godfrey head towards [her]67-nancy , and [their]1958-we eyes met , dwelling in that meeting without any movement on either side . That quiet mutual gaze of [a trusting husband]1961-a trusting husband and [wife]1907-wife is like the first moment of rest or refuge from a great weariness or a great danger — not to be interfered with by speech or action which would distract the sensations from the fresh enjoyment of repose . But presently [he]2414-her husband put out [his]2414-her husband hand , and as [Nancy]67-nancy placed [hers]67-nancy within it , [he]2414-her husband drew [her]67-nancy towards [him]2414-her husband , and said — " That 's ended ! "[2414-her husband] [She]67-nancy bent to kiss [him]2414-her husband , and then said , as [she]67-nancy stood by [his]2414-her husband side , " Yes , [I]67-nancy 'm afraid [we]1958-we must give up the hope of having [her]67-nancy for [a daughter]3088-a daughter . It would n't be right to want to force [her]67-nancy to come to [us]1958-we against [her]67-nancy will . [We]1958-we ca n't alter [her]67-nancy bringing up and what 's come of it . "[67-nancy] " No , "[66-godfrey] said [Godfrey]66-godfrey , with a keen decisiveness of tone , in contrast with [his]66-godfrey usually careless and unemphatic speech—"there 's debts [we]1958-we ca n't pay like money debts , by paying extra for the years that have slipped by . While [I]66-godfrey 've been putting off and putting off , the trees have been growing — it 's too late now . [Marner]38-silas was in the right in what [he]38-silas said about [a man]185-a man 's turning away a blessing from [his]38-silas door : it falls to [somebody else]739-somebody else . [I]66-godfrey wanted to pass for childless once , [Nancy]67-nancy — [I]66-godfrey shall pass for childless now against [my]66-godfrey wish . "[66-godfrey] [Nancy]67-nancy did not speak immediately , but after a little while [she]67-nancy asked—"You wo n't make it known , then , about [Eppie]146-eppie 's being [[your]66-godfrey daughter]3155-your daughter ? "[66-godfrey] " No — where would be the good to [anybody]263-anybody ? — only harm . [I]67-nancy must do what [I]67-nancy can for [her]146-eppie in the state of life [she]146-eppie chooses . [I]67-nancy must see who it is [she]146-eppie 's thinking of marrying . "[67-nancy] " If it wo n't do any good to make the thing known , "[67-nancy] said [Nancy]67-nancy , who thought [she]67-nancy might now allow [herself]67-nancy the relief of entertaining a feeling which [she]67-nancy had tried to silence before , " [I]67-nancy should be very thankful for [father]2569-father and [Priscilla]80-priscilla never to be troubled with knowing what was done in the past , more than about [Dunsey]104-dunsey : it ca n't be helped , [their]3158-their knowing that . "[67-nancy] " [I]66-godfrey shall put it in [my]66-godfrey will — [I]66-godfrey think [I]66-godfrey shall put it in [my]66-godfrey will . "[38-silas] So , on the fourth day from that time , [Silas]38-silas and [Eppie]146-eppie , in [their]1972-their Sunday clothes , with a small bundle tied in a blue linen handkerchief , were making [their]1972-their way through [the streets of [a great manufacturing town]1974-a great manufacturing town]1973-the streets of a great manufacturing town . "[38-silas] There was one time of the year which was held in [Raveloe]1-raveloe to be especially suitable for a wedding . It was when the great lilacs and laburnums in [the old - fashioned gardens]1996-the old - fashioned gardens showed [their]1997-their golden and purple wealth above the lichentinted walls , and when there were calves still young enough to want bucketfuls of fragrant milk . [People]387-people were not so busy then as [they]387-people must become when the full cheese - making and the mowing had set in ; and besides , it was a time when a light bridal dress could be worn with comfort and seen to advantage . Happily the sunshine fell more warmly than usual on the lilac tufts the morning that [Eppie]146-eppie was married , for [her]146-eppie dress was a very light one . [She]146-eppie had often thought , though with a feeling of renunciation , that the perfection of a wedding dress would be a white cotton , with the tiniest pink spring at wide intervals ; so that when [Mrs Godfrey Cass]151-mrs godfrey cass begged to provide one , and asked [Eppie]146-eppie to choose what it should be , previous meditation had enabled [her]146-eppie to give a decided answer at once . Seen at a little distance as [she]146-eppie walked across [the churchyard]1717-the churchyard and down [the village]247-the village , [she]146-eppie seemed to be attired in pure white , and [her]146-eppie hair looked like the dash of gold on a lily . One hand was on [[her]146-eppie husband]2414-her husband 's arm , and with the other [she]146-eppie clasped the hand of [[her]146-eppie father]1190-her father [Silas]38-silas . " [You]2414-her husband wo n't be giving [me]146-eppie away , [father]2569-father , "[146-eppie] [she]146-eppie had said before [they]2003-they went to [church]363-church ; " [you]2414-her husband 'll only be taking [Aaron]89-aaron to be [a son]2225-a son to [you]2414-her husband . "[146-eppie] [Dolly Winthrop]89-aaron walked behind with [[her]146-eppie husband]2414-her husband ; and there ended the little bridal procession . There were many eyes to look at it , and [Miss Priscilla Lammeter]80-priscilla was glad that [she]80-priscilla and [[her]80-priscilla father]1190-her father had happened to drive up to the door of [the Red House]533-the red house just in time to see this pretty sight . [They]2003-they had come to keep [Nancy]67-nancy company to - day , because [Mr Cass]66-godfrey had had to go away to [Lytherley]37-lytherley , for special reasons . That seemed to be a pity , for otherwise [he]66-godfrey might have gone , as [Mr Crackenthorp]86-mr crackenthorp and [Mr Osgood]59-mr osgood certainly would , to look on at the wedding - feast which [he]66-godfrey had ordered at [the Rainbow]4-the rainbow , naturally feeling a great interest in [the weaver who had been wronged by one of [[his]66-godfrey own family]1068-his own family]2008-the weaver who had been wronged by one of his own family . " [I]80-priscilla could ha ' wished [Nancy]67-nancy had had the luck to find [a child like that]3228-a child like that and bring [her]67-nancy up , "[80-priscilla] said [Priscilla]80-priscilla to [[her]80-priscilla father]1190-her father , as [they]2003-they sat in [the gig]2011-the gig ; " [I]80-priscilla should ha ' had something young to think of then , besides the lambs and the calves . "[80-priscilla] " Yes , [[my]81-mr lammeter dear]2469-my dear , yes , "[81-mr lammeter] said [Mr Lammeter]81-mr lammeter ; " one feels that as [one]2512-one gets older . Things look dim to [old folks]3231-old folks : [they]3231-old folks 'd need have some young eyes about ['em]3232-'em , to let ['em]3231-old folks know [the world]410-the world 's the same as it used to be . "[81-mr lammeter] [Nancy]67-nancy came out now to welcome [[her]67-nancy father]1190-her father and [sister]2013-sister ; and [the wedding group]2014-the wedding group had passed on beyond [the Red House]533-the red house to [the humbler part of [the village]247-the village]2016-the humbler part of the village . [Dolly Winthrop]113-dolly was the first to divine that [old Mr Macey , who had been set in [his]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door arm - chair outside [his]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door own door]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door , would expect some special notice as [they]2014-the wedding group passed , since [he]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door was too old to be at the wedding - feast . " [Mr Macey]41-mr macey 's looking for a word from [us]2014-the wedding group , "[113-dolly] said [Dolly]113-dolly ; " [he]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door 'll be hurt if [we]2014-the wedding group pass [him]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door and say nothing — and [him]2018-old mr macey , who had been set in his arm - chair outside his own door so racked with rheumatiz . "[113-dolly] So [they]2014-the wedding group turned aside to shake hands with [the old man]330-the old man . [He]330-the old man had looked forward to the occasion , and had [his]330-the old man premeditated speech . " Well , [Master Marner]42-master marner , "[330-the old man] [he]330-the old man said , in a voice that quavered a good deal , " [I]330-the old man 've lived to see [my]330-the old man words come true . [I]330-the old man was the first to say there was no harm in [you]42-master marner , though [your]42-master marner looks might be again ' [you]42-master marner ; and [I]330-the old man was the first to say [you]42-master marner 'd get [your]42-master marner money back . And its nothing but rightful as [you]42-master marner should . And [I]330-the old man 'd ha ' said [the ' Amens]3234-the ' amens , ' and willing , at the holy matrimony ; but [Tookey]84-tookey 's done it a good while now , and [I]330-the old man hope [you]42-master marner 'll have none the worse luck . "[330-the old man] In [the open yard]2020-the open yard before [the Rainbow]4-the rainbow , [the party of guests]2021-the party of guests were already assembled , though it was still nearly an hour before the appointed feast - time . But by this means [they]2021-the party of guests could not only enjoy the slow advent of [their]2021-the party of guests pleasure ; [they]2021-the party of guests had also ample leisure to talk of [Silas Marner]38-silas 's strange history , and arrive by due degrees at the conclusion that [he]38-silas had brought a blessing on [himself]38-silas by acting like [a father]1788-a father to [a lone motherless child]2023-a lone motherless child . [Even the farrier]2024-even the farrier did not negative this sentiment : on the contrary , [he]2024-even the farrier took it up as peculiarly [his]2024-even the farrier own , and invited [any hardy person present]2025-any hardy person present to contradict [him]2024-even the farrier . But [he]2024-even the farrier met with no contradiction ; and all differences among [the company]755-the company were merged in a general agreement with [Mr Snell]82-mr snell 's sentiment , that when [a man]185-a man had deserved [his]185-a man good luck , it was the part of [[his]185-a man neighbours]435-his neighbours to wish [him]185-a man joy . As [the bridal group]2029-the bridal group approached , a hearty cheer was raised in [the Rainbow yard]2030-the rainbow yard ; and [Ben Winthrop]87-ben winthrop , whose jokes had retained [their]2031-their acceptable flavour , found it agreeable to turn in [there]2073-there and receive congratulations ; not requiring the proposed interval of quiet at the Stonepits before joining [the company]755-the company . [Eppie]146-eppie had [a larger garden than [she]146-eppie had ever expected [there]2073-there now]2034-a larger garden than she had ever expected there now ; and in other ways there had been alterations at the expense of [Mr Cass]66-godfrey , [the landlord]761-the landlord , to suit [[Silas]38-silas 's larger family]2037-silas 's larger family . For [he]66-godfrey and [Eppie]146-eppie had declared that [they]2038-they would rather stay at [the Stone - pits]658-the stone - pits than go to [any new home]2040-any new home . [The garden]2830-the garden was fenced with stones on two sides , but in front there was an open fence , through which the flowers shone with answering gladness , as [the four united people]2042-the four united people came within sight of [them]2042-the four united people . " O [father]2569-father , "[146-eppie] said [Eppie]146-eppie , " what [a pretty home]3236-a pretty home [ours]2038-they is ! [I]146-eppie think [nobody]444-nobody could be happier than [we]2038-they are . "[146-eppie]
